Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Medior Data Analyst - Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

2 to 4 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.
You are based in or around Amsterdam




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
Hybrid way of working
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another

Show more

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Wil jij bijdragen aan het meest toonaangevende mediaonderzoek van Nederland, samen met een hecht en internationaal team dat dagelijks werkt aan innovatieve projecten?




Bij Kantar Media Nederland zijn we op zoek naar een projectmanager/data-analist mediaonderzoek. Wij zijn verantwoordelijk voor diverse onderdelen van het Nationaal MediaOnderzoek (NMO), waaronder NMO Kijken, NMO Online en de werving voor NMO Luisteren. Binnen deze projecten meten we het mediagedrag van de Nederlandse bevolking via verschillende kanalen: televisie, online video en online platforms (websites & apps). Deze gegevens zijn essentieel voor het bepalen van het bereik en de waarde van media in Nederland.

Als project manager/ data-analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van de datastromen, het analyseren van resultaten, en het adviseren van klanten op basis van deze inzichten. Je maakt deel uit van het Client Service Team en werkt daarbij nauw samen met collega’s in binnen- en buitenland. Je komt terecht in een internationaal georiënteerd team met een open en analytische cultuur, waar ruimte is voor eigen initiatief en ontwikkeling. Binnen Kantar Media zijn er volop kansen om je verder te ontwikkelen in de richting van data science, consultancy of projectleiding.







Wat wij van jou verwachten

Voorbereiden (klant)presentaties voor de NMO-projecten op basis van data-inzichten
Kwaliteitscontrole op datasets en rapportages (wekelijks en maandelijks)
Adviseren van klanten op basis van data-analyse
Analyseren van onderzoeksuitkomsten in SPSS en R
Ad-hoc analyses en troubleshooting bij datavraagstukken
Testen van meetinstrumenten en online content
Samenwerken met internationale collega’s over panelmanagement en dataverwerking
Deelnemen aan klantmeetings (in het Nederlands) en projectoverleggen




Wat wij van jou verwachten

Afgeronde universitaire opleiding met onderzoekskennis
Affiniteit met mediaonderzoek (tv, online video, online, audio)
Kennis van websites, apps en web analytics
Ervaring met SPSS, Excel en bij voorkeur R
Ervaring met of interesse in aanleren van AI tools voor o.a. data-analyses (zoals Co-Pilot)
Ervaring met Databricks en Power BI is een pré
Vermogen om data te vertalen naar begrijpelijke inzichten
Flexibele werkhouding en nauwkeurigheid
Startersfunctie: je staat aan het begin van je carrière en bent leergierig
Proactief kunnen signaleren van datakwaliteitsproblemen
Communicatief sterk (voor klantcontact en samenwerking met internationale teams)
Projectmatig kunnen werken / time management
Goede beheersing van Nederlands en Engels
Beschikbaarheid van minimaal 4 dagen per week
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role Overview




As a Junior Data Quality Analyst, you will play an essential role in delivering high-quality, actionable risk insights to clients. You will be responsible for analyzing, assessing, and improving the quality of large-scale textual datasets that fuel an AI-driven risk monitoring platform. Working closely with the product, data science, and engineering teams, you will help ensure that clients receive accurate, relevant, and timely data to support their decision-making processes.




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and optimize queries for entity matching, entity disambiguation, and event classification to improve data accuracy and relevance.
Perform ongoing data quality assessments and audits to detect and resolve anomalies, inconsistencies, and gaps within complex datasets.
Collaborate with clients to understand their data needs and ensure delivered insights meet quality and business requirements.
Develop and maintain scripts and tools to automate data validation workflows and improve efficiency.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot data issues and support product enhancements.




Requirements

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or related technical field.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL, with experience in data querying and manipulation.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
Ability to clearly communicate complex data challenges and solutions to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Comfortable working collaboratively with diverse teams including engineers, data scientists, and client-facing colleagues.




Salary Package:

Up to €50,000
Flexible Hybrid working
Pension Plan
Clear career path

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about transforming raw data into powerful insights that drive real business decisions? We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and help shape the way we understand and act on data.




🔍 What You’ll Do:

Collect, clean, and analyze structured and unstructured data from various sources.
Develop dashboards and reports to monitor key performance metrics.
Translate complex datasets into actionable insights to support strategy, operations, and product development.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product, Marketing, Finance, etc.) to identify trends and inform decision-making.
Present findings clearly to stakeholders at all levels of the business.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a data Analyst, First and foremost, your primary mission will be to unravel and understand the complete customer journey. With experiences that touch so many different product teams, it's challenging to see the whole picture. You will be tasked with answering fundamental questions: How do our customers flow from initial inspiration to a final appointment booking? Where are the key friction points and drop-offs in this process? What features and interactions are most critical for success? You will help us define what a successful E2E experience truly looks like, moving beyond siloed metrics to a holistic view of customer success.
Second, you will be the analytical engine behind our optimization efforts. To improve these complex journeys, we need to experiment and learn continuously. You will be at the heart of this process, supporting the design and analysis of A/B tests to validate new ideas and features. Furthermore, you will conduct market-per-market comparisons to understand regional differences in customer behavior, helping us identify what works best in specific markets and what learnings can be scaled globally. A key part of this will be proactively defining what "unsuccessful" looks like, creating clear signals for the team when an experience is not meeting its goals.
Finally, you will translate your findings into actionable insights for the entire organization. Your ability to build clear, compelling, and insightful dashboards will be crucial. These tools will not only track the performance of our E2E experiences but will also empower product teams with the data they need to make informed decisions daily. By making the data accessible and understandable, you will help us see how all the different pieces of the puzzle are coming together to create a seamless and successful journey for our customers.




Beyond your immediate team, you will join a vital cross-functional community of data analysts who are embedded in the various product teams that contribute to the end-to-end customer journey (e.g., product discovery, in-store appointment booking, etc.). This unique setup is essential for your success. It ensures you have a network of colleagues to build a cohesive analytical narrative, connecting the dots across different parts of the customer experience. You will learn from their insights, share your findings, and collectively solve the challenge of understanding our complex E2E journeys.




Requirements:




Must: analytical skills, SQL, good stakeholder management, knowledge/experience on customer journeys or funnels
Nice: experience with GCP, BigQuery, Python (Notebooks), familiar in an FMCG of retail sector, eager to learn, familiar in an eCommerce environment, experience with companies that have both an online and offline sales channel, experience with co-worker facing front-ends
Analytical skills, knowledge/experience on customer journeys or funnels, good stakeholder management
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a leading organization in the Life Sciences industry, is looking for a Clinical Trial Data Analyst to strengthen their clinical operations team. This position plays a pivotal role in enhancing how clinical trials are designed, planned, and monitored, ensuring each study is strategically positioned for success using a data-driven approach. You will collaborate closely with study teams to turn complex datasets into actionable insights that guide location targeting, patient recruitment, and site performance.




Key Responsibilities:




Provide analytical expertise to support trial planning, with a strong focus on location strategy and patient population targeting.
Develop and maintain tools, models, and databases that facilitate the interpretation of large-scale data relevant to trial feasibility and operational performance.
Collaborate cross-functionally to translate data outputs into practical insights for clinical teams.
Conduct analyses using real-world data sources such as EHR and medical claims to support decision-making in study design and site selection.
Apply advanced modeling techniques, including probabilistic simulations, to evaluate potential trial outcomes.
Present findings clearly using high-impact visuals and summaries tailored to clinical and non-technical audiences.
Leverage internal and external clinical data platforms to support performance analytics and study optimization.




Required Qualifications:




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field (equivalent practical experience also considered).
Minimum of 5 years' experience in clinical trial analytics or operations, ideally within a pharmaceutical or CRO environment.
Proven track record in feasibility studies, site selection analytics, and performance monitoring in clinical trials.
Strong knowledge of clinical research processes and regulatory frameworks.
Proficiency in Python and SQL for data manipulation, aggregation, and analysis.
Advanced skills in Excel for modeling and data visualization; confident presenter with PowerPoint.
Familiarity with real-world healthcare data (EHR, claims) and clinical trial databases such as Citeline is a plus.
Experience in using simulation techniques such as Monte Carlo to assess multivariable outcomes.




Can this role be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send your CV and contact information to g.andrade@panda-int.com, and we will be in touch for a conversation.




Position: Clinical Trial Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Contract: 6 months

Start Date: Asap

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Fintech – Utrecht




Are you interested in working with huge financial datasets? And are you interested in translating this to the business in order to make the landscape more data-driven? Read on!




Keywords: Python, SQL, Azure, PowerBI




Our client is a dominant financial institution in the Netherlands, covering components in insurance, mortgages, and investments. The company is in full transformation, becoming a financial institution of the future – part of this transformation is the migration of all services/applications to the public cloud.




They are looking for a data analyst who will analyze data from financial sources like pensions, mortgages, and investments. All this data needs to be cleaned and translated to the business through dashboards.




If you are someone with a technical background that also likes to see the bigger picture of how data can be used in a big fintech organization, you are at the right place. They are looking for someone that also likes to challenge and interact with business stakeholders.




Required skills:

At least 8+ years of professional experience and extensive experience in data analytics.
Experience with SQL.
Experience with cloud and tools like PowerBI is a plus.
Strong communication skills in either Dutch or English.




Benefits:

Up to 80K base salary including holiday allowance based on 38 hours.
13th month.
VISA sponsorship.
3% salary raise yearly if that fits the scale.
Pension scheme.
Healthcare insurance contribution.
Insurance discounts.
Participating in employee share plan.
Working from home allowance.
Trainings.
Travel reimbursement / NS Business Card.
Partly paid sabbatical every 5 years.
Hybrid setup – 2 days office.




Focus is on candidates in the Netherlands.




Interested? Please contact me at mette@doghouse-recruitment.nl

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst at EQOM




Requirements

Over 4 years of experience
In a commercial, fast-paced organization
Solid knowledge of SQL and experience with dbt, Databricks, Power BI, and Python
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Located in the Netherlands




EQOM Group is a major force in Europe’s sexual wellness industry. As the company continues to professionalize and grow, data plays an increasingly vital role. The Data Analyst helps unlock the full potential of data, translating it into actionable insights and practical solutions to create value and support the shift towards a more data-driven way of working.




About EQOM Group

In the fast-paced and competitive world of sexual wellness, EQOM Group stands out as one of Europe’s most prominent and rapidly expanding names. Its portfolio includes a range of well-known consumer brands such as EasyToys, Christine le Duc, Amorelie, Kondomeriet, and Beate Uhse. The group was formed in 2020 through the merger of EDC Retail – a European market leader known for EasyToys – and wholesale distributor Eropartner. Backed by private equity firm Waterland, EQOM accelerated its growth by acquiring Christine le Duc in the Netherlands, Kondomeriet and Nytelse in Norway, and Amorelie in Germany.




In subsequent years, the group further expanded its footprint across Europe. Today, EQOM serves customers in more than sixty countries. While the majority of sales take place online, several retail chains – such as Kruidvat, Etos, and Hema in the Netherlands – have also started to offer EQOM products.




Mission: become the market leader

At present, EQOM employs 360 people and generates approximately 160 million euros in annual revenue. The group is embarking on a new phase centered on further professionalization and operational alignment, guided by a clear ambition: to establish itself as the market leader in the sexual wellness industry.




Vacancy: Data Analyst

Recognizing the vital role data plays in the company’s success, EQOM Group is strengthening its Data Team with several data analysts who combine technical expertise, business understanding, and interpersonal skills. This team serves as a center of excellence for data professionals, driving high-quality analysis and insights. The Data Analyst contributes by developing data models, creating visualizations with PowerBI, uncovering meaningful insights, and delivering practical solutions that improve decision-making across departments including e-commerce, logistics, finance, sales, and purchasing – serving both B2B and B2C operations.




However, real impact arises from understanding what the business truly needs. The Data Analyst should apply interpersonal skills to listen carefully, interpret insights, and challenge colleagues to explore new perspectives on how data can generate value beyond traditional dashboards.

Reporting to the Head of Data, the Data Analyst works with tools such as Databricks, Power BI, and dbt to build data pipelines, model data, and generate analytical insights. The immediate focus lies on strengthening the current setup to make it more effective and robust. At the same time, ongoing improvements in how EQOM Group supports its customers lead to new data streams and formats that will need to be integrated moving forward.




“EQOM’s data maturity is still evolving – making this the perfect moment to join. Every contribution is immediately visible and makes a tangible difference. For a data expert who thrives on building, connecting, and solving, this role offers the chance to help a company take huge steps forward.” – Ronald van den Berg, CFO




The ideal candidate is a curious and motivated professional who knows how to ask the right questions, even when problems are not yet clearly defined. Seniority is measured less by years of experience, but more by a demonstrated track record of using data effectively to create value and drive business growth. Equally important is the ability to build strong relationships with colleagues and earn their trust, both in the role and in the power of data. To foster these connections, spending time on-site in Veendam – ideally at least once every two weeks – is an essential part of the role.




Interested?

EQOM Group is working with Top of Minds to fill this vacancy.

Show more
HTML:
Data Analyst at EQOM


Requirements

  • Over 4 years of experience
  • In a commercial, fast-paced organization
  • Solid knowledge of SQL and experience with dbt, Databricks, Power BI, and Python
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Located in the Netherlands


EQOM Group is a major force in Europe’s sexual wellness industry. As the company continues to professionalize and grow, data plays an increasingly vital role. The Data Analyst helps unlock the full potential of data, translating it into actionable insights and practical solutions to create value and support the shift towards a more data-driven way of working.


About EQOM Group

In the fast-paced and competitive world of sexual wellness, EQOM Group stands out as one of Europe’s most prominent and rapidly expanding names. Its portfolio includes a range of well-known consumer brands such as EasyToys, Christine le Duc, Amorelie, Kondomeriet, and Beate Uhse. The group was formed in 2020 through the merger of EDC Retail – a European market leader known for EasyToys – and wholesale distributor Eropartner. Backed by private equity firm Waterland, EQOM accelerated its growth by acquiring Christine le Duc in the Netherlands, Kondomeriet and Nytelse in Norway, and Amorelie in Germany.


In subsequent years, the group further expanded its footprint across Europe. Today, EQOM serves customers in more than sixty countries. While the majority of sales take place online, several retail chains – such as Kruidvat, Etos, and Hema in the Netherlands – have also started to offer EQOM products.


Mission: become the market leader

At present, EQOM employs 360 people and generates approximately 160 million euros in annual revenue. The group is embarking on a new phase centered on further professionalization and operational alignment, guided by a clear ambition: to establish itself as the market leader in the sexual wellness industry.


Vacancy: Data Analyst

Recognizing the vital role data plays in the company’s success, EQOM Group is strengthening its Data Team with several data analysts who combine technical expertise, business understanding, and interpersonal skills. This team serves as a center of excellence for data professionals, driving high-quality analysis and insights. The Data Analyst contributes by developing data models, creating visualizations with PowerBI, uncovering meaningful insights, and delivering practical solutions that improve decision-making across departments including e-commerce, logistics, finance, sales, and purchasing – serving both B2B and B2C operations.


However, real impact arises from understanding what the business truly needs. The Data Analyst should apply interpersonal skills to listen carefully, interpret insights, and challenge colleagues to explore new perspectives on how data can generate value beyond traditional dashboards.

Reporting to the Head of Data, the Data Analyst works with tools such as Databricks, Power BI, and dbt to build data pipelines, model data, and generate analytical insights. The immediate focus lies on strengthening the current setup to make it more effective and robust. At the same time, ongoing improvements in how EQOM Group supports its customers lead to new data streams and formats that will need to be integrated moving forward.


“EQOM’s data maturity is still evolving – making this the perfect moment to join. Every contribution is immediately visible and makes a tangible difference. For a data expert who thrives on building, connecting, and solving, this role offers the chance to help a company take huge steps forward.” – Ronald van den Berg, CFO


The ideal candidate is a curious and motivated professional who knows how to ask the right questions, even when problems are not yet clearly defined. Seniority is measured less by years of experience, but more by a demonstrated track record of using data effectively to create value and drive business growth. Equally important is the ability to build strong relationships with colleagues and earn their trust, both in the role and in the power of data. To foster these connections, spending time on-site in Veendam – ideally at least once every two weeks – is an essential part of the role.


Interested?

EQOM Group is working with Top of Minds to fill this vacancy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are a Global Recruitment specialist that provides support to the clients across EMEA, APAC, US and Canada. We have an excellent job opportunity for you.




Role Title: Data Analyst

Location: Remote/Amsterdam, NL

Duration: till Jan-2026




Description:

Background As a data analyst, you will be a key partner for the teams pioneering our Home Imagination capabilities. Your focus will be on the critical end-to-end (E2E) customer experiences.
First and foremost, your primary mission will be to unravel and understand the complete customer journey.
Second, you will be the analytical engine behind our optimization efforts. To improve these complex journeys, we need to experiment and learn continuously. You will be at the heart of this process, supporting the design and analysis of A/B tests to validate new ideas and features. Furthermore, you will conduct market-per-market comparisons to understand regional differences in customer behavior, helping us identify what works best in specific markets and what learnings can be scaled globally. A key part of this will be proactively defining what "unsuccessful" looks like, creating clear signals for the team when an experience is not meeting its goals.
Finally, you will translate your findings into actionable insights for the entire organization. Your ability to build clear, compelling, and insightful dashboards will be crucial. These tools will not only track the performance of our E2E experiences but will also empower product teams with the data they need to make informed decisions daily. By making the data accessible and understandable.
The scope of the consultant services is to assist *** in The majority of your work will be embedded within the teams developing our Home Imagination capabilities. Like most digital teams at ***, you will work within a PEDX (Product, Engineering, Data, eXperience) structure, collaborating daily with product managers, engineers, and designers to drive the customer experience forward.
Beyond your immediate team, you will join a vital cross-functional community of data analysts who are embedded in the various product teams that contribute to the end-to-end customer journey (e.g., product discovery, in-store appointment booking, etc.).

Requirements:

Desired knowledge, experience, competence, skills etc Must: analytical skills, SQL, good stakeholder management, knowledge/experience on customer journeys or funnels




Skills required:

Experience with GCP, BigQuery, Python (Notebooks), familiar in an FMCG of retail sector, eager to learn, familiar in an eCommerce environment, experience with companies that have both an online and offline sales channel, experience with co-worker facing front-ends

If you are interested in this position and would like to learn more, please send through your CV and we will get in touch with you as soon as possible. Please note, candidates are often Shortlisted within 48 hours.

Title: Business / Data Analyst
Description:
Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.

Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.

Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.

Be a productive member of the team.





Requirements


Develop comprehensive business cases and perform stakeholder analyses to align data initiatives with organizational goals.

Create, manage, and maintain data dictionaries and business glossaries to ensure consistent data usage and understanding.

Analyze, normalize, and optimize database structures for improved performance and data integrity.

Support the design and rollout of data governance frameworks and policies.

Provide expert guidance on data quality, data architecture, and data reusability best practices.

Design and deliver insightful reports and dashboards to facilitate data-driven decision-making.

Contribute to change management and continuous improvement initiatives across multiple projects.

Minimum HBO+ (Bachelor’s level or higher) working and thinking level.

Extensive experience as a Business Analyst or Data Analyst.

Demonstrated success in developing and implementing data governance frameworks.

In-depth knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM), data modeling, and translating complex business requirements into actionable solutions.

Strong stakeholder engagement and relationship-building skills.

Proficiency with tools such as Power BI, SQL, and SAP ERP.

Familiarity with methodologies including Agile/Scrum, PMBOK, and DMBOK.

Experience analyzing and optimizing information flows, preferably in supply chain or retail environments.

Experience supporting organizational change and transformation initiatives.

Understanding of data architecture in educational institutions.

Knowledge of reporting and dashboard development standards.

Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.

Results-driven with a proactive mindset.

Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.

High level of organizational awareness and sensitivity.

Influential and persuasive, with a collaborative team-oriented approach.




Benefits


A challenging, innovating environment.

Opportunities for learning where needed.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Nederlands is vereist)

Amsterdam, Nederland

Tot €45.000 + benefits




Wil jij onderdeel worden van een divers data team dat zich onderscheid op de retail markt doormiddel van een eigen platform? Word de nieuwe data / business analist en sluit je aan bij een snelgroeiend retail – technologie bedijf.




Het bedrijf

Het bedrijf werkt met uiteenlopende retail relaties en voorziet retailers van klantinzichten en oplossingen doormiddel van data. Een snelgroeiend bedrijf met een multidisciplinair team om hard mee aan de slag te gaan aan het platform.




De Rol:

Als Data Analist ga je binnen het bedrijf aan de slag met data inrichting en beheer van een retail-analytics platform, waarbij je een cruciale rol kunt spelen bij business bevorderingen van de klant. Wat meer informatie wat betreft de rol:




Het aanleveren van analyses en inzichten intern en voor de klant
Support bij ad hoc analytische klant aanvragen
Inrichten en beheer van data en data – bronnen
Het opzetten van pipelines, en een bijdrage leveren aan het inrichten van dashboards en data solutions.
Bewaken van data kwaliteit.
Communiceren met retail-klanten ter bevordering van de business.




Expertise

Ervaring met Python, R, SQL, en meer
Uitstekende communicatie vaardigheden
Een innovatieve mindset die bijdragen aan verdere ontwikkelingen binnen het bedrijf
retail ervaring is een plus




The Benefits

Een passend salaris bij ervaring en achtergrond
30 vakantie dagen
Laptop / telefoon vergoeding
Een pensioen regeling




Interesse? Reageer doormiddel van het sturen van je CV via de knop naar Elisabeth Oudman.

Title: Senior Data Analytics & Power BI Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Analytics & Power BI Analyst to lead data-driven workforce planning and financial analytics at our client in the Hague. This role centers on advanced data manipulation, integration, and interpretation to deliver strategic insights that drive business decisions.




You will be responsible for managing complex datasets from multiple sources, creating automated analytics workflows, and developing dynamic (Power BI) dashboards that provide clear, actionable insights into workforce metrics and financial performance. Your expertise will directly influence workforce strategy by enabling accurate forecasting, cost analysis, and predictive analytics.




Key Responsibilities:

1. Advanced Data Analytics & Reporting

Extract, clean, transform, and integrate large datasets from internal HR systems (e.g., SAP SuccessFactors), finance platforms, and external labour market sources to enable comprehensive analysis.
Develop, automate, and maintain robust (Power BI) dashboards and reports to visualize workforce and financial data with high accuracy and user accessibility.
Utilize advanced Excel techniques including automation, macros, and complex formulas to complement data workflows.
Perform deep-dive analyses to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities in workforce supply, demand, cost drivers, and financial performance.
Implement predictive analytics models to forecast workforce needs, turnover risks, skill gaps, and financial impacts.
Translate complex data findings into clear, concise insights and recommendations tailored for both technical and business stakeholders.




2. Financial Analytics & Workforce Planning Integration

Collaborate closely with Finance, HR and Strategic Workforce Planning teams to align workforce data analytics with budgeting, headcount, and cost management processes.
Support labour cost forecasting and scenario modelling by integrating workforce metrics with financial data.
Provide analytical support for workforce-related business cases, cost optimization initiatives, and strategic planning.
Monitor key financial KPIs and workforce performance indicators to inform decision-making and highlight areas for improvement.




3. Stakeholder Collaboration & Advisory

Act as a data analytics advisor to HR, finance, and business leaders, providing expert interpretation of workforce and financial data.
Partner with organisational design, HR and corporatestrategy teams to ensure data-driven insights support organisational development and talent strategies.
Maintain data quality, governance, and security standards to ensure reliability and compliance.




Qualifications and Skills:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Finance, Business Intelligence, Economics, or related field.
8+ years of experience in data analytics with a strong focus on workforce and financial data.
Expert proficiency in Excel and Power BI, including data modeling, DAX, Power Query, and dashboard design.
Demonstrated success in developing predictive models and performing scenario analysis.
Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical rigor with the ability to translate complex analytics into actionable business insights.
Exceptional communication and consulting skills.
Experience with workforce planning concepts (5 Bs and 7 Rights) and HR analytics.
Background in HR or close collaboration with HR teams is highly desirable.
Exposure to generative AI tools and their application in workforce analytics is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst - Klantdata
Description:
For the Customer View in Order project, we are looking for a data analyst. The aim of this project is to put the customer and stakeholder administration in order and to register customers unambiguously. Improving data quality is essential to, among other things, better facilitate Flex processes and create an integrated customer view. In this way, we ensure that everyone within our organization has the correct, relevant information.

The project roughly consists of two parts:


Process and system adjustments to prevent data pollution and secure data management.
Data cleaning actions to solve existing data pollution.
For the second part, we are looking for extra capacity in the form of a data analyst. This person must be able to independently analyze large amounts of data and, in consultation with project colleagues and stakeholders, make proposals for data cleaning actions, including prioritization.

Required expertise:


Experience with Power BI, SQL, MS Access and proficient in Excel.
Affinity with data analysis.
Able to interpret data and translate it into (cleaning) proposals, with an eye for the business value and priority.
Being able to work with raw data, since not all relevant data is (yet) available in BI.
Experience with SAP C/4 and SAP S/4 is an advantage.
Examples of concrete data analyses:


Contact Analytics: What data has been captured and what is its quality?
Analysis of Chamber of Commerce data in C/4 and, as soon as available, preparation for enrichment of data in C/4 and S/4.
Assessing the data quality and consistency of customer data attributes.
Customer vs. individual vs. contact analytics.
Comparison of data (differences) between C/4 and S/4.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your Tasks

Role

At MediaMarkt, we believe in innovation, growth, and freedom. As a dynamic company, we want to offer our customers the best shopping experience by placing data at the center of our operations. If you are looking for a fast-changing environment where you can make immediate and big impact using business intelligence, reporting, statistical analysis and machine learning, then this job is for you! In our Data & Analytics team, we are looking for a Data Analyst. The role includes:


Create and maintain an information infrastructure to empower organizational teams with data-driven insights for optimizing processes and business decision-making.
Data Analysis and Modeling: Analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Develop and implement predictive models and machine learning algorithms. Perform statistical analyses to support business decision-making.
Data Collection & Organization: Collaborate with internal teams and data engineers to identify relevant datasets, gather data from various sources (sales, inventory, customer feedback, market research, external providers), and develop & maintain a structured tables for easy access and analysis.
Data Visualization & Reporting: Create and maintain appealing reports and dashboards in Power BI to facilitate data-driven decision-making. Create compelling data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders. Develop dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Present data insights in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences.
Data Products / Solutions: Develop scalable data products to address business challenges, achieve process optimization or improve decision making. Build and implement tools to enable business lines to maximize the value of insights and reports.
Requirements Gathering: Partner with organizational teams to understand their business needs and translate them into actionable data product/reporting proposals that scale across business lines and improve decision-making processes.
Collaboration and Support: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs, provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. Support data scientists and data engineers with data analysis, dashboarding and visualizations
Research and Development: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Experiment with new tools, techniques, and methodologies to improve data analysis processes. Contribute to the development of best practices and standards for data science within the organization.
Technical support: provide (limited) technical support with settings in RELEX, PriceFx and/or or category management related systems


Your Profile

Requirements

You are a builder. You love to set-up new ways of working, data pipeline & data projects and to embed those in the daily operations of the team. You get energy from seeing your colleagues use data products & you are an eager learner. You understand that the customer is at the heart of all our operations and you enjoy working closely with other departments to support our customers. For the practical requirements, we also expect:


Master’s degree in Economics, Econometrics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other relevant areas
2-3 years work experience as data analyst
English (must have), Dutch (Pro)
Experience with Python/R and SQL a must
Experience with PowerBI / Looker
Experience with GCP / Google BigQuery (Pro)
Experience data projects and project management


About Us

For us"Let's Go!"is not just a slogan, it is an attitude. We love technology and we want to excite. We have fun and want to inspire. We are number one in Benelux and Europe. We influence how people experience and use technology. We make the difference and are there for our customers, through all channels. Together with our 50.000 employees across Europe, we create the shopping experience of the future.

Our best solutions arise when diverse perspectives come together. Diversity is key to achieving our vision of becoming the Experience Champion in Consumer Electronics. We value diversity, promote equal opportunities, and foster inclusion—join our team!

Additional Benefits

Job Infos

Location: Rotterdam

Media Markt Hoofdkantoor

Department: HQ - IT

Entrylevel: Professional Level

Type of Employement: Full Time/Part Time

Working Hours: 40

Persona: Job Requisition HQ Employee

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Wil jij met jouw analytische vaardigheden bijdragen aan betere zorg, onderwijs en overheidsdiensten? Bij Van Dam Datapartners zoeken we een Data Analist die data omzet in heldere inzichten en concrete adviezen.




Wat ga je doen?

Analyseren & inzicht bieden: je onderzoekt datasets van gemeenten, zorginstellingen en andere publieke organisaties om maatschappelijke trends en knelpunten te signaleren.
Datavisualisatie & rapportages: je bouwt dashboards en rapportages in tools zoals Power BI, Tableau, Qlik of Cognos, zodat besluitvormers direct aan de slag kunnen met jouw inzichten.
Adviseren & presenteren: je vertaalt data naar duidelijke en overtuigende adviezen en presenteert deze aan opdrachtgevers.
Samenwerken & verbeteren: je werkt in een dynamisch team, waarbij je samen met Data Engineers en BI-specialisten slimme data-oplossingen ontwikkelt.

Projecten met maatschappelijke impact en opdrachten die ertoe doen. Uitstekende ontwikkelmogelijkheden, zowel inhoudelijk als persoonlijk. Werken in een bedrijf waar je vrijheid krijgt, maar ook verantwoordelijkheid draagt.




Wie ben jij?

HBO/WO niveau opgeleid
Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar ervaring binnen het publieke domein.
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met het analyseren van data.
Kennis van datavisualisatie, statistiek en SQL.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden: je kunt complexe analyses eenvoudig uitleggen.
Je houdt van een uitdaging en voelt je thuis in een dynamische commerciële omgeving.
Je bent proactief en neemt het initiatief om met klanten in gesprek te gaan, zowel op inhoud als op de relatie. Je signaleert kansen en zoekt samen naar de beste oplossingen.




Uiteraard staat deze vacature open voor iedereen die zich hierin herkent. We geloven dat diversiteit binnen onze teams zorgt voor groei en innovatie.




Wat bieden we jou?

Werken in een organisatie met maatschappelijke relevantie, maar ook met ruimte voor jouw ontwikkeling.
Een marktconform salaris (€ 3.750 – € 5.500 per maand, op basis van 40 uur per week), afhankelijk van ervaring.
8% vakantiegeld.
NS-Business Card of reiskostenvergoeding (€ 0,23/km).
Een laptop en telefoon.
25 vakantiedagen.
De mogelijkheid om 5 extra dagen te kopen of verkopen.
Pensioenregeling bij Nationale Nederlanden.
Thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,40 per dag + vergoeding voor inrichting thuiswerkplek.
Toegang tot onze Academy voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Marktplaats in The Netherlands, and 2dehands and 2ememain in Belgium, are part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist. The three brands are hosted on a multi-tenant platform, operated from our Amsterdam location, and are the top players in the classifieds space throughout the Benelux region.

We offer consumers the opportunity to trade their unwanted products and contribute to a greener, circular economy. We offer businesses - of all sizes, from the smallest hobbyist to the biggest brands in Benelux - a platform to showcase their goods and services online to over 11 million monthly unique users.

What You’ll Do & Who You Are

Welcome to Marktplaats!

About Marktplaats And 2dehands

Marktplaats in The Netherlands, and 2dehands and 2ememain in Belgium, are part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist. The three brands are hosted on a multi-tenant platform, operated from our Amsterdam location, and are the top players in the classifieds space throughout the Benelux.

We offer consumers the opportunity to trade their unwanted products and contribute to a greener, circular economy. We offer businesses - of all sizes, from the smallest hobbyist to the biggest brands in Benelux - a platform to showcase their goods and services online to over 11 million monthly unique users.

About The Role

The Benelux Business Analytics team is responsible for business analytics for the Dutch and Belgian businesses of Adevinta. In this role of Business and Strategy Analyst, you will have a focus on supporting the advertising domain with financial forecasting, business case creation and strategic guidance through data. You will provide dashboarding and reporting as needed, as well as ad hoc questions. Though your primary focus will be in this department, we prioritize across the domains, so you will also contribute to our other departments like automotive or transactions.

You are a high-impact contributor with a strong analytical mindset and a track record of top performance. You bring strategic thinking to the design and evolution of data structures, proactively identify opportunities for automation and operational efficiency, and translate complex data into actionable insights. With excellent communication skills, you serve as a trusted partner to both technical teams and business stakeholders—bridging the gap between analysis, engineering, and decision-making.

Responsibilities


Support the advertising domain, specifically focusing on performance and optimization of bannering revenue, as well as the features that users can purchase.
Analyze data to get insights on trends, anomalies and opportunities and drive business decisions
Gather market insights and translate them into impactful initiatives for our business teams
Set-up, automate, maintain, and own dashboards and reporting structure for operational metrics and revenue streams of your focus area
Closely work together with the advertising business teams and finance teams to define the key operational and financial metrics
Construct and deliver clear, concise presentations of findings, key product and user performance metrics and management recommendations both in oral and written form


Qualifications


Professional experience of 4-6 years in the field
Academic degree, preferably in a quantitative field like mathematics, econometrics, statistics etc.
Expert with SQL, Tableau and Excel skills are a requirement. Experience with Python or similar is a plus
Proven experience in working with large, multisource data sets and usage of analytics to drive business and product decisions and strategy
The skill to explain complicated analyses in a simple way to colleagues and management
Ability to work in an agile and flexible environment where change is part of the day-to-day environment
The attitude to go that extra mile when needed and celebrate success after achievements


Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:


An attractive Base Salary 💸
Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) 🏆
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moon🌛well why not! just make sure you have internet connection! 🌍
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ❤️
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱


On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.
Show more

  • Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱

On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Title: Analyst
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today, our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity, and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change, helping clients initiate, navigate, and benefit from transformation. Optimism is our force multiplier, mitigating downside and maximizing opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our +3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results; our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



Collecting, analyzing, and structuring information to support projects.



Personal & professional growth



Works on personal growth and learns the intricacies of the profession and sector by being curious and showing interest
Shows ownership of tasks, asks for help/questions in time when stuck, and aligns expectations with the project team
Collaborates constructively with colleagues and stakeholders and demonstrates reliability

Client & quality



Supports (senior) consultants in successfully executing projects by:
Collecting information
Analyzing and making this information insightful
Preparing workshops

Sia’s growth



Commerce: Assists in developing commercial opportunities and proposals
Knowledge: Shares acquired knowledge internally

Portfolio: Stays informed about the services and projects delivered by Sia





Qualifications


You have completed your Master’s Degree
You have 0 to 2 years’ experience within a consultancy firm
Sectoral knowledge: Telecom & Tech / Financial Services / Automotive / Life Sciences
Outstanding collaborative team player and good communication skills
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Dutch and English communication and presentation skills are mandatory

What do we offer?



Competitive salary with extra advantages: a company car or flexible mobility plan, a clear and structured yearly salary increase and bonuses
Training plan to develop yourself as an expert in your discipline
You have the opportunity to work from home, the client or from our offices in Amsterdam or Maastricht
Working in an international environment which creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the world


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs. 



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who Are We

At Coinmerce, a Dutch-founded European cryptocurrency company, we’re on a mission to make crypto simple, secure, and accessible for everyone—whether individuals or professionals. As a registered crypto broker with De Nederlandsche Bank, we serve customers in over 10 European countries, with plans for global expansion. Transparency is key to everything we do, and our open-door culture at our Schiphol-Rijk office reflects that. With a talented and motivated team, we’re shaping the future of the crypto space—and we want you to be a part of it.

About The Role

The Coinmerce group is growing, and we’re looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you’ll help shape our product and strategic decisions by transforming complex data into actionable insights. You’ll support multiple teams (like Marketing, Product, and Finance), provide dashboards, reports, and predictive models, and act as a go-to expert for anything data-driven. If you love working with data to uncover trends, optimize processes, and guide strategic decisions, this is the role for you.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, validate, and organize data from various sources to ensure reliability and accuracy.
Analyze datasets to identify patterns, trends, and actionable insights.
Create detailed reports and visually compelling dashboards to communicate findings.
Collaborate closely with internal departments (including Marketing, Finance, and Product) to address data-related questions and deliver data-driven recommendations.
Develop and implement predictive models for forecasting, segmentation, or risk analysis.
Continuously monitor and improve data quality and analysis processes.
Translate business needs into data solutions and support stakeholders in making informed decisions.


What You Bring


A proactive mindset with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
HBO or WO level of education in Data Science, Statistics, Finance, Business Economics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in a similar data analysis role.
Strong skills in SQL in BigQuery (essential), MySQL, and PostgreSQL.
Experience with visualization tools. Looker is a strong plus.
Experience with Python is a strong plus.
Familiarity with marketing analytics and an affinity for crypto and finance.
Experience with predictive analytics or machine learning models is a bonus.
Excellent communication skills in English. Dutch is a plus.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job role- Senior Power BI




Location - Amsterdam, Netherlands




Job Description:




Minium 5 years of experience as PowerBI Developer or BI specialist

• Good experience in working in Agile

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to help us spread the film love? Cineville is looking for a Data Analyst to join the team.

Who are we?

Hi, we are Cineville: a fast-growing film club for anyone that wants to look further. What we do? We help (young) people discover as many great films as possible by giving them access to over 250 film theaters across the Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, Austria and Sweden. With almost 160.000 members (and counting), our Cinevillers see more than 2 million movies together a year.

Cineville’s success is powered by our very own software ecosystem, composed of two systems: Cineville Digital and CultureKit.

Cineville Digital consists of a public-facing website, a mobile application, and an internal Content Management System (CMS). The website and mobile app are the primary user interfaces, offering access to information about Cineville, affiliated cinemas, films, festivals, reviews, articles, and the digital Cineville pass. Supporting these platforms, the CMS enables the content team to efficiently create, manage, and publish diverse content, like film articles and cinema details, using structured templates for delivery across both the website and app.

CultureKit serves as the core subscription and membership platform for Cineville, Podiumpas, and Nonstop Kino, representing the heart of Cineville's software infrastructure. Its robust API allows for seamless integration with venue Point-of-Sale (POS) systems to handle ticket sales, visit registration, and reservations, while also providing comprehensive programming data to websites and applications. This platform, built on a microservices architecture, is developed, managed, and hosted by the Cineville tech team utilizing the Google Cloud Platform.

Fueled by rapid growth, Cineville is building a new data platform to drive data-informed decisions across our ecosystem. We are seeking a proactive Data Analyst to join our Development Team and take ownership of analyzing our data and generating insights. Your work will directly support affiliated theaters, international Cineville teams, and internal stakeholders by providing clear, actionable insights. You will be part of our Development Team, which includes four Backend Developers, two Frontend Developers, a Product Owner, supported by the Director of Software and Services.

At Cineville, we believe that celebrating and stimulating diversity in all its forms is natural and important. It doesn't matter where you're from, what your background is, or who you are - everyone is welcome to join our film club. Film is meant for everyone, and so is this job opportunity.

What You’ll Be Doing


Collaborate with stakeholders (dev team, PO, marketing, leadership) to define requirements and build intuitive dashboards delivering actionable insights, as well as to ensure that the delivered insights and dashboards meet user needs.
Analyse complex datasets to identify key trends, translating findings into clear reports and compelling visualizations.
Write clean, efficient, and documented SQL queries and Python scripts for data transformation, analysis, and visualization, adhering to best practices.
Actively participate in peer reviews for analytical code (SQL, Python), providing and receiving feedback to maintain high standards.


Who are you?


You have a strong analytical mindset focused on driving business impact.
You excel at translating complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations and compelling data stories.
You are proficient in SQL, with (basic) Python skills or a strong desire to develop them. Experience with dbt and git is a plus.
You have hands-on experience building insightful dashboards from concept to implementation using tools like Tableau, Looker, Kibana, Metabase, or similar.
You are experienced with cloud data platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform and its data warehouse solution BigQuery.
You know that good teamwork begins and ends with consistent and clear communication and you lead by example.
You enjoy working with different type of stakeholders within the company, such as our marketing and business development team.
You know that self reflection is the key to growth, and apply that in your day-to-day life.
You have 2-4 years of work experience as a data or business analyst.


What do we offer?


A job for 24-40 hours a week.
The salary for this job has a range of € 3.570,- tot € 4.395,- gross per month based on fulltime (plus 8% holiday allowance). Your salary will be based on your skills and experience.
A beautiful place to work right in the heart of Amsterdam, including a free biological lunch, and as much coffee, tea and fruit as you’ll need.
The possibility to work from home, and a budget to create a nice home office.
A MacBook Pro or alternative machine to your liking.
An NS Business Card if you need to take the train to work.
Great benefits, such as: 25 holidays (based on a fulltime contract), flexible parental leave, and a sustainably invested pension.
A Cineville membership, to watch as many films as you like.
No relocation or visa sponsorship possible.


Sounds good?

Apply via the button below with an English or Dutch CV and a (short) cover letter which clearly states your motivation to work with us. Applications can be submitted till Wednesday the 23rd of July. We will get back to you within 2 weeks. If you have any questions, just send us an email to kantoor@cineville.nl for the attention Floor Ploeg or Anastasija Efremovska.

If you’re excited about this role but your past experiences don’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. 



With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



As a Data Analytics Consultant, you will be at the heart of delivering impactful data-driven strategies to our clients. You will collaborate closely with local and international clients to bridge the gap between business objectives and technical execution.



You will help deliver actionable data-driven solutions & insights, and present the results in an interactive, easily understandable manner.



What you will do



Collaborate with stakeholders to define business goals and shape solution blueprints through workshops and mock-ups.



Prepare and validate data by mapping, extracting, cleaning, enriching, and performing feature engineering to establish stable datasets for analysis.



Design, implement, and automate interactive dashboards and customized reports that cater to specific client requirements using advanced visualization tools.



Conduct comprehensive statistical analysis and exploratory data investigations to extract actionable insights supporting decision-making.



Translate complex technical and analytical findings into clear, understandable presentations for non-technical stakeholders.



Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics, applying innovative approaches to enhance service offerings.



Provide guidance and support to business users and team members in leveraging data effectively, contributing to a data-driven culture and continuous learning.



Within Sia, you will



Contribute to enhancing Sia’s Data Science and Generative AI offerings through internal training sessions, working groups, and publications.



Represent Sia at professional events, actively contributing to thought leadership (articles, white papers, webinars).



Support business development by crafting proposals/offers, identifying collaboration opportunities, and nurturing long-term client relationships.





Qualifications



About You



You bring:



A Master's degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.



0–3 years of experience in data analytics or a relevant consulting or industry role.



Fluency in Dutch or French, and English.



Strategic thinking with strong analytical skills and a proactive approach.



Experience in clearly communicating and presenting complex ideas to varied audiences.



Efficient collaboration with various stakeholders, internally and externally, to gather requirements and support data-driven decisions.



Eagerness to work alongside and learn from more experienced colleagues while contributing fresh ideas to team projects.



Interest in applying innovative analytics and AI solutions to drive sustainability and create meaningful business impact.



Your technical toolkit:



Hands-on experience with Python or R for data analysis.



Proficiency with SQL and Microsoft Excel for data manipulation.



Familiarity with dashboarding tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.



Knowledge of cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a strong plus.







Why Join Us?



Tailored career development with ongoing training in analytics, AI, and consulting skills.



Project diversity: Collaborate on high-impact assignments across sectors and geographies.



Flexibility: Hybrid work model combining office, remote, and client-based work.



Attractive compensation package including annual raises, bonuses, and personalized mobility options.



Global network: Be part of a vibrant international consulting community with thought leaders in AI and analytics.





Additional Information



Unfortunately, we are unable to provide a work permit for this position.



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or disciplinary actions, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, and business needs.











Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Data Analist




Voor een wereldwijd toonaangevende financiële klant in Nederland ben ik met spoed op zoek naar een Data Analist.

Taken en werkzaamheden

Tijdig en accuraat aanleveren van data op basis van ad-hoc verzoeken.
Uitvoeren van data-analyses en vertalen van inzichten naar concrete adviezen.
Stakeholders ondersteunen met jouw data-expertise en bijdragen aan het verhogen van data literacy binnen de Tribe.
Ondersteunen bij migratie naar het nieuwe platform (datasets aanvragen, queries ombouwen).




Jouw profiel:

Je bent een bruggenbouwer tussen business en data, dus we zoeken een business profiel met technische vaardigheden (tov puur tech profiel).
Je kunt complexe data vertalen naar informatie en uitleggen aan een stakeholder.
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met:
Data analyse en het opstellen van adviezen
SQL en Databricks (minimaal 3 jaar intensief mee gewerkt)
Flexibel kunnen schakelen tussen verschillende verzoeken en prioriteiten.
Omdat we een klein team zijn, zoeken we een kandidaat die niet alleen goed kan samenwerken, maar ook actief wil bijdragen aan de teamdynamiek en zich echt onderdeel wil voelen van het team.
Master of bachelor degree (bijv. data analytics /econometrie / wiskunde / bedrijfskunde met specialisatie data-analyse / statistiek)
Nederlands en Engels sprekend
Ervaring binnen een bank of financiële instelling, bij voorkeur ervaring binnen het zakelijk domein




Mocht jij de Data Analist zijn waar mijn klant naar op zoek is, aarzel dan niet om je c.v. aan mij te sturen!




Contract: 6+ months

Tarief: Uitstekend

Locatie: Amsterdam (Hybrid)




Nick Chinweerapunt

Account Manager

Gazelle Global Consulting

Tel +31 85 111 0171

Tel +44 203 588 7747

Mob +44 7377 403 773

nick@gazellegc.com

Title: Intern - Data Analyst
Description:
This Is What We Offer You


Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
EUR 1,400 development budget per year
Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution


Or view all our benefits.

Are you passionate about data and eager to turn insights into impact? Join our Existing Customer Management (ECM) team as an InternData Analyst and help shape the future of data-driven decision-making in the financial sector.

You’ll work within a collaborative environment that values curiosity, innovation, and continuous learning. From day one, you’ll contribute to real projects that support our mission to deliver reliable insights and improve customer experiences.


Start Date: August 2025
Duration: 4–5 months (flexible)
Location: Utrecht / Remote (hybrid)


You & the job


Perform data cleaning, processing, and analysis tasks
Create dashboards and data visualizations using tools like Power BI
Extract insights to support internal reporting and decision-making
Learn and apply tools such as Excel, SQL, or Python (based on your background)
Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders
Ensure data quality and ethical use of customer data
Support the development of data products that drive operational and strategic improvements


You & your talent


Recent graduate or early-career professional
Studying or completed a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Comfortable with Excel, SQL, or Python (beginner level welcome)
Familiarity with Power BI or other visualization tools
Strong interest in data analysis, visualization, and storytelling
Proactive mindset with a passion for solving problems
Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team
Eager to learn, grow, and gain hands-on experience


Additional nice to haves:


Experience with DAX or Power Query
Familiarity with Azure DevOps or similar tools
Understanding of data ethics and privacy


What do we offer?


An internship allowance of €600 per month (based on 36 hours)
Personal guidance and opportunities for professional development
An inspiring workplace in the heart of Utrecht
Access to our intern community and events
An inclusive work environment where your ideas truly matter


You & the application process

Do you have questions about the internship or recruitment process? Reach out to campusrecruitment@rabobank.nl.


You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: SDG Group in the Netherlands – A Division of Alten NL
Place: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Description:
Data Analyst – Capelle a/d IJssel - ALTEN Nederland




De functie

Als onderdeel van ons groeiend bedrijf zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Analyst om ons team te versterken en bij te dragen aan lopende klantprojecten in Capelle a/d IJssel.




Als Data Analyst omvatten je belangrijkste taken:

Analyseren, interpreteren en visualiseren van complexe datasets
Meedenken met klanten over data-gedreven verbeteringen en oplossingen
Ontwerpen van dashboards en rapportages met tools zoals Power BI of Tableau
Vertalen van businessvraagstukken naar concrete data-analyses (SQL, Python, R)
Samenwerken met multidisciplinaire teams (developers, engineers, consultants)
Bijdragen aan projecten van data-acquisitie tot presentatie en advies




Jouw profiel

Minimaal een hbo- of wo-diploma in een relevante richting (bijv. Data Science, Informatica, Econometrie)
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie als Data Analyst of BI Consultant
Vaardig in SQL, Power BI, Tableau en kennis van Python en/of R
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels
Gewenste soft skills: analytisch denkvermogen, probleemoplossend, communicatief sterk, klantgericht en proactief




Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Je krijgt een vast contract
Je krijgt een leaseauto met tankpas
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken
Maandelijkse netto onkostenvergoeding
27 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen
Pensioenregeling zonder eigen bijdrage




Waarom kiezen voor ALTEN?

Impactvolle projecten in belangrijke sectoren: Draag bij aan betekenisvolle initiatieven in sectoren zoals defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, waar jouw expertise echt het verschil maakt.
Een breed klantenportfolio: Werk samen met zowel grote marktleiders als innovatieve middelgrote bedrijven en verzamel zo diverse en verrijkende ervaringen.
Versterk je loopbaan dankzij SDG's expertise: Bij ALTEN staat jouw ontwikkeling centraal. Je krijgt toegang tot doorlopende leermogelijkheden via trainingen, technische communities en evenementen. Sinds 2020 is dit verder versterkt door de integratie van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data-, Analytics- & AI-consultancy en als leider in complexe systemen en embedded technologieën.
Een cultuur van innovatie en samenwerking: Ontplooi je in een omgeving die creativiteit waardeert, kennisdeling aanmoedigt en gezamenlijk succes stimuleert.




Over ALTEN

ALTEN is een wereldwijde leider in engineering- en technologieconsultancy, en ondersteunt topklanten in hun innovatie- en R&D-strategieën. Met meer dan 57.000 medewerkers in meer dan 30 landen zijn we actief in sectoren zoals lucht- en ruimtevaart, automotive, telecom, financiën, energie en life sciences.




ALTEN Netherlands is een belangrijke entiteit binnen de ALTEN Group, met kantoren in Eindhoven, Capelle aan den IJssel, Apeldoorn, Groningen en Amstelveen. Onze 550+ consultants leveren hoogwaardige oplossingen in technologie en IT. Al meer dan 20 jaar dragen we in Nederland bij aan impactvolle projecten in hightech, defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, en ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun technologische transformatie.




Een belangrijke stap in onze ontwikkeling was de overname van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data, Analytics & AI-consultancy en expert in complexe systeemengineering. Deze strategische stap heeft onze technische expertise vergroot en ons aanbod van geavanceerde oplossingen verbreed. Door de integratie van SDG’s kennis kunnen we innovatieve oplossingen bieden die extra waarde creëren voor zowel onze klanten als consultants, in Nederland en daarbuiten.




Klaar voor jouw volgende uitdaging?

Solliciteer nu en neem deel aan boeiende en impactvolle projecten bij ALTEN Nederland!

Show more
HTML:
Data Analyst – Capelle a/d IJssel - ALTEN Nederland


De functie

Als onderdeel van ons groeiend bedrijf zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Analyst om ons team te versterken en bij te dragen aan lopende klantprojecten in Capelle a/d IJssel.


Als Data Analyst omvatten je belangrijkste taken:

  • Analyseren, interpreteren en visualiseren van complexe datasets
  • Meedenken met klanten over data-gedreven verbeteringen en oplossingen
  • Ontwerpen van dashboards en rapportages met tools zoals Power BI of Tableau
  • Vertalen van businessvraagstukken naar concrete data-analyses (SQL, Python, R)
  • Samenwerken met multidisciplinaire teams (developers, engineers, consultants)
  • Bijdragen aan projecten van data-acquisitie tot presentatie en advies


Jouw profiel

  • Minimaal een hbo- of wo-diploma in een relevante richting (bijv. Data Science, Informatica, Econometrie)
  • Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie als Data Analyst of BI Consultant
  • Vaardig in SQL, Power BI, Tableau en kennis van Python en/of R
  • Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels
  • Gewenste soft skills: analytisch denkvermogen, probleemoplossend, communicatief sterk, klantgericht en proactief


Arbeidsvoorwaarden

  • Je krijgt een vast contract
  • Je krijgt een leaseauto met tankpas
  • Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken
  • Maandelijkse netto onkostenvergoeding
  • 27 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen
  • Pensioenregeling zonder eigen bijdrage


Waarom kiezen voor ALTEN?

  • Impactvolle projecten in belangrijke sectoren: Draag bij aan betekenisvolle initiatieven in sectoren zoals defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, waar jouw expertise echt het verschil maakt.
  • Een breed klantenportfolio: Werk samen met zowel grote marktleiders als innovatieve middelgrote bedrijven en verzamel zo diverse en verrijkende ervaringen.
  • Versterk je loopbaan dankzij SDG's expertise: Bij ALTEN staat jouw ontwikkeling centraal. Je krijgt toegang tot doorlopende leermogelijkheden via trainingen, technische communities en evenementen. Sinds 2020 is dit verder versterkt door de integratie van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data-, Analytics- & AI-consultancy en als leider in complexe systemen en embedded technologieën.
  • Een cultuur van innovatie en samenwerking: Ontplooi je in een omgeving die creativiteit waardeert, kennisdeling aanmoedigt en gezamenlijk succes stimuleert.
