Title: Artificial Intelligence Intern (Fall)
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for PRGX. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

About Prgx

About PRGX Global, Inc

We provide the business intelligence to unlock incremental value from data and expand impact across our clients' organizations for healthier whole businesses. PRGX pioneered Recovery Audit nearly 50 years ago and is now the global leader in source-to-pay analytics and margin expansion. PRGX empowers clients in more than 30 countries with the business intelligence to recover $1.2 billion in annual cash flow, unlocking value and improving the overall health of organizations across the world. We collaborate with supplier communities to realize improved profits and deliver the tools to optimize processes, finding immediate and lasting value. With end-to-end technology and deep vertical expertise that underpins our recovery, preventive, and analytics solutions, we provide the actionable insights to minimize leakage, optimize cash flow, and shape stronger, healthier businesses. For additional information on PRGX, please visit www.prgx.com.

Summary

Job Description

We are seeking a talented AI Intern or a co-op with Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Generative AI skillsets to join our team. This role will report to the Director, Artificial Intelligence and based out of PRGX’s Atlanta office. The ideal candidate will be pursuing a Master of Science or PhD degree in a relevant field, has academic/industry experience applying NLP, artificial intelligence techniques to solve complex data problems. As a member of our AI team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing machine learning models to extract insights and drive decision making across the organization.

Job Duties & Responsibilities


Apply machine learning algorithms and statistical models to large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and relationships.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and develop data-driven solutions.
Design and implement end-to-end machine learning pipelines, from data preprocessing to model training, evaluation, and deployment.
Stay up to date with the latest research and developments in machine learning and artificial intelligence
Communicate complex data insights and findings to non-technical stakeholders through visualizations and presentations.


Work Experience And Education Requirements


Current Master of Science or PhD student in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or Data Science.
Academic/Industry experience of applying NLP, AI techniques to solve complex data problems.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and deep learning algorithms and statistical models, including supervised and unsupervised learning methods.
Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and data visualization techniques.
Proficiency in Python programming, and experience working with large unstructured data.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Experience with agile development methodologies and version control tools such as Git.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience working with natural language processing (NLP) techniques.
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Knowledge of cloud computing platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.


EEO INFORMATION AND WORKING CONDITIONS

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of the job. PRGX will make all employment decisions without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship status, sex, pregnancy, religion, age (age 40 and over), disability, service in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities. The employee is occasionally required to remain stationary; move; lift and/or move up to 15 pounds. The employee must regularly sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; communicate. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.

Skills & Requirements Qualifications

PRGX provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetic information, Protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

The employee must regularly sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; communicate. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.

Title: Computer Operator
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Leidos. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Description

Leidos is seeking a Computer Operator to support an IT program for The Centers for Medicaid and Medicare Services Internal Service Desk. The service desk consists of a centralized service desk and related roles tied to specific networking/telecom functions. The centralized service desk is the entry point and owner of first tiers of support (based on Information Technology Infrastructure Library’s [ITIL®] definition of tiers). Requests are received via phone calls, emails, chats, and web submittals.

Position requires shift flexibility to support a 24x7 operation 365 days a year. Must be available to work nights, holidays and weekends on short notice.

The service desk is responsible for (1) delivering remote IT support by creating, maintaining, and using knowledge articles and (2) performing basic troubleshooting to resolve, capture, report, or route incidents and requests. Some of the service desk's functions are replicated in the network/telecom areas.

The responsibility of a Computer Operator is to provide in-depth procedural & technical computer end-user support with the highest level of customer satisfaction. Support will be provided using inbound phone calls, inbound chat, inbound & outbound email, instant messaging or other tools as assigned & available. In some cases, the Computer Operator will dispatch service requests & escalate issues to appropriate points of contact defined within the support organization.

Responsibilities


Resolve basic issues remotely by phone and email support that have been reported by the customer. Upon completing additional training, you will move to resolve more complex issues.
Provide comprehensive Phone and Email Support for the efficient resolution of incidents & requests for end-users.
Upon completing additional training, assist in various scopes of the Service Desk as needed by the business. Resolve more complex hardware & software problems utilizing this additional training & expertise.
Appropriately document all required information into the ticketing system & the knowledgebase. Efficiently & accurately identify the customer’s specific information.
Resolve issues as appropriate on the first point of contact or within the appropriate timeline.
Meet required productivity expectations, including Service Center metrics.
Route & Dispatch the service request, incident or change request to the appropriate IT support group or next level Tech, for resolution.
Maintain & contribute to the in-house knowledgebase; Analyze content of resolved tickets & promote information to knowledgebase articles as appropriate, while keeping knowledgebase articles current.
Possess the capacity to work independently & effectively while maintaining positive productivity levels.
Maintain a positive relationship with fellow peers, cross functional teams & leadership.
Other duties assigned as necessary.


Qualifications


Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust Clearance; All candidates supporting the CMS programs must havelived in theUnited Statesatleastthree(3)outofthelastfive(5)yearsprior in order to be considered.
High School Diploma or equivalent.
Ability to type 35 WPM.


Desired Skills


Demonstrated experience with Mac and Windows Operating Systems and hardware.
1-2 plus year(s) of PC support, diagnostic/troubleshooting, & repair experience is desired.
Must have a working knowledge of PC operations which include: Hardware, network settings, operating system, & MS Office applications.
Associates Degree or Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or related discipline.
Any Technical Certifications, ie: A+, NET+, ACMT, Microsoft Fundamentals, etc.
ITIL v4 Foundations Certification.
Ability to type 40+ WPM.


The hourly rate for this position is ~$17/hr. - $25/hr. Actual compensation will be based upon geographic location and experience.

Original Posting

June 27, 2025

For U.S. Positions: While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.

Pay Range

Pay Range -

The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline onlyand not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

#Remote

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. Leidos will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment in accordance with relevant Laws. Leidos is an equal opportunity employer/disability/vet.

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Associate
Description:
Job Description

Overview

Why OCTA

Discover work that moves you in a dynamic and innovative setting. Be part of a team delivering Orange County’s transportation network of today and creating a vision for the future.

OCTA is the county’s transportation planning commission and public transit operator. With a focus on safety and accountability, we plan, fund, and implement countywide projects that include bus and rail transit, freeways and express lanes, rideshare, microtransit, paratransit, active transportation, and environmental programs.

We’re passionate about creating a balanced, equitable and sustainable transportation system that reflects the diverse travel needs of the county’s 34 cities and 3.2 million residents.

Our employees rated OCTA as a top workplace in Orange County. Come join us on our mission of keeping Orange County moving.

Overview

Under direct supervision, provides primary information systems support for Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A). Assists in the data extraction and cleaning of data from OCTA’s accounting, procurement and human resources systems, and the upload of this data into FP&A’s budget system and dashboards. Provides entry-level business intelligence skills in reporting and dashboard building. Maintains metadata in FP&A systems, synchronizing shared data with external systems.

This is a non-exempt position in Salary Grade 185: Min $38.71 – Mid $46.24 – Max $53.76 hourly. The starting salary will be within this range based on qualifications.

This posting will remain open until filled.

Responsibilities

This list is intended to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification and is not designed to be interpreted as an exhaustive listing of all tasks required of employees assigned to this job.

Displays High Integrity & Honesty: Takes personal responsibility, acts with honesty and consistency.

Has Technical and Professional Expertise: Has the technical skills, product knowledge and professional skills to do the job.


Assists in maintaining metadata in FP&A's Financial System, keeps chart of accounts data in-synch with Accounting and maintains title/employee data is in-synch with Human Resources.
Assists in supporting user security in Microsoft Power Apps and Qlik Sense, enforcing FP&A policies and communicating with users to ensure they know how to log-in and have access as needed.
Participates in providing ad hoc data extractions as requested by FP&A analysts to support analysis.
Assists in coordinating and prioritizing on-going development and implementation of database and software features and appropriate software conversions, including the training of employees on new programs.
Analyzes accounting and/or financial issues.
Plans and organizes projects and meets multiple deadlines. Communicates clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing.
Exercises discretion in the use of confidential information.
Assists in maintaining SQL Server and Essbase databases, performs daily, weekly, monthly, and annual data extraction, and the transformation from OCTA's Oracle and SQL Server databases into FP&A's databases, business intelligence applications and Essbase databases.


Solves Problems & Analyzes Issues: Has and applies problem analysis and problem-solving skills on a technical and interpersonal level.


Responds to requests and inquiries from system users and resolves problems. Assume responsibility for the data integrity and efficient operation of assigned applications.
Performs analysis and assists with the design and testing of assigned programs.
Assists in monitoring data integrity between FP&A's systems ensuring that control totals tie across systems, and that, as fiscal periods change, internal variables have been reset accordingly.


Takes Initiative: Initiates new programs, processes, relationships, or technologies to accomplish goals.


Participates in creating and maintaining documentation of systems, standard operating procedures, and user instruction materials.
Adapts to changing technologies and learns functionality of new equipment and systems.


Customer & External Focus: Markets his/her workgroup effectively and influences others in the organization.


Establishes and maintains effective working relationships with superiors, peers, and subordinates.
Participates in providing technical support to special projects relating to the use of specific applications.
Participates in user training in FP&A’s systems and dashboards; assists in the development of printed and video training materials.


Qualifications

Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science, business, mathematics, economics, finance, or accounting.

Working Conditions/Physical Activities

(The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by the employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. OCTA provides reasonable accommodation to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions).

Positions In This Class Typically Require


Work may be performed in a stressful, fast-paced office environment, depending upon assignment.
Requires ability to understand verbal communication and to respond effectively.
Positions in this class typically require: Reaching, Finger Dexterity, Grasping, Feeling, Talking, Hearing, Seeing, and Repetitive Motions in computer use.


Compensation And Benefits

OCTA offers an attractive compensation and benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision health insurance programs, flex time (may be available), paid sick leave, paid vacation and holidays, short-term and long-term disability, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, retirement, deferred compensation plan, educational reimbursement, excellent in-house training programs, free transportation passes for the employee and dependents, wellness and ergonomic programs, and much more. OCTA has a hybrid remote work program. Eligibility is dependent on manager’s approval.

OCTA is an equal employment opportunity employer that recruits, hires, and promotes qualified people without regard to race, color, religion, creed, ancestry, national origin, age, sex, pregnancy, gender, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, disability, genetic information, military and veteran status, or other legally protected status.

Title: Jr. Information Security Analyst
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Touro University. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Overview

A Junior IS Analyst plays a crucial role in supporting the information systems team by analyzing data, trends, and performance metrics to provide valuable insights to senior analysts and the CISO. They are responsible for collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to assist in making informed information security decisions. Additionally, Junior IS Analysts often collaborate with other team members to conduct research, prepare entitlement reports, assessments, and research security incidents. The Jr. Information Security Analyst is a critical thinker who will be tasked with assisting with information security assessments, compliance reviews, incident response, and helping with the overall cybersecurity posture of TU.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:


Assist with onboarding new applications, obtaining documentation from the various vendors and ensuring that all applications have undergone security reviews
Assist with and undertake routine entitlement reviews
Engage in incident response, maintaining incident tickets, developing playbooks, work flows and validating false positives
Collaborate with the business’s functional areas, including student services, database support to understand data flows and identify impact to information security
Work with the CISO to automate manual processes, such as sending out notifications to managers on employees that have not completed training, within the Information Security group, wherever possible
Work with the CISO to undertake security risk assessments, build reports for presentations
Undertake information security assignments, as requested


Qualifications

Education/Experience


Bachelor of Applied Sci in Cybersecurity & Network Admin preferred.
A Bachelor’s or Masters degree in a related field such as Information Security, Information technology required.Prior internship experience in data analysis or a related field is preferred.


Knowledge/Skills/Abilities


General administrative duties
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Excel, Power Point, & Outlook required
Strong attention to details, required
Accuracy and productivity in completing tasks required
Demonstrated proficiency in communication (written and verbal) required
Familiarity with power builder, power automate suite of Microsoft tools required
Comfortable working with flowcharting tools required


Travel


Possibility of flexible Work Arrangements including remote work opportunities


Maximum Salary

USD $55,000.00/Yr.

Minimum Salary

USD $44,000.00/Yr.

Touro University offers a comprehensive benefits package for full-time employees which includes:


Full range of Health Plans
Medical Plans (choice of EPO, PPO, High Deductible HSA)
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
Dental Plans (PPO & HMO) and Vision Plan
Dependent Care and Transit Programs
Life Insurance, AD&D and Voluntary Supplemental Life Insurance
Short-term and Long-term disability programs
Retirement Plan (403b) - matching contribution up to 5% for eligible/enrolled employees following one year of employment (may make own pre-tax contributions immediately following employment)
Touro University Tuition Exemption Program for eligible employees, their spouse and dependent children
Employee Assistance Program
Early-Release Fridays (upon approval)
Generous Paid Time Off
Vacation, Sick Leave, Personal Leave & Floating Holiday
Annual Holiday Schedule


All campuses of the Touro University unite to promote our core values of Respect, Integrity, and Ethics. As an international institution with diverse and talented faculty and staff, we value an inclusive learning experience where students and employees come first.

Touro University is an equal opportunity employer. Touro University treats all employees, job applicants, and students without unlawful consideration of race, ethnicity, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition), age, disability, medical condition, marital status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, military service or veteran status, citizenship status, or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. We are committed to ensuring the fulfillment of this policy in all decisions, including but not limited to, recruitment, the administration of educational programs and activities, hiring, compensation, training and apprenticeship, placement, promotion, upgrading, demotion, downgrading, transfer, layoff, suspension, expulsion and termination, and all other terms and conditions of admission, matriculation, and employment.

Inquiries or complaints concerning the non-discrimination policies should be sent to Nicole Barnett, 202 West 43rd Street, 11th Floor, New York, New York, 10036, nicole.barnett@touro.edu (646-565-6285) or, alternatively, to the Chief Compliance Officer at compliance@touro.edu and 646-565-6000 x55330.

Description:

Employment Type

Full time

Shift

Description:

The IT Operations Analyst plays a key role within the IT Business Management Office (BMO), supporting strategic planning, operational execution, and delivery across the IT organization. This position is responsible for ensuring consistency with Trinity Health’s enterprise standards for internal materials and messaging, managing centralized IT engagement efforts, auditing and administering IT SharePoint environments, and leading initiatives related to the organization, presentation, and accessibility of information. The ideal candidate will possess strong written and verbal skills, along with demonstrated experience in facilitating programs, developing processes, coordinating cross-functional efforts, and driving both tactical and strategic initiatives that align with organizational objectives.

In collaboration with IT leadership, this role supports the implementation, delivery, and oversight of internal IT initiatives to ensure alignment with Trinity Health’s operational goals, while also contributing to both tactical and strategic IT projects that advance key organizational priorities.

Essential Functions


Knows, understands, incorporates, and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision, and Values in behaviors, practices, and decisions.
Evaluates IT communication engagement needs, assesses current practices organization and identifies areas for improvement.
Solves unique and complex operational problems that have a broad impact on the business. Serves in advisory roles.
Determines and develops appropriate procedures/standards in the absence of guidelines/protocols.
Conceptualizes well in an unstructured or multi-disciplinary environment with latitude for independent action.
Analyzes large data sets and develops reports on the overall performance of business segments; develops metrics to measure various characteristics of the business. Tracks, maintains, and provides current information on the operation’s business scorecard.
Applies basic proficiency in creating easy-to understand data visualizations that facilitate business decision making.
Facilitates meetings, demos, and training sessions with customers, either in person or via video conference. 
Engages IT customers to implement new and updated processes.
Curates content and orchestrates delivery of information for IT town halls, business meetings, year-end artifacts, and other assets to strengthen the organization’s reputation.
pay grade 14 range 84,491.07-126,736.6031 Actual compensation will fall within the range but may vary based on factors such as experience, qualifications, education, location, licensure, certification requirements, and comparisons to colleagues in similar roles.


Internal Engagement & Messaging


Acts as a representative of the IT business unit, ensuring consistent and professional messaging across all internal platforms.
Supports IT new hire orientation events in collaboration with departmental partners.
Develops and distributes emails, announcements, and updates that reflect the IT organization’s strategic direction.
Partners with IT leadership to craft messaging that supports change initiatives and fosters user engagement.


SharePoint Administration & Information Management


Administers and maintains internal IT SharePoint sites ensuring content is accurate, accessible, and aligned with Trinity Health standards.
Collaborates with the product and engineering teams to design and implement site structures, workflows, and permissions to support collaboration and knowledge sharing.
Manages IT specific digital content including documentation, training materials, policies, and other internal IT assets to support effective information management.


Program/Process Facilitation & Operations Support


Contributes to the planning, coordination, and tracking of strategic IT initiatives and projects.
Provides operational support through documentation management, scheduling, stakeholder communications, and risk monitoring.
Partners with cross-functional teams to ensure timely achievement of project milestones and alignment of deliverables with business objectives.
Performs additional duties as assigned to support overall IT operations and project success.
Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State, and local laws and regulations, Trinity Health’s Organizational Integrity Program, Standards of Conduct, as well as other policies and procedures to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical, and professional behavior.


Minimum Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in healthcare, information technology, business administration or a related field, and a minimum of four to six (4-6) years of experience in descriptive analytics of financial, resource planning or other operational data sets; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Ability to communicate the analysis results meaningfully to varying audiences is required.
Advanced skills and experience using a variety of data analytics tools (such as Excel, Access, Tableau, Cube.js or similar) is required. Working knowledge of various programming languages is preferred.
Proficient knowledge in two or more (2+) business operations disciplines and supported business processes. Business operations disciplines include, but are not limited to, financial management, contract performance management, process improvement, vendor management and change leadership.
Enrollment and completion of PX Essentials and Root Cause Analysis training offered by Trinity Health, or equivalent certifications, completed within first twelve (12) months in this role.
Moderate to advanced analytical, problem-solving skills and technical aptitude.
Ability to meet deadlines, set priorities and lead department work initiatives. Must possess a willingness to work in teams and with direct supervision, while having the ability to work independently on a day-to-day basis.
Must be able to learn and develop skills, as well as receive constructive feedback.
Requires advanced written and verbal communication and presentation skills needed to discuss/explain issues which may be of a complex or sensitive nature and to garner support of others for issues and projects. Ability to engage in negotiation and resolution of standard issues.
Must be comfortable operating in a collaborative, shared leadership environment.
Must possess a personal presence that is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity, and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals, and values of Trinity Health


Other Preferred Qualifications


Experience working in a hybrid or enterprise IT environment.
Knowledge of change management and communication planning.
Graphic design or visual communication skills for internal branding.
Certification in project management (e.g., PMP, CAPM) or IT service management (e.g., ITIL Foundation).


Physical And Mental Requirements And Working Conditions


Must be able to set and organize own work priorities and adapt to them as they change frequently. Must be able to work concurrently on a variety of tasks/projects in an environment that may be stressful with individuals having diverse personalities and work styles.
Must be able to travel to the various Trinity Health sites (10%) as needed.
Must possess the ability to comply with Trinity Health policies and procedures.


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by persons assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of duties assigned.

Our Commitment

Rooted in our Mission and Core Values, we honor the dignity of every person and recognize the unique perspectives, experiences, and talents each colleague brings. By finding common ground and embracing our differences, we grow stronger together and deliver more compassionate, person-centered care. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Trinity Health is a family of 115,000 colleagues and nearly 26,000 physicians and clinicians across 25 states. Because we serve diverse populations, our colleagues are trained to recognize the cultural beliefs, values, traditions, language preferences, and health practices of the communities that we serve and to apply that knowledge to produce positive health outcomes. We also recognize that each of us has a different way of thinking and perceiving our world and that these differences often lead to innovative solutions.

Our dedication to diversity includes a unified workforce (through training and education, recruitment, retention, and development), commitment and accountability, communication, community partnerships, and supplier diversity.

EOE including disability/veteran

Title: Security Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities:

Analyze Client Security Needs: Evaluate the specific security needs of our U.S.-based clients and provide tailored solutions to enhance their security measures.
Monitor Security Trends: Stay up-to-date on the latest security threats, technologies, and regulatory changes affecting the global market. Provide proactive advice on emerging risks and how to address them. Research on a wide range of geopolitical issues related to domestic politics, foreign policy, trade, security, risk and developments, and what they mean for regional and global trends.
Risk Assessment and Vulnerability Analysis: Conduct regular assessments of client security operations, identify potential risks or vulnerabilities, and provide recommendations for improvements.
Incident Analysis and Reporting: Analyze security incidents, investigate root causes, and develop strategies for preventing similar issues in the future. Prepare detailed reports and share findings with clients and internal teams.
Provide Expert Recommendations: Advise on the integration of new security technologies and methodologies. Help clients obtain the latest geopolitical developments in a region to help them make the most reasonable decisions.
Keep a close eye on the geopolitics and volatility of the world.: The role sits in the both defense and geopolitics analyze area. You should generate analysis that enhances the work of client governments and supports partnerships which improve people’s understanding of the world.







Requirements:

Proven experience as a security analyst, information security professional, or a similar role in the security industry.
Experience working with business leaders and political decision-makers, with a particular expertise in providing insightful recommendations based on geopolitical dynamics.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in security tools and methodologies (e.g., risk assessment, vulnerability testing, etc.).
Ability to apply a range of research methodologies to write original, forward-looking analysis on global, regional, and country-specific issues for leaders and clients.
Ability to provide impact assessments and private briefings to client governments, as well as customized consulting projects for individual leaders and governments to help assess the impact of emerging trends.
Ability to use data, documents, and expert insights to develop innovative and practical policy recommendations for governments and policymakers to help them better assess and respond to geopolitical developments and technological changes.
Excellent communication skills to collaborate with both internal teams and clients.

Preferred:

Experience with security systems or technologies used in physical or cybersecurity.
In-depth research and information input in the fields of geopolitics and defense.
Experience working with global decision makers or contracting government projects
Certifications such as CISSP, CISA, or other relevant qualifications in security analysis.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Turn data into insights that drive smarter decisions across a global organization

Are you passionate about transforming data into business value? Join our Global IT team and help shape how BioMar uses data to inform decisions and drive strategic progress across our global organization. Your work will bring clarity to complex questions and help colleagues make better decisions every day.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our journey toward becoming a more data-driven organization. You’ll play a key role in unlocking the full potential of our BI platform, BioMetrics, built on Microsoft Azure and using Tableau for reporting and visualization. BioMetrics connects people with the data they need to move the business forward.

At BioMar, the role of Data Analyst is titled IT Solution Lead, and this will be your official title once you join us.

Make a difference in how we turn business questions into actionable answers

In this role, your focus will be on delivering the right data in clear, interactive dashboards and reports that bring business matters into sharp focus. By designing BI solutions that are not just informative but truly actionable, you’ll help colleagues quickly grasp key insights and take the right steps to move the business forward.


Partner with colleagues across the business to understand and translate their needs into data requirements
Design and maintain insightful dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Tableau or similar tools
Use strong problem-solving skills to work through complex business challenges and data
Improve reporting processes and ensure data quality across our BI platform
Align BI products with strategic goals and business value


Bring your experience and curiosity to build better data solutions

You are someone who thrives in complexity, takes ownership, and enjoys working closely with diverse colleagues. You know that successful BI is about more than just numbers - it’s about making things easier to understand, easier to act on, and more impactful. You are proactive, structured, and committed to continuous improvement.


At least 5 years of experience working with data and BI in a professional setting
Hands-on experience with Tableau or similar tools, as well as SQL and Azure-based environments
A structured communicator who can work with both technical and non-technical colleagues
A relevant academic degree in IT, Business Intelligence, Computer Science, or similar
Fluent in written and spoken English; Spanish is a plus, but not required


Be part of a collaborative, forward-thinking environment

At BioMar, innovation and collaboration are at the heart of everything we do. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to influence how data is used across our global company - and help us meet our mission of advancing sustainable aquaculture.

You’ll work with dedicated professionals across disciplines and regions in a supportive environment that values learning and initiative. We offer flexibility, professional development, and a chance to make your mark on a company with purpose.

Ready to apply or have questions?

We look forward to hearing from you. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to our HR Business Partner, Emilie Louise Svenning, on +45 2065 2997. The application process is ongoing, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Please include your CV when applying.

About BioMar

More than half of the seafood consumed globally comes from aquaculture. At BioMar, we are committed to developing and delivering efficient, sustainable, and healthy aquaculture feed solutions. Innovation and partnerships are at the heart of everything we do, and we are proud that our highly skilled people share this commitment. With feed factories in 13 countries across 4 continents, we supply feed to over 90 countries, supporting more than 45 different species of fish and shrimp. Join us on our journey to innovate aquaculture.

Powered by Partnership. Driven by Innovation.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Assistant (Part-Time / Student Job)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ahoy, fellow miners! 👋

We’re on the hunt for a Data Analyst Assistant to join our crew!




Who We Are

Based in the heart of Copenhagen, Ghost Ship Games is a passionate, close-knit studio of 45+ gamers. Guided by our “Co-op First” philosophy, we proudly created Deep Rock Galactic, one of Steam’s top 100 games, and we are supported by one of the friendliest player communities.




Our Approach

At GSG, we take a pragmatic, hands-on approach to our work. We prioritize teamwork, flexibility, and proactivity. Collaboration is central to everything we do. We believe the best results come from sharing ideas and refining them based on further feedback.




What This Means for You

We value clear communication, adaptability, and a proactive approach. This means being comfortable trying different solutions, sharing opinions, receiving and incorporating feedback, being open to different perspectives, and taking responsibility for your own tasks.




As our new crew member, you'll be part of the Publishing and Marketing Team and will work closely with all its current members. The team consists of three people — each with their own area of responsibility — and is led by the Head of Publishing & Marketing. You'll also coordinate with the development teams at Ghost Ship Games and our colleagues at external studios across all the titles we publish.




Who You Are and What You Will Be Doing

You are a student with at least 1.5 years remaining in your studies in the fields of Statistics, Business Analytics, or Data Analytics. It is also crucial that you have a strong interest in the gaming industry.

In this role, your main goal will be to structure, visualize, and process data to support the team’s work. Therefore, it is essential that you:

Are well-organized and able to present data in a way that is easily understood by people in different roles.
Are capable of turning raw data into clear insights that support future decision-making.
Possess strong communication skills and the ability to clearly present your ideas.
Are familiar with game titles developed by Ghost Ship Games as well as those published by Ghost Ship Games Publishing.




Personality-wise

While you may still be building your experience, you’re curious, eager to learn, and motivated to grow your skills.




You’re genuinely interested in understanding how games work and what influences player behavior, enjoying the process of spotting patterns in how players interact with games.

You’re comfortable sharing what you discover and believe that working together and discussing data leads to better insights than simply presenting results. You see yourself collaborating with people across different teams and contributing to a wide range of data-related topics.




You also

Are curious and data-driven.
Manage your tasks proactively and work well independently.
Have a passion for game development and design.




Your Day-to-Day Tasks Will Include

Making dashboards and other visualizations of gameplay and business data.
Writing queries and scheduling jobs that make the data in our data warehouses usable for dashboards and visualizations.
Doing ad-hoc quantitative analyses based on questions from the development team.
Helping the team plan what data to track and what format in which it should be tracked.




Additional duties

Depending on your interests, you may also have the opportunity to get involved in other areas of game publishing, such as localization, publishing support, or related fields.




Tools

Looker Studio.
Bigquery.
Snowflake.
Data analysis tools of choice (Python, R, Excel, etc.)




Desirable, but not mandatory

Interest in games of various genres.
Understanding of business operations, product development, and/or general financial reporting.
A desire to understand how we can improve our games, together with everyone at Ghost Ship Games.




What We Offer

Flexible hours.
Competitive salary with an annual bonus.
Strong pension plan.
Health and dental insurance.
Paid parental leave.
Vacation in accordance with the Salaried Employees Act (Funktionærlov).
Child sick leave.
Spacious office in Gothersgade with lunch and plenty of social shenanigans.




Practical Information

You must have at least 1.5 years remaining in your studies.
Strong English language skills.
This is a part-time (approx. 15 hours/week) student on-site position. To be considered, you must be enrolled in an educational program and live in Copenhagen or within commuting distance.
We don’t have a strict deadline for this position, but we will begin reviewing applications after the 3rd of August. The role will remain open until we find the right fit, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.




Application

Let’s keep it brief! No cover letter is needed — just focus on your application responses, and CV. 😊




Review & Interviews

Your application will be reviewed by People & Culture and the Head of Publishing & Marketing, followed by one interview round. The interview will last about 45 min to an hour, during which we’ll discuss your background, experience, and what you’re interested in doing at GSG. If needed, an additional interview round may be scheduled for further clarification.




We welcome everyone to apply! Your unique background strengthens our crew.




Ready to embark on your next expedition?

Grab your ⛏️ and join us!

Show more

Title: Junior Quantitative Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you curious to enter the investment world at Danske Bank and guide our customers in their investment decisions? Join our Investment Concepts team and contribute to developing highly competitive investment solutions that contribute to great customer experiences across the Nordic region.

Join the Investment Concepts Team in the Investment Products & Offerings department

In the Investment Products & Offerings department, part of the broader Private Banking & Investments organization at Danske Bank, we provide the foundation for a highly competitive investment product offering towards Danske Bank’s private customers across the Nordic markets. We constantly seek to enhance our customers' financial wellbeing and guide private customers in their wealth planning anchored by sound investment concepts and recommendations, helping our clients reach their long-term financial goals. The new team member will join our Investment Concepts team, a crucial component of the Investment Products & Offering department. This innovative group is focused on securing the highest standards of quality and innovation in our investment concepts. The team's work concentrates on continuously developing and refining our investment concepts to ensure relevance and value contribution for our customers. Their efforts are vital in maintaining the integrity and effectiveness of our investment recommendations, directly contributing to our overarching goal of enhancing customers’ financial well-being.

In this role within the Investment Concepts team, you will handle both changing and recurring tasks, supporting assignments throughout the Investment Products & Offering organization. Your analytical skills and creative mindset will be key in driving the development and refinement of investment concepts that will shape the future of our customer engagements.

You will:


Develop and implement quantitative methods for diverse projects to enhance data-driven decisions, streamline processes and improve operational efficiency.
Create tools to convert database information into actionable business insights.
Analyse investment portfolios and custody holdings across various customer segments.
Evaluate the effectiveness and relevance of investment recommendations.
Work on developing and refining investment concepts using quantitative foundations.


Detail-oriented quantitative analyst with an interest in investments

We are looking for a candidate with an interest in investments, investment products, and financial markets, who is skilled in developing quantitative frameworks and analyses. Your technical skills, combined with a proactive, open, positive and collaborative mindset, and a wish to engage with many great colleagues, will be essential in advancing our team in a continuously evolving environment. We do not expect you to bring many years of experience, but instead the ideal candidate will have:


Proficiency in SQL and basic knowledge of database schema.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C#, C++, or R.
Curiosity and motivation for handling non-routine tasks and thriving in engaging settings.
Notable creativity, self-motivation and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to initiate and drive projects efficiently.
Proficiency in English and a Scandinavianlanguage to effectively communicate and collaborate across our diverse teams.


Have we caught your interest?

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Morten Melander, Head of Investment Concepts at mmela@danskebank.dk . Please note that due to the summer holiday period, response times may be longer than usual.

We will begin reviewing applications from August 4th, after which we will start conducting interviews.

We look forward to hearing from you and possibly welcoming you to our team.

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: BI Analyst
Place: Herlev, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About The Job

At Flatpay, a rapidly growing fintech company recognized as one of the fastest growing in Denmark, we’re expanding our presence in Denmark, Finland, Germany, Italy and France. We’re looking for an ambitious and curious BI Analyst for our office in Copenhagen, who loves transforming data into insights and developing value-adding solutions to support our growth journey!




About Us

Flatpay is dedicated to revolutionizing the payment industry with innovative solutions that enhance user experience and drive efficiency. Our commitment to technology and customer satisfaction has positioned us as a leader in the fintech sector. With a dynamic team and a collaborative culture, we are focused on leveraging data to inform decision-making and drive our business forward. You’ll become part of our expanding BI team, where collaboration, fun and a relaxed atmosphere are our top priorities.




What You'll Do

As a BI Analyst at Flatpay, you’ll be juggling various tasks related to analysis and reporting on diverse data sets. In this role your main responsibility will be to maintain and further develop our early sales funnel reports and operations reports. With your expertise, you’ll revise and develop our existing models, ensuring that we meet business needs and stay ahead of best practices and technologies.




Your Main Responsibilities Will Include:




Understanding and exploring business needs for data, analysis and reporting
Ensuring data quality and accuracy through testing and validation of data
Developing reports and dashboards (mainly in Power BI)
Support on data transformations and data pipeline (dbt)
Optimizing existing reports and insights based on user feedback
Contribute to shaping a future-proof solution of our data infrastructure




Who You Are

To succeed in this role, you must have flair for programming along with experience in Power BI and SQL. You are naturally curious, and open to embracing new technologies to streamline your tasks. You possess a solid understanding of business processes and thrive when working on connecting business needs with complex analytical solutions. You’re used to working independently, passionate about delivering results continuously, and comfortable navigating an agile environment with a high pace.




Moreover, We Imagine That You Have:




1-2 years of experience in data processing and visualization using Power BI
Fluency in English, both written and spoken (Danish is a big plus)
Great stakeholder management skills
The ability to communicate financial and analytical concepts in an understandable way
A higher education degree in economics, IT, data analytics or another relevant field
Great business acumen and a commercial mindset




Why Flatpay?

At Flatpay, we believe in work-life balance, creativity, and a culture that embraces innovation, where our ambitious colleagues can thrive. As part of our team, you become a part of +900 passionate Flatpayers dedicated to shaping the future of payments in Europe.




Flatpay is proud to be a company that values diversity. We secure an inclusive work environment for all our people and offer opportunities for professional growth and development.




We have free slush-ice, an in-office gym, fully equipped gaming room and lots of other fun stuff at the office!




If you’re ready to be a part of this exciting journey, we would love to hear from you today!




Please submit your resume and cover letter no later than July 14th and we’ll get in touch with you.




About Us

Welcome to Flatpay!




Flatpay is not just another payment solution; we are dedicated to innovating the market for payment solutions and financial services in the SME segment with our customer-centric and transparent services.




Flatpay is more than just work. We believe in fostering a vibrant and fun work culture where our ambitious colleagues can thrive. Our goal? To create the next unicorn straight out of Denmark. As part of our team, you will be one of +900 passionate colleagues dedicated to making a difference in the financial world.




What sets Flatpay apart is our dedication. We continuously strive to stay ahead of the curve, adapting our solutions to meet our client's evolving needs.




Let's shape the future of 7 million European merchants together!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have +5 years of experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible

Title: Data Analyst for Performance Management
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description:

Do you want to improve the performance and customer satisfaction of the Aftermarket division of Airbus?

What The Job Is

This role, based in Copenhagen, reports to the Head of Performance Management (ASAXP) and requires continuous cross-functional collaboration with our Operations functions, Sales, Product Management, Finance, HR, and IT Teams from all our sites in the world.

You will integrate the Business Performance team which is spread across the globe, matching Satair's operational footprint. It means working in multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural teams with a focus and responsibility on delivering pragmatic solutions.

We are looking for our new Process & Performance Manager who is ready to roll up their sleeves and help us develop actionable, data-driven insights and solve business problems, using various quantitative tools and core project management skills. The candidate will challenge the status quo as well as be resolutely determined to ensure operational excellence by speeding implementation across the organization to make a difference in terms of performance perceived by customers.

Key deliverables:


Lead Customer Performance Improvement projects with the aim of reducing/eradicating customer Irritants
work directly with customers to understand pain points from a data driven perspective in collaboration with our Sales organization
Translate customer satisfaction expectations into operational targets
Deploy Airbus Continuous Improvement initiates (Called Airbus Operating System - AOS) deployment in Satair in close collaboration with Airbus Customer Services AOS team (S function) and Satair Functions.
Support operational functions in their AOS/continuous improvement deployment
Benchmarking across the company

How You Will Contribute To The Team

Key competencies needed to succeed in this position


Strong analytical & Problem Solving: Demonstrate exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving skills in an industrial environment, to structure ambiguous situations and to use data analysis to the extent possible to find and drive solutions.
Delivering Results: Ability to successfully deliver end-to-end solutions in complex organisation under tight timelines, working through the multiple constraints along the way with agility .
Influencing and foster collaboration: Innovative leader with the ability to identify opportunities and influence / challenge stakeholders with unbiased view across all functions to gain support and overcome resistance with trustful collaboration, data, persuasion and common goals.
Data Analysis Skills: Experience in Python, including data manipulation and analysis libraries Familiarity with database systems and SQL Ability to visualize and communicate data and analyses
Excellent communication (especially in English): Ability to create synthetic and precise status reports with internal and cross functional teams for reviews with executive and senior leadership teams synthesizing large quantities of data to help create new, step-change initiatives for the organisation. Communicate expectations and requirements equally well at all levels, and capacity to write well-reasoned and data-driven proposals, performing your own data analysis as necessary


What does your next challenge look like?

At Satair, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe. We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow.

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company!

About SATAIR

Satair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers’ orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment.

With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family.

Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

What do we offer at SATAIR?

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options


Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company

Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Satair A/S

Contract Type:

Permanent

Experience Level:

Professional

Job Family:

Digital

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

HTML:
Job Description:

Do you want to improve the performance and customer satisfaction of the Aftermarket division of Airbus?

What The Job Is

This role, based in Copenhagen, reports to the Head of Performance Management (ASAXP) and requires continuous cross-functional collaboration with our Operations functions, Sales, Product Management, Finance, HR, and IT Teams from all our sites in the world.

You will integrate the Business Performance team which is spread across the globe, matching Satair's operational footprint. It means working in multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural teams with a focus and responsibility on delivering pragmatic solutions.

We are looking for our new Process & Performance Manager who is ready to roll up their sleeves and help us develop actionable, data-driven insights and solve business problems, using various quantitative tools and core project management skills. The candidate will challenge the status quo as well as be resolutely determined to ensure operational excellence by speeding implementation across the organization to make a difference in terms of performance perceived by customers.

Key deliverables:

  • Lead Customer Performance Improvement projects with the aim of reducing/eradicating customer Irritants
    • work directly with customers to understand pain points from a data driven perspective in collaboration with our Sales organization
    • Translate customer satisfaction expectations into operational targets
  • Deploy Airbus Continuous Improvement initiates (Called Airbus Operating System - AOS) deployment in Satair in close collaboration with Airbus Customer Services AOS team (S function) and Satair Functions.
    • Support operational functions in their AOS/continuous improvement deployment
    • Benchmarking across the company
How You Will Contribute To The Team

Key competencies needed to succeed in this position

  • Strong analytical & Problem Solving: Demonstrate exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving skills in an industrial environment, to structure ambiguous situations and to use data analysis to the extent possible to find and drive solutions.
  • Delivering Results: Ability to successfully deliver end-to-end solutions in complex organisation under tight timelines, working through the multiple constraints along the way with agility .
  • Influencing and foster collaboration: Innovative leader with the ability to identify opportunities and influence / challenge stakeholders with unbiased view across all functions to gain support and overcome resistance with trustful collaboration, data, persuasion and common goals.
  • Data Analysis Skills: Experience in Python, including data manipulation and analysis libraries Familiarity with database systems and SQL Ability to visualize and communicate data and analyses
  • Excellent communication (especially in English): Ability to create synthetic and precise status reports with internal and cross functional teams for reviews with executive and senior leadership teams synthesizing large quantities of data to help create new, step-change initiatives for the organisation. Communicate expectations and requirements equally well at all levels, and capacity to write well-reasoned and data-driven proposals, performing your own data analysis as necessary

Title: Data Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Dawn Health is a leading digital health company that builds high-quality products for pharmaceutical and medical device companies. We help them create apps and platforms that patients and healthcare providers actually use, while meeting the highest regulatory standards. We're looking for an Intermediate Data Specialist to join our team in Copenhagen.




The Opportunity

As an Intermediate Data Specialist, you will help develop our analytics platform that transforms how Life Science clients leverage data within their digital health solutions. You'll build data pipelines, create dashboards, and deliver insights that impact patients and healthcare providers worldwide. Working with Product Owners and cross-functional teams, you'll bridge the gap between technical analytics and product strategy.




Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain scalable ETL/ELT data pipelines ensuring data quality and compliance –
Create product dashboards and KPI visualizations that deliver actionable insights –
Conduct funnel analysis, cohort analysis, and retention modeling to understand user behavior
Set up connections to new data sources and help evolve our data platform
Partner with product managers to identify measurement needs and present insights to leadership
Mentor junior team members and translate technical findings into business value
Contribute ideas to enhance our analytics capabilities and technical approach




Our Tech Stack

We currently use Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, and Azure Data Factory as our core data platform, but we're always looking to evolve and improve. We welcome candidates who can bring fresh ideas and help us enhance our technical approach. Experience with similar technologies like Tableau, Looker, Airflow, dbt, Databricks, Snowflake, or other modern data platforms is highly valued.




What You Bring

3-6 years of experience in data analytics with focus on product analytics
Advanced SQL and Python skills for product data analysis
Experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker) and analytics platforms (Mixpanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics)
Strong stakeholder management skills and ability to influence through data-driven insights
Product analytics expertise including funnel analysis, cohort analysis, and retention modeling
ETL/ELT experience with tools like Azure Data Factory, Airflow, or similar orchestration platforms
Version control experience and collaborative coding practices
Understanding of healthcare data systems and compliance frameworks (preferred)
Degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field




What We Offer

Impact thousands of patients through world-class analytics platform development
Technical ownership of key platform components in a leading digital health scale-up
Opportunity to mentor others and establish best practices in an emerging field
Access to leading pharma clients and cutting-edge analytics approaches
Open, collaborative culture focused on "Code to Save Lives"
Resources to experiment with innovative technologies and make your mark on digital health analytics




About Dawn Health

Dawn Health is a digital health company specializing in developing Software as Medical Device (SaMD) and other regulated healthcare solutions. We deliver both strategic consulting and development of innovative digital therapies targeting patients on a global scale.

Working at Dawn Health is more than just a job. We are not just looking for new employees. We are looking for deeply passionate souls, gifted minds, innovators, team players, entrepreneurs and people who believe they can change the world. We love to build things, change the status quo, and drive a new digital health agenda that will impact 1 million patients by 2030.

Our passion not only includes the urge to make a difference, and "Code to Save Lives", we're also very focused on our people. There is a great social culture at Dawn Health, and throughout the company you will find warm, helpful, and friendly colleagues. When we hire, we do not just look for professional skills and talent, we look for people who will thrive in our environment, and who will make a good addition to the team and contribute to the culture.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Novonesis
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Data Analyst, Novonesis

We are looking for a new Data Analyst to join our Business Process Support Team. The Business Process Support team is the SAP competencies center in Manufacturing Enzymes Europe MEE, supporting the function with all items related to the use of SAP. The core responsibilities include General support and Training, Software automation (RPA), Technology implementations (e.g. scanners), Data and KPI visualization and availability (Knime and PowerBI), and coordinating off-shored activities. Additionally, the department has regional responsibilities on corporate business processes such as the Annual Budget process (revision for all materials in MEE) and creation of master data.

The team currently consists of 4 people specialized in above core areas. The team supports all 1000+ employees, and a good network and people skills is essential succeeding in this role. In this role you will have the following main responsibilities; Annual Budget back-up and over time take on the main responsibility, creation of master data regional super user, enabling automatization, and data and KPI visualization. Additionally, training and ad hoc support of users with master data and historical performance is part of the role.

Finally, Novonesis has started a major project to combine and update the two legacy SAP systems from previous Novozymes and Christian Hansen to SAP S4Hana. The project is focused on standardizing and harmonizing processes which will enable new ways of optimization. It makes the work more scalable which will add a more global context to the role over time. The Business Process Support team will also play a central role during roll out in MEE.

Welcome to Manufacturing Enzymes Europe (MEE)

Manufacturing Enzymes Europe (MEE) consists of six production sites distributed in Denmark and Germany, producing enzymes and HMOs. MEE has more than 1,000 dedicated employees producing over 150 different enzymes and HMOs in a 24/7 operation.

In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By

The tasks are complex in various ways ranging from data heavy, communication focused, and understanding ‘customer’ needs. Hence, you will require both technical and analytical skills working with data models and various systems and software, as well as communicating in a clear and concise way, to support decision making. At the same time, you will be maintaining a larger network of stakeholders and ensuring a good collaboration and satisfaction. You will work independently, but also work with your colleagues in the team, colleagues in the line of business, and with colleagues in the Global Competence Center in India.

To Succeed You Must


Have experience (5+ years) from similar role with large data management, and relevant education; Supply Chain Management/Production Engineering/Planning/Chemical Engineering
Have profound knowledge of concepts for operations management and business processes
Have advanced Experience with SAP or similar system and data management
Have experience with tools such as KNIME and PowerBi or similar
Possess good analytical skills and communication of information
Be structured, decisive, and independent, with the ability to prioritize, establish overview and coordinate between several stakeholders. You thrive in a dynamic working environment
Possess good people skills and ability to maintain relationships with internal stakeholders.
Be fluent in English both verbally and in writing and competent in Danish with a willingness to enhance


Location: Preferably Copenhagen, but Kalundborg / Avedøre/ Roskilde can be considered.

Application Deadline: 25th of July 2025.

Contact Details: For more information, please contact Rasmus Andreas Prior at RMAP@novonesis.com or mobile: 30771200.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is dedicated to fostering a unique community by embracing and respecting differences. We make all employment decisions based on business needs, ensuring that every individual can thrive, regardless of identity or background such as ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Stay alert: Avoid recruitment scams

At Novonesis, We Are Committed To Maintaining a Safe And Transparent Recruitment Process. Please Be Aware Of Potential Scams Targeting Job Seekers And Take Note Of The Following


Novonesis will never ask for sensitive personal information, such as bank account details, Social Security numbers, or passwords, at any stage of the hiring process.
Novonesis does not make employment offers without conducting interviews with candidates.


If you receive suspicious communication claiming to be from Novonesis, please do not share any personal or financial information. We encourage you to verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us directly through our official channels.
