Title: Data Analyst & Automation Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description:

Satair

Data Analyst & Automation Manager

An exciting opportunity has arisen within the Supply Chain Process & Performance Management team. Drive the digital transformation in our supply chain through Data Engineering and Analytics. Your primary role is to design and implement data-driven solutions and uncover hidden insights to support the business growth.

What the job is ...

With reference to the Head of Supply Chain Process and Performance Management, you will join our Global team of 8 dedicated experts across Planning & Supply Management. Our team was established to drive all necessary projects, continuous improvement initiative and digitalization to enable a fast, reliable and efficient Supply Chain.

In a nutshell, you can expect to:


Implement data analytics and automation solutions to optimise operations
Take ownership of the Supply Chain Data Products
Conduct data-driven initiatives and foster collaboration within the Data community
Drive digital transformation and process optimization across the supply chain
Proactively identify opportunities for improvement and data-driven decision-making
Ensure data integrity and compliance within the supply chain
Lead the adoption of digital tools, robotics, and data analytics to enhance supply chain efficiency
Train the Data Specialists and Operational teams


Less than 15 Travel days to be expected

Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

How you will contribute to the team


University degree in data science, engineering or related fields
3+ years programming in Python and utilizing Data Visualization Libraries
Proven expertise in data analytics and process automation
Enthusiastic team player with a business-oriented mindset
Self-motivated and results-oriented with the ability to prioritize tasks
Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
Good understanding of supply chain management principles
Negotiation level in English


What does your next challenge look like?

At SATAIR, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe.

We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international and diverse teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow, making an impact on aviation’s digital and sustainable transformation.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

About SATAIR

Satair is an Airbus Services company offering first-class material management solutions in the aviation aftermarket industry. We take pride in delivering an excellent customer experience around the clock, driving innovation, and contributing to aviation’s digital and sustainable transformation.

With our global functional organisation spanning 11 sites and locations worldwide, and a team of over 1,900 people supporting a $3.3 billion turnover, you will be part of a truly global company that continues to grow year after year.

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options


Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company.

Please get your application in ASAP as we will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis.

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Satair A/S

Contract Type:

Permanent

Experience Level:

Professional

Job Family:

Digital

HTML:
Job Description:

Satair

 Data Analyst & Automation Manager

An exciting opportunity has arisen within the Supply Chain Process & Performance Management team. Drive the digital transformation in our supply chain through Data Engineering and Analytics. Your primary role is to design and implement data-driven solutions and uncover hidden insights to support the business growth.

What the job is ...

With reference to the Head of Supply Chain Process and Performance Management, you will join our Global team of 8 dedicated experts across Planning & Supply Management. Our team was established to drive all necessary projects, continuous improvement initiative and digitalization to enable a fast, reliable and efficient Supply Chain.

In a nutshell, you can expect to:

  • Implement data analytics and automation solutions to optimise operations
  • Take ownership of the Supply Chain Data Products
  • Conduct data-driven initiatives and foster collaboration within the Data community
  • Drive digital transformation and process optimization across the supply chain
  • Proactively identify opportunities for improvement and data-driven decision-making
  • Ensure data integrity and compliance within the supply chain
  • Lead the adoption of digital tools, robotics, and data analytics to enhance supply chain efficiency
  • Train the Data Specialists and Operational teams

Less than 15 Travel days to be expected

Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

How you will contribute to the team

  • University degree in data science, engineering or related fields
  • 3+ years programming in Python and utilizing Data Visualization Libraries
  • Proven expertise in data analytics and process automation
  • Enthusiastic team player with a business-oriented mindset
  • Self-motivated and results-oriented with the ability to prioritize tasks
  • Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
  • Good understanding of supply chain management principles
  • Negotiation level in English

What does your next challenge look like?

At SATAIR, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe.

We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international and diverse teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow, making an impact on aviation’s digital and sustainable transformation.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

About SATAIR

Satair is an Airbus Services company offering first-class material management solutions in the aviation aftermarket industry. We take pride in delivering an excellent customer experience around the clock, driving innovation, and contributing to aviation’s digital and sustainable transformation.

With our global functional organisation spanning 11 sites and locations worldwide, and a team of over 1,900 people supporting a $3.3 billion turnover, you will be part of a truly global company that continues to grow year after year.

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:

  • Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
  • Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
  • Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
  • Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company.

Please get your application in ASAP as we will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis.

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Satair A/S

Contract Type:

Permanent

Experience Level:

Professional

Job Family:

Digital

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brænder du for at omdanne data til indsigt, og vil du være med til at udvikle innovative og værdiskabende løsninger og rapporter - og løfte den måde vi anvender data på?

Ligger din faglige interesse og motivation i at forvandle data til indsigter og løsninger, der skaber konkret værdi for både kolleger, kunder og partnere? Så har vi det helt rigtige job klar til dig!

Alm. Brand Group er en af Danmarks førende skadeforsikringskoncerner, der består af Alm. Brand Forsikring, Codan Forsikring og Privatsikring. Vi er i konstant udvikling og har stor appetit på innovative data-løsninger, der kan understøtte vores strategiske mål, rådgive og hjælpe vores kunder når de har mest brug for det.

Du skaber indsigt i data som skaber grundlag for handling

Som Data Analyst skal du på den ene side kunne identificere behov og specificere disse i en datamæssig sammenhæng. Hvor du også udfordrer og inspirerer dine kolleger konstruktivt med nye indsigter og ideer. På den anden side skal du kunne udvikle dataløsninger og rapporteringer med data, hvor genanvendelse og standardisering er vigtigt. Dette sker alt sammen med udgangspunkt i vores nye konsoliderede og cloudbaserede dataplatform i et stærkt datafagligt miljø sammen med et fast forretningsvendt team, som har et specifikt data- og forretningsdomæne fokus.

Dine Primære Opgaver Bliver At


Sparre med kollegaer omkring deres udfordringer og behov for rapportering og indsigt i data
Udvikle data- og rapporteringsløsninger vha. Microsoft Power BI og andre dataværktøjer
Bidrage til forretningsmæssige afklaringer og udvikling af datastrukturer på ny data platform
Bidrage med adoptionen af nye og eksisterende dataløsninger hos brugerne
Udarbejde dataanalyser og indsigter baseret på data i samarbejde med brugerne
Vedligeholde og videreudvikle eksisterende løsninger


Erfaring med udvikling af løsninger baseret på data fra en struktureret dataplatform

Vi leder efter en faglig profil, som har lyst til at forstå forretningsmæssige udfordringer og kunne se muligheder i løsninger med dataindsigter og løsninger. Du skal kunne udvikle løsningerne med moderne data og business intelligence værktøjer i samarbejde med et tværfagligt team og i dialog med flere forskellige forretningsmæssige interessenter. Du kan derfor begå dig med både meget faglige dygtige specialister og mere strategisk orienterede ledere.

Derudover Rummer Dit CV


En videregående uddannelse med vægt på dataanalyse og IT
Erfaring med at samle, analysere og afklare behov og krav
Erfaring med udvikling af løsninger og rapporteringer baseret på data fra en struktureret dataplatform eller data warehouse
Erfaring med dataudtræk vha. SQL, dataanalyse og præsentation af data i Microsoft Power BI
Gerne erfaring som business intelligence analytiker, udvikler eller konsulent
Gode dansk- og engelskkundskaber, skriftligt og mundtligt


Din nye afdeling og team

Din nye arbejdsplads bliver Alm. Brand Groups hovedsæde på Midtermolen nær Østerport Station og Langelinie. Her får du godt 50 gode kolleger og faste konsulenter i vores centrale dataafdelinger, hvor vi arbejder tæt integreret i fagligt tværgående teams og på tværs af landegrænser. Du vil arbejde fast sammen med det samme team på typisk 4-6 data engineers, udviklere og analytikere. Du kan se frem til at komme ind i et ambitiøst og meget positivt miljø, hvor alle hjælper hinanden, og hvor der også er god plads til at have det sjovt sammen.

Ansøgning og kontakt

Er du vores nye kollega, så send os din ansøgning med CV snarest muligt.

Ansøgningsfristen er 3. august, og vi behandler herefter ansøgninger. Vi forventer at afholde 1. runde samtaler i uge 33 og 2. runde i uge 34. Opstart efter aftale.

For spørgsmål, kontakt venligst chef for Data Solutions, Ole Michelsen på 3047 8921.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig og håber, du vil være med til at forme fremtiden for data i Alm. Brand Group!

Alm. Brand Group er en af Danmarks største forsikringsselskaber, og omfatter både Alm. Brand, Codan, Privatsikring og Erhvervssikring. Vi er over 2000 medarbejdere, der arbejder for at sikre og forsikre vores flere end 700.000 kunder. Vores fundament er fokus på kunden, høj arbejdsglæde og vores værdisæt: Vi er ambitiøse, Vi er ordentlige, Vi udviser tillid. Læs mere om Alm. Brand Group på almbrandgroup.com. Følg os på LinkedIn: Alm. Brand Group. Vi opfordrer alle uanset alder, køn, baggrund, handicap eller oprindelse til at søge stillingen.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Maternity Cover (7 months)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.






At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.






Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.






As a Data Analyst, you'll be reporting directly to our Head of Data & Analytics and will play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions.


You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices.


Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels.


Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.






This role is a maternity cover role for about 7 months.







What you'll do

Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
Leverage proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.
During your time with us we’re expecting key projects to include: Product-Market-Fit analysis, customer lifecycle insights, as well as supporting product teams.







Success looks like

Exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
Proactive delivery of actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
Development and implementation of intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
Insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
Clear and compelling communication of complex data insights, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
Successful exploration and implementation of advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.







What you'll bring with you

Proven experience in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.







At Planday, we offer you

Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
Flexible remote work
Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities







Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.






At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.






As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.


All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Fredericia, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du nysgerrig af natur og elsker at dykke ned i store datamængder for at finde mønstre, sammenhænge og indsigter? Vil du bruge dine analytiske evner til at hjælpe kolleger og kunder med at træffe bedre beslutninger? Så er du måske vores næste Data Analyst.

Missionen: Brug data til at gøre en forskel

I Bankdata har vi oceaner af data, der bare venter på at blive omsat til viden, der skaber værdi for vores kunder – de danske pengeinstitutter – og for vores egne teams. Som Data Analyst bliver du en del af et dedikeret team, hvor vi hjælper hinanden, deler viden og har det sjovt undervejs.

Vi arbejder agilt med korte iterationer og hurtige feedbackloops, og du bliver en del af et stærkt dataområde, hvor vi inspirerer hinanden til at udnytte datapotentialet endnu bedre.

Dit bidrag – Fra data til adfærdsændrende indsigter

Som vores nye Data Analyst får du en central rolle i at:


Finde, modellere og visualisere data, så både interne teams og eksterne kunder kan handle på dem.
Udvikle rapporter og dashboards i Power BI, der skaber storytelling og understøtter forretningskritiske beslutninger.
Identificere anvendelsesmuligheder for advanced analytics sammen med forretningen.
Drifte og forbedre eksisterende rapporteringsløsninger samt komme med input til automatisering og nye løsninger.
Være en del af Bankdatas Power BI-kompetencecenter og hjælpe kolleger med at blive endnu stærkere på datavisualisering.



De første 6-12 måneder vil du:


Opbygge en solid forståelse for vores systemer, datas livscyklus og dataværdikæde.
Bygge Power BI-rapporter for både interne kunder og banker med fokus på best practice og storytelling.
Sætte dig ind i et avanceret rapporteringssystem og med friske øjne foreslå forbedringer.
Arbejde både på vores on-prem SQL-platform og i vores cloud-miljø (Fabric).



Er du vores næste datadetektiv?

Vi forestiller os, at du har:


Erfaring med Power BI, SQL og gerne også Python.
Indblik i dataplatforme i cloud-miljøer.
En kandidatgrad i fx naturvidenskab, økonomi, data science eller lignende – men din nysgerrighed og praktiske erfaring vægter tungere end en bestemt uddannelse.
Evnen til at identificere de vigtigste indsigter i store datasæt og formidle dem via storytelling.
En samarbejdende, tillidsfuld tilgang og lyst til at dele viden og sparre med kolleger.



Hvad tilbyder vi?

Masser af data at arbejde med og muligheden for at gøre en reel forskel for danske pengeinstitutter.

Et stærkt fagligt miljø med hjælpsomme kolleger og en kultur præget af psykologisk tryghed.

Gode udviklingsmuligheder – vi investerer i din læring og holder dig på forkant med de nyeste teknologier.

Fleksibilitet i hverdagen, inkl. mulighed for hjemmearbejde.

Vil du være med?

Send os dit CV allerede i dag via linket nedenfor. Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Manager Ditte Mølgård Heidi-Jørgensen, dmh@bankdata.dk eller +45 2116 2438.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Velkommen til Bankdata

Bankdata bygger software til finanssektoren. Vi er næsten 1000 kolleger på holdet, og vi udvikler digitale produkter, platforme og infrastruktur, som ca. hver tredje dansker, 200.000 virksomheder og flere tusinde bankansatte bruger hver dag.

Vi tror på struktureret personlig udvikling, et stærkt kollegialt fællesskab og at ambitiøse medarbejdere med fleksible og bæredygtige arbejdsliv præsterer bedre. Bliv klogere på arbejdslivet i Bankdata her.

Hos Bankdata arbejder vi aktivt med at fremme mangfoldighed og diversitet blandt vores medarbejdere, og vi opfordrer derfor alle uanset kønsidentitet, alder og kulturel baggrund til at søge job hos os.

Bankdata er en af Danmarks vigtigste teknologivirksomheder. Vi går på arbejde for at finde teknologiske svar på finanssektorens forretningsproblemer. For at udvikle og bygge fremtidens digitale bank.
Show more
HTML:
Er du nysgerrig af natur og elsker at dykke ned i store datamængder for at finde mønstre, sammenhænge og indsigter? Vil du bruge dine analytiske evner til at hjælpe kolleger og kunder med at træffe bedre beslutninger? Så er du måske vores næste Data Analyst.

Missionen: Brug data til at gøre en forskel

I Bankdata har vi oceaner af data, der bare venter på at blive omsat til viden, der skaber værdi for vores kunder – de danske pengeinstitutter – og for vores egne teams. Som Data Analyst bliver du en del af et dedikeret team, hvor vi hjælper hinanden, deler viden og har det sjovt undervejs.

Vi arbejder agilt med korte iterationer og hurtige feedbackloops, og du bliver en del af et stærkt dataområde, hvor vi inspirerer hinanden til at udnytte datapotentialet endnu bedre.

Dit bidrag – Fra data til adfærdsændrende indsigter

Som vores nye Data Analyst får du en central rolle i at:

  • Finde, modellere og visualisere data, så både interne teams og eksterne kunder kan handle på dem.
  • Udvikle rapporter og dashboards i Power BI, der skaber storytelling og understøtter forretningskritiske beslutninger.
  • Identificere anvendelsesmuligheder for advanced analytics sammen med forretningen.
  • Drifte og forbedre eksisterende rapporteringsløsninger samt komme med input til automatisering og nye løsninger.
  • Være en del af Bankdatas Power BI-kompetencecenter og hjælpe kolleger med at blive endnu stærkere på datavisualisering.


De første 6-12 måneder vil du:

  • Opbygge en solid forståelse for vores systemer, datas livscyklus og dataværdikæde.
  • Bygge Power BI-rapporter for både interne kunder og banker med fokus på best practice og storytelling.
  • Sætte dig ind i et avanceret rapporteringssystem og med friske øjne foreslå forbedringer.
  • Arbejde både på vores on-prem SQL-platform og i vores cloud-miljø (Fabric).


Er du vores næste datadetektiv?

Vi forestiller os, at du har:

  • Erfaring med Power BI, SQL og gerne også Python.
  • Indblik i dataplatforme i cloud-miljøer.
  • En kandidatgrad i fx naturvidenskab, økonomi, data science eller lignende – men din nysgerrighed og praktiske erfaring vægter tungere end en bestemt uddannelse.
  • Evnen til at identificere de vigtigste indsigter i store datasæt og formidle dem via storytelling.
  • En samarbejdende, tillidsfuld tilgang og lyst til at dele viden og sparre med kolleger.


Hvad tilbyder vi?

Masser af data at arbejde med og muligheden for at gøre en reel forskel for danske pengeinstitutter.

Et stærkt fagligt miljø med hjælpsomme kolleger og en kultur præget af psykologisk tryghed.

Gode udviklingsmuligheder – vi investerer i din læring og holder dig på forkant med de nyeste teknologier.

Fleksibilitet i hverdagen, inkl. mulighed for hjemmearbejde.

Vil du være med?

Send os dit CV allerede i dag via linket nedenfor. Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Manager Ditte Mølgård Heidi-Jørgensen, dmh@bankdata.dk eller +45 2116 2438.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Velkommen til Bankdata

Bankdata bygger software til finanssektoren. Vi er næsten 1000 kolleger på holdet, og vi udvikler digitale produkter, platforme og infrastruktur, som ca. hver tredje dansker, 200.000 virksomheder og flere tusinde bankansatte bruger hver dag.

Vi tror på struktureret personlig udvikling, et stærkt kollegialt fællesskab og at ambitiøse medarbejdere med fleksible og bæredygtige arbejdsliv præsterer bedre. Bliv klogere på arbejdslivet i Bankdata her.

Hos Bankdata arbejder vi aktivt med at fremme mangfoldighed og diversitet blandt vores medarbejdere, og vi opfordrer derfor alle uanset kønsidentitet, alder og kulturel baggrund til at søge job hos os.

Bankdata er en af Danmarks vigtigste teknologivirksomheder. Vi går på arbejde for at finde teknologiske svar på finanssektorens forretningsproblemer. For at udvikle og bygge fremtidens digitale bank.

Title: Senior Data Analyst – Finance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Finance team and help us grow smarter as a scale-up. This new role has been created to address the need for stronger data control and quality assurance, particularly to support billing accuracy, Accounts Receivable (AR), Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), and management reporting. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring data integrity, creating reports, and providing data-driven insights to enable more accurate financial processes and decision-making.

This role reports directly to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO).

Main Responsibilities


Data Integrity Assurance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data used for client invoicing and self-billing processes.
Work closely with the Accounts Receivable team to ensure data used for account reconciliation is reliable and accurate.
Support FP&A and management by providing quality data for in-depth analysis.
Data Extraction & Reporting:
Extract, manipulate, and provide data to support the Accounts Receivable team with client queries and account reconciliations.
Develop and provide reports to support group reporting processes.
Provide ad-hoc data and reports to the CFO and management on company performance, sales trends, and financial metrics.
Enable detailed financial analysis through accurate data sets, helping to drive strategic decisions.
Database Management & Querying:
Utilize your technical skills to ensure the smooth extraction, indexing, and organization of financial data across various databases.
Create and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and reporting, ensuring accuracy and speed.
Manage and improve the database structure, ensuring links, indices, and relationships are properly established for efficiency.
Cross-functional Support:
Act as a bridge between finance and other departments by providing essential data support.
Collaborate with the AR team, FP&A, and management to ensure data quality is maintained across various financial processes.

Profile


Experience:
5-7 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with exposure to finance, accounting, or FP&A functions.
Strong background in data extraction, reporting, and ensuring data accuracy.
Experience with tools and technologies such as SQL (queries), Python, Metabase, and Power BI for reporting and data analysis.
Technical Skills:
Advanced proficiency in SQL for querying databases, as well as experience with Python for automation or data manipulation.
Strong knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI or Metabase for creating dynamic reports and dashboards.
Good understanding of database structures, including indexing and linking, to optimize performance and reporting accuracy.
Experience working with data extracted from ERP systems such as Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365), including familiarity with its structure and reporting outputs.
Finance Knowledge:
Basic understanding of finance processes, including billing, accounts receivable, financial analysis, and group reporting.
Knowledge of key financial metrics and how to manipulate data for FP&A purposes.
Personal Attributes:
Hands-on, flexible, and agile with a “can-do” attitude—able to manage competing priorities and adapt to a fast-changing environment.
Eager to be part of a transformative journey within the finance function, with a focus on improving data quality and analytical capabilities.
Strong attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Benefits


Flexible Work Environment: Enjoy a collaborative, inclusive, and open workplace designed to fit your needs and support work-life balance.
Competitive Package: Receive a competitive salary, an 11% company pension plan, and a comprehensive benefits package.
Time to Recharge: Benefit from 32 paid vacation days (5 weeks + 5 extra) and paid parental leave to focus on what matters most.
Career Growth: Access professional development opportunities and grow your career in a high-impact, high-growth industry.
Stay Energized: Enjoy excellent coffee, tea, free snacks, and subsidized lunches at the office.
Stay Active: Use our Spirii gym and shared company car to keep moving.
Make an Impact: Be part of a team driving the future of sustainable energy while working on meaningful projects.


Why Join Us?

As the Senior Data Analyst in our rapidly growing scale-up, you will play a key role in transforming how we manage and utilize data across the finance function. You will have the opportunity to shape the future of our financial reporting, billing, and analysis processes, all while being a key player in a high-growth environment. This is a great opportunity for someone who is passionate about data and finance, and who wants to make a significant impact in a dynamic, fast-paced company.

About Spirii – Who We Are

Spirii is a full-service e-Mobility provider, which offers hardware and software charging solutions to companies in the private and the public sector. Spirii has recently celebrated its four-year anniversary as a founded company, however the people in Spirii have extensive experience working with electric cars and charging, as well as development of future transport- and energy systems.

Spirii is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences. Spirii strives to create an inclusive and diverse workplace, and we encourage all qualified applicants to apply regardless of age, gender, race, sexual/religious orientation, or disability.
Show more

Title: Power BI Business Analyst
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do You Dream of a Career with Global Impact and Visibility in an Ambitious and Growing Company?

Use your skills to shape the future of operational intelligence with advanced, time-driven reporting solutions.

Are you passionate about visualizing high-frequency data and building dashboards that truly drive decisions? We're looking for a Power BI Business Analyst - Operations Intelligence Industry 4.0 with a deep understanding of time series analytics to join our team and help transform complex datasets into powerful business insights.

This is a unique opportunity for a Power BI professional who thrives in data-rich environments like operations, industrial IoT, or manufacturing. If you're experienced with DAX, Power Query, and time-based modeling – and ready to bring data to life – we want to hear from you.

What You’ll Do


Design and develop advanced Power BI dashboards to visualize time-based trends, anomalies, seasonality, and performance metrics
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into interactive, impactful reporting solutions
Aggregate and transform large time series datasets for forecasting, trend analysis, and historical review
Build robust, scalable data models and complex DAX calculations to support advanced time intelligence
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure data sources and pipelines are optimized for time series analysis
Implement advanced features like rolling averages, Year-over-Year (YoY), and Period-over-Period (PoP) comparisons
Support integration with Industry 4.0 frameworks and real-time/near real-time analytics solutions
Document best practices to ensure consistency, governance, and high performance across Power BI environments


What You Bring


3+ years of hands-on experience building Power BI dashboards, reports, and enterprise-level data models
Deep experience working with time series data, including time intelligence functions and performance trends
Advanced skills in DAX and Power Query (M language), with the ability to build complex calculations and custom measures
Strong business acumen and the ability to explain insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience in operational, industrial, IoT, or other high-frequency data environments
Familiarity with data sources such as SQL Server, Azure, Microsoft Fabric, or cloud-based platforms
Bonus if you have experience with real-time data feeds, predictive analytics, or anomaly detection
Power BI Certification (PL-300 or equivalent) is a strong plus


Global career possibilities

At Hempel, we offer a variety of global career possibilities and many cross-functional and cross-cultural working relationships. We strive to create the right conditions for personal and professional development.

Join a global company where employees are truly passionate about delivering the best in everything they do. With business in mind and people at heart, we always work together to influence our road ahead. We want you to be part of our growth journey and of a great global family.

Sounds like a match?

Welcome to apply! Click the ‘Apply for position’ button in the top-right corner and submit your application letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system. Final deadline for applications is 1 August 2025. For further information about the job, please contact Line Friis – lif@hempel.com

Application due

2025-08-01

Seniority Level

Associate

Job Functions

Analyst

Industry

Chemicals

At Hempel, you’re welcomed to a global community of +7000 colleagues around the world. A workplace built on shared trust, mutual respect and support for each other.

We’re on a mission to double our impact. To succeed, we need bright minds and team players. Which is why, from day one, your input, ideas and initiative are not only welcomed, but expected. In return, you will enjoy great opportunities for development in a growing global company – and be part of the solution by contributing to our global impact.

At Hempel, we are committed to everyone feeling safe, valued and treated equally, in an environment where each employee can bring their authentic selves to work.  We believe that inclusion is key to innovation and by bringing together the most diverse perspectives and talents, we can achieve great things, together.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst for Performance Management (H/F) - SATAIR A/S
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description: Do you want to improve the performance and customer satisfaction of the Aftermarket division of Airbus? What the job isThis role, based in Copenhagen, reports to the Head of Performance Management (ASAXP) and requires continuous cross-functional collaboration with our Operations functions, Sales, Product Management, Finance, HR, and IT Teams from all our sites in the world. You will integrate the Business Performance team which is spread across the globe, matching Satair's operational footprint. It means working in multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural teams with a focus and responsibility on delivering pragmatic solutions. We are looking for our new Process & Performance Manager who is ready to roll up their sleeves and help us develop actionable, data-driven insights and solve business problems, using various quantitative tools and core project management skills. The candidate will challenge the status quo as well as be resolutely determined to ensure operational excellence by speeding implementation across the organization to make a difference in terms of performance perceived by customers. Key deliverables:


Lead Customer Performance Improvement projects with the aim of reducing/eradicating customer Irritants
work directly with customers to understand pain points from a data driven perspective in collaboration with our Sales organization
Translate customer satisfaction expectations into operational targets
Deploy Airbus Continuous Improvement initiates (Called Airbus Operating System - AOS) deployment in Satair in close collaboration with Airbus Customer Services AOS team (S function) and Satair Functions.
Support operational functions in their AOS/continuous improvement deployment
Benchmarking across the company
How you will contribute to the teamKey competencies needed to succeed in this position


Strong analytical & Problem Solving: Demonstrate exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving skills in an industrial environment, to structure ambiguous situations and to use data analysis to the extent possible to find and drive solutions.
Delivering Results: Ability to successfully deliver end-to-end solutions in complex organisation under tight timelines, working through the multiple constraints along the way with agility .
Influencing and foster collaboration: Innovative leader with the ability to identify opportunities and influence / challenge stakeholders with unbiased view across all functions to gain support and overcome resistance with trustful collaboration, data, persuasion and common goals.
Data Analysis Skills: Experience in Python, including data manipulation and analysis libraries Familiarity with database systems and SQL Ability to visualize and communicate data and analyses
Excellent communication (especially in English): Ability to create synthetic and precise status reports with internal and cross functional teams for reviews with executive and senior leadership teams synthesizing large quantities of data to help create new, step-change initiatives for the organisation. Communicate expectations and requirements equally well at all levels, and capacity to write well-reasoned and data-driven proposals, performing your own data analysis as necessary
What does your next challenge look like?At Satair, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe. We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan. In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide. Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures. If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow. Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company! About SATAIRSatair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers’ orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment. With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family. Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this. If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany ! What do we offer at SATAIR?At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas. SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely! Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options
Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team! We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.Company: Satair A/SContract Type:PermanentExperience Level:ProfessionalJob Family:Digital By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

      • Delivering Results: Ability to successfully deliver end-to-end solutions in complex organisation under tight timelines, working through the multiple constraints along the way with agility .
      • Influencing and foster collaboration: Innovative leader with the ability to identify opportunities and influence / challenge stakeholders with unbiased view across all functions to gain support and overcome resistance with trustful collaboration, data, persuasion and common goals.
      • Data Analysis Skills: Experience in Python, including data manipulation and analysis libraries Familiarity with database systems and SQL Ability to visualize and communicate data and analyses
      • Excellent communication (especially in English): Ability to create synthetic and precise status reports with internal and cross functional teams for reviews with executive and senior leadership teams synthesizing large quantities of data to help create new, step-change initiatives for the organisation. Communicate expectations and requirements equally well at all levels, and capacity to write well-reasoned and data-driven proposals, performing your own data analysis as necessary
    What does your next challenge look like?At Satair, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe. We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan. In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide. Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures. If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow. Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company! About SATAIRSatair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers’ orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment. With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family. Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this. If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany ! What do we offer at SATAIR?At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas. SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely! Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:

    • Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
      • Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
      • Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
      • Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options
    Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team! We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.Company: Satair A/SContract Type:PermanentExperience Level:ProfessionalJob Family:Digital By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data & Automation Engineer




PNO Group, Copenhagen




PNO is the Nordic’s largest trailer rental company. We are a family-owned company established in 1975 with our head oce in Copenhagen, and with branches in Germany, Finland, Norway, Sweden, Denmark & the Netherlands.




At PNO, we are looking for smart people who are curious at heart and always looking for new ways of doing things. In a nutshell, we are a human-centred organisation looking for team players who bring their honest selves to work every day.




About the job




We are looking for a tech savvy individual to take our data and automation setup to the next level. Over the past years we have built up base infrastructure for data and reporting mainly using PowerBI, PostgreSQL, Azure data factory and Databricks.




We are now looking for someone to help take that to the next level especially focusing more on data sync and alignment between systems including automation of that.




You will be required to have an eye on the strategic aspect in terms of how we structure our data landscape and connect systems, but still enjoy spending most of your time with getting your hands dirty developing pipelines and automations.




You’ll play a central role in syncing and aligning data between systems and automating where it really matters. You care about impact, not complexity, and are able to make strategic calls about where to focus, while being hands-on with implementation.




One day you might be helping design how we align data models between our ERP and CRM, while you the other day will code robots to handle data in our AP system.




Skills, experience and background




5+ years Data engineering experience with ETL/ELT pipeline development and data architecture.
Comfortable navigating real world, resource-constrained environment and prioritising what moves the needle.
Knowledge of all or some of PowerBI, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and PostgreSQL, Power Automate.
Experience working with a stack of loosely connected cloud systems and using scripts, APIs, automated browser robots and similar to bridge the gaps.
Proven ability to design practical data models that connect operational and commercial systems (e.g. ERP and CRM).
A sharp, structured thinker who values rational decision-making and can clearly communicate trade-offs.
Strong ownership mindset and an instinct for simple, high-leverage solutions over engineering.




We invest in your success




An organization with a dynamic team of smart and thoughtful individuals.
A team-first culture with high ambition and low ego.
Competitive salary and meaningful work.
Regular coaching from experienced leaders.




If you’re excited by this opportunity and see yourself in this role, we’d love to hear from you.

Show more

Title: Senior Specialist, eCommerce Analytics & Insights
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about driving eCommerce growth through data-driven insights and digital innovation?

If you have a strategic mindset, a deep understanding of digital analytics, and a talent for turning complex data into clear, actionable insights, you might be the perfect fit for our Senior Specialist, eCommerce Analytics & Insights role at Pandora’s Global Office in Copenhagen.

As a Senior Specialist in eCommerce Analytics & Insights, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our digital performance. You’ll lead the development and implementation of best-in-class website analytics practices, ensuring that data is not only accurate and reliable but also deeply embedded in our commercial decision-making processes.

You will act as the key liaison between Adobe data engineering teams and the broader analytics community, translating business needs into technical solutions and ensuring seamless collaboration across functions. Your insights will directly influence strategic initiatives, helping Pandora deliver exceptional digital experiences and drive measurable business impact.

In this role, you’ll also champion data governance, oversee data quality assurance, and lead the creation of advanced dashboards and visualizations tailored to senior stakeholders. You’ll work closely with regional eCommerce teams and internal partners to anticipate and exceed their analytics needs, while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. We are looking for a highly analytical, commercially minded individual with a strong foundation in digital analytics, stakeholder management, and data storytelling. If you thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment and are passionate about the power of data to drive growth, we’d love to hear from you.

Key responsibilities:


Define and evolve best-in-class commercial website analytics practices aligned with Pandora’s digital transformation agenda
Act as the primary bridge between Adobe data engineering and commercial analytics teams
Integrate Adobe Analytics insights into core business workstreams to influence strategic decisions
Drive data integrity initiatives across all tracking and reporting mechanisms. Analyse, document and resolve inconsistencies while controlling business impact through stakeholder management. Lead advanced data analysis and visualization efforts, delivering insights through dashboards and reports with multi-system data inputs.
Build strong partnerships with regional eCommerce and internal teams to elevate performance reporting and consolidate strategic data needs into clear technical development requirements.
Promote continuous learning and innovation within the analytics function
Mentor colleagues and elevate the organization’s analytical maturity



Ideally, you have:


4–5 years of experience in website analytics, with at least 4 years owning or managing analytics systems
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Engineering, Economics, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
Proven ability to translate complex commercial needs into actionable analytics improvements
Experience with Adobe Analytics (certification is a plus)
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI
Strong understanding of eCommerce KPIs and the commercial impact of digital analytics



Furthermore, we hope to see that you are:


A strategic thinker with exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in data interpretation
A clear communicator who can translate data into compelling stories for diverse audiences
Skilled at building trust and partnerships across technical and commercial teams
Proactive, self-motivated, and accountable for delivering results
Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint



Your new team

Pandora is a company with a big heart, and we take great pride in treating our people well. You’ll join a passionate, ambitious team within an international, high-impact function.

Additional Information

Global Career Band: 5A

Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site  www.pandoragroup.com .

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design, we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Recognised by the Financial Times as one of Europe’s Best Workplaces and ranked #1 among Danish companies, Pandora is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe that reflecting the diversity of society in how we engage with our customers is essential to fulfilling our purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We are dedicated to nurturing a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Mantell Associates is partnered with a pioneering MedTech organisation that is transforming biotech workflows through Robotics, AI, and Cloud infrastructure.




This business is looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Engineer to help drive innovation through data integration, ETL automation, and cloud-native architecture. This is a unique opportunity to join a growing, mission-driven team focused on redefining the future of biotech R&D and clinical development.




Data Engineer - Responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain robust, scalable ETL pipelines using Python to support real-time and batch data workflows
Architect and manage cloud-native data solutions using AWS (including Lambda, S3, Redshift, and related services)
Collaborate cross-functionally with data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to ensure data accuracy, accessibility, and integrity
Develop and maintain data models and warehouse structures to support analytics and operational decision-making
Perform advanced data wrangling, transformation, and validation across structured and unstructured datasets
Monitor data pipeline performance and implement enhancements for reliability, security, and scalability
Document architecture and contribute to best practices across the data engineering function




Data Engineer – Requirements:

4–6+ years of experience in a Data Engineering role, ideally within Biotech, MedTech, HealthTech, or Life Sciences
Strong hands-on expertise with AWS services including Lambda, S3, Redshift, Glue, and related technologies
Advanced proficiency in Python for building ETL pipelines and automation workflows
Deep understanding of SQL, data modeling, and data warehouse architecture
Experience working with complex biological or healthcare data preferred
Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong attention to detail
Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced, innovative environment




Mantell Associates is a specialist Pharmaceutical and Life Sciences headhunting firm. For more information on this opportunity, contact us at +44 (0)20 3854 7700.

Show more

Title: Web Data Specialist
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do You Dream of a Career with Global Impact and Visibility in an Ambitious and Growing Company?

At Hempel, we believe that data has the power to transform experiences – and we’re looking for a talented Web & Data Analytics Specialist to help us do just that. Hempel is a global leader in coatings and solutions that protect and beautify the world around us. Our purpose is to shape a brighter future with sustainable coating solutions, and we’re on a digital transformation journey to better serve our customers across industries and markets.

Your Key Responsibilities

In this pivotal role, you’ll be the go-to expert for web and performance analytics across our digital ecosystem. Reporting to the Head of eCommerce, you’ll help define and implement tracking strategies that deliver accurate, accessible, and actionable data. Your insights will directly support marketing, UX, and commercial teams in making smarter, faster, data-driven decisions.

Get ready to join a purpose-driven team with global reach. In this role, you will:


Research market conditions and translate digital marketing ideas into actionable strategies aligned with Hempel’s commercial goals
Set up and manage web analytics infrastructure to optimize performance of our B2B eCommerce and web platforms
Create excellent user experiences by activating relevant content across owned, paid, and earned channels
Enhance visibility and rankings through SEO strategies backed by data and insights
Deliver dashboards, performance reports, and deep-dive analyses that drive real business value


What We Are Looking For


Solid experience in web & digital analytics, preferably in a B2B or eCommerce context
Proficiency with tools such as Google Analytics (GA4), Google Tag Manager, Looker Studio or similar
Strong knowledge of SEO principles, traffic acquisition, and UX optimization
A strategic mindset combined with hands-on technical skills
Fluent in English – other languages are a plus


Global career possibilities

At Hempel, we offer a global career in a purpose-driven company that puts innovation, collaboration, and sustainability first. You’ll join a new and ambitious team with the opportunity to shape the direction we take and leave a lasting impact.

Sounds like a match?

Welcome to apply! Click the ‘Apply for position’ button in the top-right corner and submit your application letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system. Final deadline for applications is 23 July 2025. For further information about the job, please contact Hans-Christian Schwartzbach – haksc@hempel.com

Application due

2025-07-23

Seniority Level

Associate

Job Functions

Analyst, General Business

Industry

Chemicals

At Hempel, you’re welcomed to a global community of +7000 colleagues around the world. A workplace built on shared trust, mutual respect and support for each other.

We’re on a mission to double our impact. To succeed, we need bright minds and team players. Which is why, from day one, your input, ideas and initiative are not only welcomed, but expected. In return, you will enjoy great opportunities for development in a growing global company – and be part of the solution by contributing to our global impact.

At Hempel, we are committed to everyone feeling safe, valued and treated equally, in an environment where each employee can bring their authentic selves to work.  We believe that inclusion is key to innovation and by bringing together the most diverse perspectives and talents, we can achieve great things, together.
Show more
