Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Temporary paternity leave cover)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Bring more to life.

Are you ready to accelerate your potential and make a real difference within life sciences, diagnostics and biotechnology?

At Radiometer, one of Danaher’s 15+ operating companies, our work saves lives—and we’re all united by a shared commitment to innovate for tangible impact.

You’ll thrive in a culture of belonging where you and your unique viewpoint matter. And by harnessing Danaher’s system of continuous improvement, you help turn ideas into impact – innovating at the speed of life.

At Radiometer, life comes first. Our vision is to improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses. We’re a team that celebrates diverse ideas and continuous improvement. Here, you’ll find a place to grow and make a real impact, with your unique perspective driving us forward in improving patient care. At Radiometer, our vision is to improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses.

Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for


Lead transition from Qlickview to Power BI
Create impactful BI reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams
Maintenance of reports and data quality
Ownership of GSC databases and data flow into these


This position is part of the Business Intelligence Analyst located in Radiometer Headquarter, Brønshøj, Denmark and will be onsite. The role is temporary paternity leave cover with estimated duration of 5 months. The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for analyzing complex data sets, creating impactful BI reports, providing strategic recommendations to support key business decisions, facilitate the development of BI applications that will be used across sites, and lead the transition from QlikView to Microsoft Power BI. Thereby enabling Radiometer Operations to take the next step in analytics and usage of big data.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in using Microsoft Power BI to develop interactive and intuitive dashboards, as well as a strong background in data analysis and visualization. They should possess exceptional analytical skills, be detail-oriented, and have a deep understanding of data modeling and manipulation. The ability to effectively communicate complex findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders is also essential.

You will be a part of the Supply Chain and Logistics Department and report to the Sr. Manager, Supply Chain Development.

The essential requirements of the job include:


+3 years working with Power BI and developing BI applications and skilled or expert in SQL language, QlikView & experience with Microsoft Dynamics Axapta or similar ERP system is an advantage
Exceptional analytical skills.
Have a deep understanding of data modeling and manipulation.
Ability to effectively communicate complex findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with transactional data flow for Microsoft Dynamics Axapta or similar ERP system is an advantage.


Application

We continuously assess candidates and invite them for interviews, so please don’t hesitate to write and send in the application. The recruitment will be completed as soon as a suitable candidate is found. Due to the summer holiday period there might be some delays in the process.

We look forward to seeing your application.

We thank you for your interest. Please read our Applicant Data Privacy Notice carefully here.

Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.

For more information, visit www.danaher.com.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.
Show more
HTML:
Bring more to life.

Are you ready to accelerate your potential and make a real difference within life sciences, diagnostics and biotechnology?

At Radiometer, one of Danaher’s 15+ operating companies, our work saves lives—and we’re all united by a shared commitment to innovate for tangible impact.

You’ll thrive in a culture of belonging where you and your unique viewpoint matter. And by harnessing Danaher’s system of continuous improvement, you help turn ideas into impact – innovating at the speed of life.

At Radiometer, life comes first. Our vision is to improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses. We’re a team that celebrates diverse ideas and continuous improvement. Here, you’ll find a place to grow and make a real impact, with your unique perspective driving us forward in improving patient care. At Radiometer, our vision is to improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses.

Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for

  • Lead transition from Qlickview to Power BI
  • Create impactful BI reports
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams
  • Maintenance of reports and data quality
  • Ownership of GSC databases and data flow into these

This position is part of the Business Intelligence Analyst located in Radiometer Headquarter, Brønshøj, Denmark and will be onsite. The role is temporary paternity leave cover with estimated duration of 5 months. The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for analyzing complex data sets, creating impactful BI reports, providing strategic recommendations to support key business decisions, facilitate the development of BI applications that will be used across sites, and lead the transition from QlikView to Microsoft Power BI. Thereby enabling Radiometer Operations to take the next step in analytics and usage of big data.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in using Microsoft Power BI to develop interactive and intuitive dashboards, as well as a strong background in data analysis and visualization. They should possess exceptional analytical skills, be detail-oriented, and have a deep understanding of data modeling and manipulation. The ability to effectively communicate complex findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders is also essential.

You will be a part of the Supply Chain and Logistics Department and report to the Sr. Manager, Supply Chain Development.

The essential requirements of the job include:

  • +3 years working with Power BI and developing BI applications and skilled or expert in SQL language, QlikView & experience with Microsoft Dynamics Axapta or similar ERP system is an advantage
  • Exceptional analytical skills.
  • Have a deep understanding of data modeling and manipulation.
  • Ability to effectively communicate complex findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience with transactional data flow for Microsoft Dynamics Axapta or similar ERP system is an advantage.

Application

We continuously assess candidates and invite them for interviews, so please don’t hesitate to write and send in the application. The recruitment will be completed as soon as a suitable candidate is found. Due to the summer holiday period there might be some delays in the process.

We look forward to seeing your application.

We thank you for your interest. Please read our Applicant Data Privacy Notice carefully here.

Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.

For more information, visit www.danaher.com.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

Title: Junior Data Analyst & Scientist – Bliv bindeleddet mellem data og forretning
Description:
Er du vild med data og nysgerrig på, hvordan tal og analyser kan skabe værdi i en virksomhed? Har du lyst til at kickstarte din karriere i en rolle, hvor du får lov at prøve kræfter med både analyse, samarbejde og forretningsforståelse? Så har vi måske jobbet til dig!

Lige nu leder vi efter en Junior Data Analyst til vores Marketing-team – en rolle, hvor du får masser af ansvar, læring og mulighed for at udvikle dig i krydsfeltet mellem forskellige afdelinger og stakeholders.

Hvad går jobbet ud på?

Du bliver en del af vores Marketing Data Insights-team, hvor vi hjælper forretningen med at træffe de rigtige beslutninger baseret på data. Du får chancen for at arbejde tæt sammen med både Product Marketing, Digital Marketing og andre nøglefunktioner.

Vi leder ikke efter én med mange års erfaring – vi leder efter dig, der har mod på at lære og har lyst til at bruge dine tekniske evner i en mere kommerciel kontekst. Vi sørger for, at du får den oplæring og sparring, du har brug for, så du kan vokse i rollen.

Når du er kommet godt ind i jobbet, vil du bl.a. arbejde med:


Supplier Management & Analyse: Understøtte Product Marketing med værktøjer, statistik og KPI-overvågning for vores leverandører. Du sikrer, at vi har styr på leverandørpræstationer, bonusberegninger og kontraktstatus.



Kampagneanalyse & Digital Marketing:

Evaluere og analysere marketingkampagner og bidrage med optimeringsforslag. Opbygge dashboards og datarutiner, der sikrer transparens og forbedret beslutningsgrundlag.


Projektledelse: Drive og koordinere projekter på tværs af Marketing og øvrige afdelinger, herunder budgetarbejde, sortimentsvalg og systemintegrationer.
Data & Systemudvikling: Være med til at videreudvikle og vedligeholde vores dataprocesser.



Hvem er du?

Du behøver ikke have mange års erfaring – det vigtigste for os er, at du:


Har en relevant uddannelse inden for Data Science, Business Intelligence eller lignende
Har arbejdet med SQL, Python eller lignende programmeringssprog og har et ønske om at blive endnu dygtigere på området
Har erfaring med databaser og Cloud (Google Cloud, Power BI eller lign.)
Har superbrugerkompetencer i Excel
Evt har erfaring med analyse, dataflows og performance management – gerne i en kommerciel kontekst
Er flydende engelsk i skrift og tale



Og vigtigst af alt: Du har lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vi tør prøve nyt, hjælper hinanden og har det sjovt undervejs.

Hvad får du hos os?


En plads i en international virksomhed.
Mulighed for både faglig og personlig udvikling.
Fantastiske kolleger og en stærk social kultur.
Svanemærket kantine og god kaffe.
Sundheds- og tandforsikring, pension og personaleforening.



Læs mere om os her

Klar til at tage det første skridt?

Så send os dit CV inkl. en kort motiveret tekst, hvor du fortæller, hvorfor du vil arbejde hos os. Ansøgningsfristen er d. 18. august 2025.

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Dennis Rømer Jensen, Head of Marketing Data Insights på telefon 23331102 eller e-mail dennis.jensen@lyreco.com. (ferie frem til 14. juli 2025.)

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Hos Lyreco ønsker vi at fremme ligestilling og mangfoldighed. Vi opfordrer alle kvalificerede kandidater til at søge – uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, religion, seksuel orientering eller handicap.

Lokation Roskilde


Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst – Finance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Finance team and help us grow smarter as a scale-up. This new role has been created to address the need for stronger data control and quality assurance, particularly to support billing accuracy, Accounts Receivable (AR), Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), and management reporting. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring data integrity, creating reports, and providing data-driven insights to enable more accurate financial processes and decision-making.




This role reports directly to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO).




Main Responsibilities:




Data Integrity Assurance:

Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data used for client invoicing and self-billing processes.
Work closely with the Accounts Receivable team to ensure data used for account reconciliation is reliable and accurate.
Support FP&A and management by providing quality data for in-depth analysis.

Data Extraction & Reporting:

Extract, manipulate, and provide data to support the Accounts Receivable team with client queries and account reconciliations.
Develop and provide reports to support group reporting processes.
Provide ad-hoc data and reports to the CFO and management on company performance, sales trends, and financial metrics.
Enable detailed financial analysis through accurate data sets, helping to drive strategic decisions.

Database Management & Querying:

Utilize your technical skills to ensure the smooth extraction, indexing, and organization of financial data across various databases.
Create and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and reporting, ensuring accuracy and speed.
Manage and improve the database structure, ensuring links, indices, and relationships are properly established for efficiency.

Cross-functional Support:

Act as a bridge between finance and other departments by providing essential data support.
Collaborate with the AR team, FP&A, and management to ensure data quality is maintained across various financial processes.




Profile:




Experience:

5-7 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with exposure to finance, accounting, or FP&A functions.
Strong background in data extraction, reporting, and ensuring data accuracy.
Experience with tools and technologies such as SQL (queries), Python, Metabase, and Power BI for reporting and data analysis.

Technical Skills:

Advanced proficiency in SQL for querying databases, as well as experience with Python for automation or data manipulation.
Strong knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI or Metabase for creating dynamic reports and dashboards.
Good understanding of database structures, including indexing and linking, to optimize performance and reporting accuracy.
Experience working with data extracted from ERP systems such as Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365), including familiarity with its structure and reporting outputs.

Finance Knowledge:

Basic understanding of finance processes, including billing, accounts receivable, financial analysis, and group reporting.
Knowledge of key financial metrics and how to manipulate data for FP&A purposes.

Personal Attributes:

Hands-on, flexible, and agile with a “can-do” attitude—able to manage competing priorities and adapt to a fast-changing environment.
Eager to be part of a transformative journey within the finance function, with a focus on improving data quality and analytical capabilities.
Strong attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.







Benefits




Flexible Work Environment: Enjoy a collaborative, inclusive, and open workplace designed to fit your needs and support work-life balance.
Competitive Package: Receive a competitive salary, an 11% company pension plan, and a comprehensive benefits package.
Time to Recharge: Benefit from 32 paid vacation days (5 weeks + 5 extra) and paid parental leave to focus on what matters most.
Career Growth: Access professional development opportunities and grow your career in a high-impact, high-growth industry.
Stay Energized: Enjoy excellent coffee, tea, free snacks, and subsidized lunches at the office.
Stay Active: Use our Spirii gym and shared company car to keep moving.
Make an Impact: Be part of a team driving the future of sustainable energy while working on meaningful projects.




Why Join Us?

As the Senior Data Analyst in our rapidly growing scale-up, you will play a key role in transforming how we manage and utilize data across the finance function. You will have the opportunity to shape the future of our financial reporting, billing, and analysis processes, all while being a key player in a high-growth environment. This is a great opportunity for someone who is passionate about data and finance, and who wants to make a significant impact in a dynamic, fast-paced company.




About Spirii – Who We Are

Spirii is a full-service e-Mobility provider, which offers hardware and software charging solutions to companies in the private and the public sector. Spirii has recently celebrated its four-year anniversary as a founded company, however the people in Spirii have extensive experience working with electric cars and charging, as well as development of future transport- and energy systems.




Spirii is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences. Spirii strives to create an inclusive and diverse workplace, and we encourage all qualified applicants to apply regardless of age, gender, race, sexual/religious orientation, or disability.

Show more
HTML:
We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Finance team and help us grow smarter as a scale-up. This new role has been created to address the need for stronger data control and quality assurance, particularly to support billing accuracy, Accounts Receivable (AR), Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), and management reporting. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring data integrity, creating reports, and providing data-driven insights to enable more accurate financial processes and decision-making.


This role reports directly to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO).


Main Responsibilities:


Data Integrity Assurance:

  • Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data used for client invoicing and self-billing processes.
  • Work closely with the Accounts Receivable team to ensure data used for account reconciliation is reliable and accurate.
  • Support FP&A and management by providing quality data for in-depth analysis.

Data Extraction & Reporting:

  • Extract, manipulate, and provide data to support the Accounts Receivable team with client queries and account reconciliations.
  • Develop and provide reports to support group reporting processes.
  • Provide ad-hoc data and reports to the CFO and management on company performance, sales trends, and financial metrics.
  • Enable detailed financial analysis through accurate data sets, helping to drive strategic decisions.

Database Management & Querying:

  • Utilize your technical skills to ensure the smooth extraction, indexing, and organization of financial data across various databases.
  • Create and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and reporting, ensuring accuracy and speed.
  • Manage and improve the database structure, ensuring links, indices, and relationships are properly established for efficiency.

Cross-functional Support:

  • Act as a bridge between finance and other departments by providing essential data support.
  • Collaborate with the AR team, FP&A, and management to ensure data quality is maintained across various financial processes.


Profile:


Experience:

  • 5-7 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with exposure to finance, accounting, or FP&A functions.
  • Strong background in data extraction, reporting, and ensuring data accuracy.
  • Experience with tools and technologies such as SQL (queries), Python, Metabase, and Power BI for reporting and data analysis.

Technical Skills:

  • Advanced proficiency in SQL for querying databases, as well as experience with Python for automation or data manipulation.
  • Strong knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI or Metabase for creating dynamic reports and dashboards.
  • Good understanding of database structures, including indexing and linking, to optimize performance and reporting accuracy.
  • Experience working with data extracted from ERP systems such as Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365), including familiarity with its structure and reporting outputs.

Finance Knowledge:

  • Basic understanding of finance processes, including billing, accounts receivable, financial analysis, and group reporting.
  • Knowledge of key financial metrics and how to manipulate data for FP&A purposes.

Personal Attributes:

  • Hands-on, flexible, and agile with a “can-do” attitude—able to manage competing priorities and adapt to a fast-changing environment.
  • Eager to be part of a transformative journey within the finance function, with a focus on improving data quality and analytical capabilities.
  • Strong attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.



Benefits


  • Flexible Work Environment: Enjoy a collaborative, inclusive, and open workplace designed to fit your needs and support work-life balance.
  • Competitive Package: Receive a competitive salary, an 11% company pension plan, and a comprehensive benefits package.
  • Time to Recharge: Benefit from 32 paid vacation days (5 weeks + 5 extra) and paid parental leave to focus on what matters most.
  • Career Growth: Access professional development opportunities and grow your career in a high-impact, high-growth industry.
  • Stay Energized: Enjoy excellent coffee, tea, free snacks, and subsidized lunches at the office.
  • Stay Active: Use our Spirii gym and shared company car to keep moving.
  • Make an Impact: Be part of a team driving the future of sustainable energy while working on meaningful projects.


Why Join Us?

As the Senior Data Analyst in our rapidly growing scale-up, you will play a key role in transforming how we manage and utilize data across the finance function. You will have the opportunity to shape the future of our financial reporting, billing, and analysis processes, all while being a key player in a high-growth environment. This is a great opportunity for someone who is passionate about data and finance, and who wants to make a significant impact in a dynamic, fast-paced company.


About Spirii – Who We Are

Spirii is a full-service e-Mobility provider, which offers hardware and software charging solutions to companies in the private and the public sector. Spirii has recently celebrated its four-year anniversary as a founded company, however the people in Spirii have extensive experience working with electric cars and charging, as well as development of future transport- and energy systems.

Collaborate throughout the development cycle – from ideation and requirements to development, testing and delivery, to ensure the Business Intelligence of the future.

Fluent Danish & English




This is a great opportunity for anyone that's looking for growth opportunities with one of the worlds biggest consultancies

Title: Student Assistant - Data Engineering
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Again

At Again, we are tackling one of the planet’s most pressing issues— waste CO2 —by transforming emissions into the solution. Our innovative approach involves fermenting industrial waste gases into carbon-negative chemicals, thereby turning harmful emissions into valuable, emission-free green chemicals. With each tonne of product we create, we remove over 2 tonnes of carbon from the atmosphere. Backed by over $100 million in funding from top venture capital investors and the European Union’s Horizon 2020 programme, we’re poised for rapid growth and global impact. If you think we’re doomed - think Again

What you'll do


Continuous updating of databases for experimental data, ensuring integrity and completeness of raw and metadata
Writing basic data wrangling and analysis scripts
10-15 hours per week, consistent availability 2 days per week required, flexible around class schedule and exams periods.


About You


Undergraduate degree in a subject with data science/coding component (e.g. data science, statistics, computational biology)
Coding experience in R and/or Python and ideally SQL
Understanding of best practices in data management
Strong attention to detail, ability to work independently
Preferred:
Some knowledge of biology/experimental data
Basic experience with cloud data storage and cloud computing

What we promise you?


You get to work with a group of passionate scientists, working on challenging and meaningful projects
An inclusive, empowering and engaging work environment
This will be the journey of a lifetime – we are serious about our mission to reduce over 1 gigaton of CO₂ and you can play a pivotal role in making that happen


If you have questions regarding the role, we would love to hear from you. Feel free to reach out at hej@again.bio. We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: VIE – Data Analyst – Ballerup
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Where is the Position?

 

The position is located in Ballerup, Denmark in Northern Europe, in Customer Care Center which is a multicultural team within dynamic & challenging environment.

 

Which missions will you lead?

 

 As a Data Analyst, you will analyze service data to uncover trends and improve customer experience. Using these insights, develop dashboards and KPIs to guide decisions and boost team performance.Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and deliver impactful, actionable insights. Your main mission will be:

Monitor and analyze key workforce metrics such as staffing levels, service levels, and productivity to support operational efficiency.
Partner with Workforce Management (WFM) teams to forecast customer demand and optimize agent scheduling across regions.
Provide regular performance updates and actionable insights to team leaders in the Nordic and Baltic countries.
Maintain and enhance KPI dashboards and reports to ensure visibility into team and individual performance.
Serve as the main point of contact for KPI-related questions, performance reviews, and data clarification.
Identify trends, anomalies, and root causes in performance data, and recommend corrective actions where needed.
Extract, clean, and analyze case data from bFO (Salesforce) to support service improvements and customer satisfaction.
Automate recurring reporting tasks using tools like Excel, Power BI, or Python to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Conduct both ad hoc and regular analyses to support strategic initiatives and align with business objectives.
Present data findings in a clear, actionable format tailored to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

 What are the qualifications we are looking for?

 

Education: Master’s degree in Data Science, Data analytics, Business or Engineering

 

Work experience:  At least 1 year as data analyst (apprenticeship/internship included)

 

Skills:

Microsoft Office 365 package - Proficient in data analysis in Excel
Proficient in Tableau, Power BI, ETL tools
Knowledge of SQL & Python
Knowledge of Data modeling, data flow, data monitoring

Requested languages:  Fluent English

 

Personal abilities or skills:

Digital mindset
Adept in working with cross-functional and multi-cultural teams, face to face and remotely
Ability to motivate and influence
Curious, paying attention to details while keeping a global view
Well organized

What's in it for me?

Gain international experience and enhance your English skills.
Work in a multicultural and inclusive environment.
Attractive remuneration and social coverage.
Opportunity for a permanent position upon successful completion of your mission.

Ready to Make an Impact?
Let us learn about you! Apply today and take the next step in your career.

 

Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our  IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.

We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.

Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!

€36 billion global revenue
+13% organic growth
150 000+ employees in 100+ countries
#1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations

 

 

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

 

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.

 

At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here
 
Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

Title: Principal Statistician
Description:
Principal Statistician FSP | Global CRO |Denmark| Home Based |

Award-winning global biometric CRO have multiple opportunities for experienced Principal Statisticians to join its growing FSP team.

Partnering with top pharma, biotech, and medical device companies, they deliver high-quality biostatistics, programming, data management, and data science services.

What you will be doing:

The successful candidates will be working as a statistician on cardio, renal & metabolic clinical trials; producing and validating complex outputs to excellent quality whilst adhering to deliverable timelines.

What you will need:

Educated to PhD or MSc in Biostatistics, statistics or a related discipline
Experience within the pharmaceutical industry to have a good awareness of clinical trial issues, design, and implementation.
Familiarity with GCP and regulatory requirements
Experience of writing SAPs, protocols




What’s in it for you:

Recognized as an outstanding workplace, committed to employee engagement, satisfaction, and work-life balance.
Structured training, development plans, and a supportive, friendly environment.
Condensed hours for a shorter workweek.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Fully remote role available in Denmark.




What to do next:

If this opportunity is of interest, please apply now with your CV as the organisation are looking to welcome Principal Statisticians onboard as soon as possible.




Not what you’re looking for?

Please contact Mark O'Brien at mark@warmanobrien.com for a confidential discussion about potential other opportunities in Denmark and across Europe.

Title: Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)
Company: Department of Pharmacy, University of Copenhagen
Description:
Job portal
All vacancies


Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)

The center for pharmaceutical data science education is a joint effort by seven departments at two universities to raise the data literacy of people discovering, developing and helping the right usage of drugs. We aim to rapidly evolve and integrate data and modelling heavy research into the pharmaceutical education contributing to progressing the cultures and mindsets of people and organizations involved in the pharma value chain. To do this we are creating and joining expertise at the universities and the broader ecosystem. The center aims to be human-centric and characterized by co-leadership and high levels of autonomy and empowerment. Read more at our temporary website (cpdse.ku.dk) also linking to the individual departments (cpdse.ku.dk/about-the-center/participants/)

Of the 4 Data Science Specialists, 1 will be employed and primarily located at the Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU. The 3 other positions will be at UCPH, 1 at Department of Pharmacy and the remaining 2 at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology. This job announcement is posted both at SDU and UCPH. Please apply at both universities if you want to be considered for all four positions, or at the university of your choice, if you only want to be considered at either UCPH or SDU. All applications received at either SDU or UCPH will be evaluated together to select candidates with complementary skills and competences.

Job Description

We are looking for 4 passionate Data Science Specialists to lead the integration of advanced data science techniques into life sciences education, supporting educators and inspiring the next generation of professionals in pharmacy, biology, and chemistry, and other areas in life science. The positions aim to elevate data science skills across students, faculty, and staff while offering a unique pathway for professional growth by collaboration across disciplines, innovation of teaching strategies, and contribution to groundbreaking pharmaceutical research.

As one of the Data Science Specialists, you will be part of a team with complementary expertise, including, among other things, system architects, data/database engineers, data analysts/scientists, and programmers. You will also work closely together with course teams to develop data generation, data analysis, modeling, simulation, and machine learning workflows as well as develop custom data science-related materials for teaching. In addition, you will aid the scientific staff in their day-to-day work in activities related to data science research and education within the Center. Actual teaching of students in practical data science exercises and classroom assignments will also be part of the job. Furthermore, you are expected to take part in organizing workshops and other events for employees to broaden the application and integration of data, code, and computational tools in the research at the departments. Assisting with practical tasks including access to high-performance facilities, server/data management, and alignment with IT departments.

The positions are for 5 years starting as soon as possible with the following possibility of permanent employment.

Profile

Essential Experience And Skills

The ideal candidate should have prior work experience related to research and/or teaching within some field of expertise including Data Science and fulfil many of the below listed requirements:


MSc (or BSc plus minimum of 2-years of work experience) related to data science, bioinformatics, computer science or within natural sciences
Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python and/or R
Good software engineering practices (e.g. git, virtual environments, modular code organization)
Excellent data handling and analysis skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, preferentially in both Danish and English
Ability to work and communicate with non-data scientists from different areas
Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team of specialists
Experience with AI/machine learning


Ideally the final team of 4 data science specialists should between them cover these desirable experience and skills:


Knowledge of the drug discovery and design processes and pharmaceutical sciences in general, including e.g. physics and chemistry
High-level knowledge and experience in working with ML models and in particular neural networks.
Experience with teaching and development of teaching material
Familiar with system administration and integration, Linux and shell scripting
Familiar with high-performance computing environments (e.g. Slurm scheduler)
Experience with GDPR compliance
Experience with database design and management
Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)


Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH – Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:


Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience


Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Pottegård (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

  • All vacancies

Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)

The center for pharmaceutical data science education is a joint effort by seven departments at two universities to raise the data literacy of people discovering, developing and helping the right usage of drugs. We aim to rapidly evolve and integrate data and modelling heavy research into the pharmaceutical education contributing to progressing the cultures and mindsets of people and organizations involved in the pharma value chain. To do this we are creating and joining expertise at the universities and the broader ecosystem. The center aims to be human-centric and characterized by co-leadership and high levels of autonomy and empowerment. Read more at our temporary website (cpdse.ku.dk) also linking to the individual departments (cpdse.ku.dk/about-the-center/participants/)

Of the 4 Data Science Specialists, 1 will be employed and primarily located at the Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU. The 3 other positions will be at UCPH, 1 at Department of Pharmacy and the remaining 2 at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology. This job announcement is posted both at SDU and UCPH. Please apply at both universities if you want to be considered for all four positions, or at the university of your choice, if you only want to be considered at either UCPH or SDU. All applications received at either SDU or UCPH will be evaluated together to select candidates with complementary skills and competences.

Job Description

We are looking for 4 passionate Data Science Specialists to lead the integration of advanced data science techniques into life sciences education, supporting educators and inspiring the next generation of professionals in pharmacy, biology, and chemistry, and other areas in life science. The positions aim to elevate data science skills across students, faculty, and staff while offering a unique pathway for professional growth by collaboration across disciplines, innovation of teaching strategies, and contribution to groundbreaking pharmaceutical research.

As one of the Data Science Specialists, you will be part of a team with complementary expertise, including, among other things, system architects, data/database engineers, data analysts/scientists, and programmers. You will also work closely together with course teams to develop data generation, data analysis, modeling, simulation, and machine learning workflows as well as develop custom data science-related materials for teaching. In addition, you will aid the scientific staff in their day-to-day work in activities related to data science research and education within the Center. Actual teaching of students in practical data science exercises and classroom assignments will also be part of the job. Furthermore, you are expected to take part in organizing workshops and other events for employees to broaden the application and integration of data, code, and computational tools in the research at the departments. Assisting with practical tasks including access to high-performance facilities, server/data management, and alignment with IT departments.

The positions are for 5 years starting as soon as possible with the following possibility of permanent employment.

Profile

Essential Experience And Skills

The ideal candidate should have prior work experience related to research and/or teaching within some field of expertise including Data Science and fulfil many of the below listed requirements:

  • MSc (or BSc plus minimum of 2-years of work experience) related to data science, bioinformatics, computer science or within natural sciences
  • Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python and/or R
  • Good software engineering practices (e.g. git, virtual environments, modular code organization)
  • Excellent data handling and analysis skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, preferentially in both Danish and English
  • Ability to work and communicate with non-data scientists from different areas
  • Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team of specialists
  • Experience with AI/machine learning

Ideally the final team of 4 data science specialists should between them cover these desirable experience and skills:

  • Knowledge of the drug discovery and design processes and pharmaceutical sciences in general, including e.g. physics and chemistry
  • High-level knowledge and experience in working with ML models and in particular neural networks.
  • Experience with teaching and development of teaching material
  • Familiar with system administration and integration, Linux and shell scripting
  • Familiar with high-performance computing environments (e.g. Slurm scheduler)
  • Experience with GDPR compliance
  • Experience with database design and management
  • Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
  • Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
  • Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)

Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH – Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:

  • Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
  • Curriculum vitae
  • Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
  • List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
  • Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience

Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Pottegård (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

Title: Commercial Insights Analyst, Lystrup
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you love turning data into stories that matter? Do you want your work to shape real business decisions—like where to go next, what to build, or how to grow? At Terma, we’re looking for a Commercial Insights Analyst who’s curious, analytical, and ready to make an impact.

We are facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes, as we deliver advanced technologies and mission critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industry. Our systems provide security for people on land, at sea and in the air. Therefore, we are looking for Commercial Insights Analyst to become part of this journey and contribute to our overall purpose – securing people through advanced technology.

Your role in our team

With direct report to Head of Commercial Insights, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and presenting market, customer, and competitor data to support strategic, data-driven decision-making across Terma. You will also contribute to initiatives such as product strategy, business development, go-to-market planning, and identification of new market opportunities.

You will become part of our close-knit Commercial Insights team that consists of 5 colleagues who collaborate across the company to uncover what is really going on in our markets, with our customers, and among our competitors. Whether it is helping shape product strategies or spotting opportunities in new markets, your insights will help drive smarter, data-based decisions.

We care deeply about creating a good vibe in the team—supporting each other, working flexibly, and making space for both focus and fun.

How you will make a meaningful contribution

Your Key Responsibilities Include


Dive into market, customer, and competitor data to spot trends and opportunities
Turn messy data into clear insights that decision-makers can act on
Work with ERP systems and databases to organize and manage key business info
Build clean dashboards and visuals that tell compelling stories
Collaborate with different departments to understand their needs and deliver value
Be part of shaping how we work with data and insights across the company


Bring your world class expertise into play

Do you have interest in how data drives real-world decisions? We believe that the right mindset and personality matter more than years of experience. So, whether you are a recent graduate or have already gained some relevant professional experience, we warmly encourage you to apply.


You hold a Bachelor’s or a Master’s degree in e.g. Business, Economics, Data Science, IT, or another relevant field of study
You are fluent in English both in writing and verbal at a professional level. Danish is an advantage but not a requirement
You are proficient in working with data analysis tools (e.g. Excel, Power BI, SQL)
You are able to structure and handle large sets of data and are skilled in both quantitative and qualitative data analysis
You have proficiency in creating visual and written presentations of insights
Experience with ERP systems and data processes is an advantage


With a collaborative and team-oriented mindset, you thrive in dynamic environments that require both adaptability and structure. You take pride in delivering high-quality work that supports informed decision-making, driven by a strong sense of personal accountability and attention to detail. You are good at understanding what others need, not just what the data says.

While you value teamwork and cross-functional collaboration, you are equally comfortable working independently, managing shifting priorities with a well-organized and structured approach. Your communication skills and ability to build strong internal networks help foster trust and effective cooperation across teams.

We are an international company representing world class expertise, delivering complex and high-tech products. We value our colleagues and our meaningful contributions to securing people through advanced technology. You will also experience that we have a strong focus on your development, teaching you useful new competences and further strengthening current ones, both professionally and personally. Our company culture is autonomous and engaging, and we acknowledge the importance of flexibility in a great working environment.

When joining Terma, we promise that you will experience: Great people, challenging tasks, world-class expertise, and meaningful contribution in your daily work.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Benefits at Terma

At Terma, we prioritize the well-being of our employees, ensuring they are well taken care of. Joining our team comes with a multitude of perks designed to enhance your social life, cultural experiences, and health.

International Environment: Explore great teamwork and professional sparring with colleagues around the world

Flexible Working Hours: Enjoy the opportunity to work flexibly and the option to work from home up to two days per week. Internet connection at home is paid by Terma.

Comprehensive Benefits Package: Receive a 10% paid pension along with a beneficial health care and insurance package. Enjoy discounts from various business partners.

Well-being Perks: Opportunity to enroll in our on-site massage-offer at our locations in Denmark

Social and Professional Events: We have an active staff association that arrange a variety of social activities and events to bring all of our colleagues together.

Competence networking across professional experts in Terma: Professional presentations and knowledge sharing across the organization

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

If you would like to take on the challenge of working in an innovative company, we look forward to receiving your application. A resume is required, while a cover letter is optional. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

Do you have any questions regarding the position?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on e-mail: chhl@terma.com

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Bear in mind, that we need you to confirm that you can obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service, and that all adults in your household are not posing any risk to the related risk-evaluation. This entails among other issues:


That you have as a minimum stayed within NATO/EU/MISWG countries for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad, and
That you have not committed serious criminal offences


Terma group has headquarters in Denmark and is a high-tech company developing products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible

Title: Business Analyst to join the Nordic CEO Office
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
With more than 3,000 employees, Deloitte is the largest audit and consultancy firm in Denmark. We tailor solutions across Audit, Tax, Financial Advisory Services, Enterprise Risk Services, Technology, and Transformations.




About the team




At the Nordic CEO Office, we are a team of approximately 10 people, supporting the Nordic CEO and the Nordic Head of Transformation. Our area of responsibility covers both strategy, transformation, and the executive agenda, where we work closely with business leaders and teams within Deloitte.




We are a dedicated team of professionals who work closely together on projects, processes, and tasks. We value a culture based on trust, where we have fun in what are often busy days, and we help each other succeed. We expect everyone to contribute, and for this, our Business Analysts are a vital part of the team.




Job Description




Are you interested in working in the intersection of strategy and transformation? Do you want to make an impact while being part of an inclusive culture based on collaboration, curiosity, and high ambitions?




We offer an attractive part-time student position of approximately 15 hours per week, where you will have the opportunity to contribute, learn, and develop in a variety of tasks while gaining valuable experience from working at a leading global professional services firm.




Your place of work will be at our office in Copenhagen, and the position will offer flexibility around your studies and exams.




In this role, you will make an impact by:




Supporting the executive agenda, communication, and engagement around our Nordic strategy
Contributing to the preparation and follow-up on leadership and communication activities
Developing presentations and key material for our Nordic executive management teams
Performing quantitative and qualitative data analyses to ensure solid argumentation for recommendations
Assisting on cross-functional projects in collaboration with team members
Providing support in facilitating our Nordic annual cycle and strategy execution




Qualifications




You are a student currently enrolled at a relevant university with at least two years remaining in your studies. Your field of study is within economics, business administration, management, or a related field, and we expect you to have demonstrated your skills and have relevant experience from a previous or current role.




You are curious, proactive, with a positive can-do attitude, and you demonstrate a strong willingness to learn and develop through diverse tasks, including leadership communication, data analysis, and structured follow-up on activities and plans.




What you bring to the team:




An analytical mindset with the ability to think and solve tasks through a structured approach
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey insights and key messages from analyses effectively
Structured and detail-oriented, committed to delivering quality deliverables on time
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and thrive in a varied, fast-paced environment
Strong interest in business, business strategy, leadership engagement, and communication
Fluency in English, both oral and written
Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite – especially PowerPoint and Excel




Even if you do not see yourself in all the bullets above, we still encourage you to apply if you believe your skills can make an impact on our team.




Additional Information




Do you want to be part of our team?




Click the "I am interested" button above if you are ready to join our team.




Send your application, CV, and grade transcripts by 04.08.2025. We process applications continually, so we recommend that you apply as soon as possible. Interviews will be held from the start of August.




Expected start date: 01.10.2025 or as soon as possible.




Please do not hesitate to contact Valerie Weihprachtitzky, Manager at +45 52 80 57 20, if you have any questions about the position.




We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender (gender identity and gender expression), sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability.




By applying for this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.




In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. We value our different skills, perspectives and experiences and foster an environment where innovative powers thrive. To us, success is the feeling that the work we are doing will outlast us. The impact we make is not about what we achieve as individuals, but how we enable those around us to be their very best. From professional development to leadership opportunities, we empower our people to be extraordinary by playing to their strengths – because that is how we can make a difference.

Show more

Title: Lead Data / IT Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 30308

Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.

Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We're not just a bank, we're a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.

About This Opportunity

To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you’ll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea´s target payment architecture.

What you’ll be doing:


Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis


The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team


Your experience and background:


Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups


What We Offer

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.

People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 15/08/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance.

Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.

HTML:
Job ID: 30308

Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.

Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We're not just a bank, we're a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.

About This Opportunity

To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you’ll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea´s target payment architecture.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
  • Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
  • Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
  • Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
  • Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
  • Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
  • Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
  • Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
  • Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis

The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

  • Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
  • Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
  • Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team

Your experience and background:

  • Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
  • Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
  • Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
  • Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
  • Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
  • Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
  • Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
  • Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
  • Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups

What We Offer

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.

People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 15/08/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com.
