Title: PV & BESS Analyst
Description:
We're Hiring: PV & BESS Performance Analyst

📍 Location: UAE / Saudi Arabia / Uzbekistan Projects

🧠 Experience: Data-Driven Performance Engineering in Solar & Storage Systems




Ever looked at a hybrid energy plant’s performance data and known—just from the numbers—where it’s falling short?

If you don’t wait for alarms, but instead predict issues before they surface—

If SCADA feeds, Python scripts, and storage efficiency reports are where you do your best thinking—

If you understand that energy generation is just the beginning, and performance is where the real value is—

Then read on.




What This Role Actually Is

You’ll sit at the core of performance intelligence for PV, BESS, and hybrid power plants. You’ll turn raw system data into operational improvements. You won’t just report problems—you’ll recommend exactly how to fix them.

This role is for someone who knows what to look for before output drops, before alerts trigger, and before inefficiency becomes cost.




What You'll Be Doing

Monitor live and historical data from PV systems, BESS, and hybrid configurations.
Use platforms like PVsyst, SCADA, Plexos, and Python/Excel to assess energy yields, round-trip efficiency, and degradation patterns.
Generate performance reports that aren’t just readable—they drive decision-making.
Optimize system behavior by coordinating with engineering, O&M, and site teams to implement changes.
Investigate root causes of underperformance and conduct on-site inspections when needed.
Keep an eye on industry trends, grid code changes, and technology updates that impact system output.
Maintain a clear record of what worked, what didn’t, and how to repeat the wins.




What You Need to Bring

Bachelor’s in Engineering, Renewable Energy, or similar. Master’s? Even better.
Experience with renewable energy performance analysis, especially PV and BESS.
You’ve used data tools like Python, R, or Excel—not just for graphs, but for decisions.
You know SCADA environments and how to set up meaningful alerts.
You understand not just what the data says, but why it's saying it—and what to do about it.
You’re fluent in both technical logic and business impact.

Why This Role Matters

This isn’t about watching dashboards. It’s about extracting insight from system behavior and feeding it back into engineering, O&M, and strategy. Your work directly increases plant efficiency, asset value, and uptime.

You won’t just be part of a system—you’ll be part of how it improves itself.

If you already track the pulse of solar + storage systems—and know how to correct it—this is where your skill creates real impact.

Show more

Title: Customer Development Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
No Relocation Assistance Offered

Job Number #167678 - Copenhagen, Copenhagen, Denmark

Who We Are

Colgate-Palmolive Company is a global consumer products company operating in over 200 countries specializing in Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care, Skin Care, and Pet Nutrition. Our products are trusted in more households than any other brand in the world, making us a household name!

Join Colgate-Palmolive, a caring, innovative growth company reimagining a healthier future for people, their pets, and our planet. Guided by our core values—Caring, Inclusive, and Courageous—we foster a culture that inspires our people to achieve common goals. Together, let's build a brighter, healthier future for all.

Location: Nordhavn,Denmark

Duration: 12 months

Reports to: Customer Development Manager (CDM)

We are looking for a passionate and dynamic Customer Development Analyst to strengthen our team in Nordhavn.

If you are analytically strong and passionate about customer contact and making a real difference every day, then this is the job for you.

Why Work For Colgate Palmolive:


The learning & development opportunities: You will refine your commercial mindset and continue to learn new skills working closely with a cross-functional team giving you exposure to all local market departments.
The challenge & variety: You will operate in a fast paced operational environment, directly impacting the day-to-day performance of the business, with personal accountability for your business.
The global experience: You will have the opportunity to work with global brands, participate in global strategies with potential to develop your career internationally.
The Colgate Values: We are Caring, We are Inclusive and We are Courageous are integral to how we operate every day.


What You Will Achieve


Data Analysis: Analyze sales data from our various customers and find insights that can make a business difference.
System Savvy: Navigate effortlessly in Google Programs, SAP, and GS1 – and become our go-to person for system questions.
Campaign Coordination: Planning and execution of campaigns including forecasting so our products are always available to customers.
Customer Support: Help our customers with various questions, product creation, and much more.
Price Responsibility: Handle price lists and ensure that all prices are correctly updated in SAP.


In addition, you will be an important support for our Field Sales team, CDMs, and actively participate in our Customer Planning & Monthly Discipline.

Field Sales Support


Preparation of sales meetings - delivery of samples/materials.
Local resource for field sales regarding setup and troubleshooting for PC, iPhone, and iPad.
Update our field sales system C4C (Products, Surveys, Store Change, etc.).


CDM Support


Support CDMs in achieving budgeted KPIs through delivery of ad hoc requests and ongoing analyses.
Invoice handling.
Customer-related questions.
Assist with POS data reports.
General ongoing assistance to CDMs.


Customer Planning & Monthly Discipline


Drive interdisciplinary support for the planning process internally and with customer commercial teams.
Manage planning and execution of customer volume.
Work with CDMs to ensure customer financial results.
Coordination of SKU transitions, including planning new/changed price lists and executions with customers.


Who are you?

A highly customer-oriented & proactive person with strong analytical skills.


Analytically strong: You love numbers and data, and you can translate them into action.
System-minded: You are not afraid of new systems, and you learn quickly (thorough training in various systems).
Strong communication skills: You are good at talking to people, both internally and externally.
Proactive: You take responsibility and find solutions to problems.
Detail-oriented: Good numerical skills and an eye for detail.
Team player: You work well with others and contribute positively to the team.
Language: You are fluent in Danish and English.
Education: Minimum a short cycle higher education or a bachelor's degree in business/communication or finance.


Key opportunity

An exciting journey in an international company where you will have the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally and, in the long term, take responsibility for your own customers.

You will become part of an energetic team where your ideas and input are valued. The position is desired to be filled by September 1st 2025.

Our Commitment to Inclusion

Our journey begins with our people—developing strong talent with diverse backgrounds and perspectives to best serve our consumers around the world and fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging. We are dedicated to ensuring that each individual can be their authentic self, is treated with respect, and is empowered by leadership to contribute meaningfully to our business.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.

Reasonable accommodation during the application process is available for persons with disabilities. Please complete this request form should you require accommodation.

Title: Senior Market Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll support the revenue desk, strategic portfolio and other key stakeholders by providing deep insights, predictions, and prescriptions on power market prices using our internal fundamental model. You will work closely with analysts, traders, model developers, revenue managers and originators. Your work will leverage Domain Knowledge, Python, SQL, Excel and our JupyterHub environment to deliver high-impact analytics and recommendations.

Welcome to Trading & Revenue

You’ll be part of Price Forecasting & Analysis team where you, together with your colleagues, will support European Trading, the Strategic Portfolio and key stakeholders across Trading & Revenue. Our team consists of dedicated desk analysts and model developers with diverse backgrounds in power market analysis, business, engineering and mathematical optimization. As a team, we value flexibility, experimentation, and knowledge sharing, working in virtual teams with experienced analysts, traders, model developers, revenue managers and originators. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We encourage women, men, and individuals from underrepresented backgrounds to join us.

You’ll play an important role in:


performing fundamental analysis of power market prices using internal fundamental model
delivering quantitative power price analysis, insights, and actionable recommendations
providing predictions and prescriptions to support trading and portfolio strategies
using Python, SQL and Excel for data analysis, modelling, and reporting
leveraging JupyterHub for collaborative analytics and sharing results
collaborating with analysts, traders, model developers, revenue managers and originators to drive continuous improvement of processes and tools.


To succeed in the role, you:


have a background in data science, economics, engineering, or a related field, with strong knowledge of power markets and fundamental modelling
are experienced in time-series analysis, forecasting methods, and data visualisation
are proficient in Python, SQL and Excel, and comfortable working with Jupyter Notebooks
enjoy working with data, models, business intelligence and analytics
demonstrate strong communication skills and the ability to work independently and collaboratively within respectful and supportive team
embrace continuous improvement, foster innovation, and actively share knowledge - driven by the challenges and opportunities in energy trading and risk management.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist for Group Finance
Place: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Req Number: 96732

Time Type: Full Time

Would you like to be part of the journey developing the enterprise performance management (EPM) landscape in DSV, based on SAP S/4 HANA, SAP Group Reporting, BW4 HANA and SAP Analytics Cloud? Does the opportunity of supporting a global organisation that spans more than 90 countries on six continents sound exiting?

Do you possess analytical talent, and does development of models, reports, and processes, used for FP&A, BI and financial reporting sound fun?

If so, apply now!

We are looking for a talented colleague, who is dedicated to developing and improving the way we do our reporting in Group Corporate Finance. You can look forward to plenty of challenges and continuous professional development in a company and department that is constantly developing.

Join a team of finance and system professionals

When joining Group Corporate Finance at our headquarters in Hedehusene, you will be part of the Group Financial Systems team within Group Financial Reporting and Systems. More specifically you will work with dedicated finance, BI and system professionals who are committed to continuously improving our global reporting processes and systems, and ensuring that all users have the tools, training and support they need.

Your new team values a performance culture built upon trust and openness and where humour, professionalism and results go together, and where everyone contributes and supports each other in reaching our goals.

Contributing to DSV’s journey towards the future enterprise performance management setup

Over the past few years, DSV has successfully implemented SAP Group Reporting and rolled out Analysis for Office and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) across our global finance organization. We have also adopted SAC Planning for our Rolling Forecast processes and are now initiating the transition of Budget reporting to SAC Planning.

As a Senior Business Intelligence Specialist, you will play a key role in shaping the future of our financial reporting and planning landscape. This is a unique opportunity to influence strategic finance solutions, drive innovation, and contribute to the successful delivery of critical BI initiatives within a global organization

In close collaboration with your colleagues in Group Financial Systems and IT your tasks include:



Develop and maintain management reports and financial models for both group and local finance teams using SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Analysis for Office, and BW queries.
Design, implement and maintain functional and technical components of planning, budgeting, and forecasting solutions using SAC Planning.
Actively participate in the planning, coordination, and execution of BI and finance-related projects across the organization.
Participate in the daily operation activities



Curious analytical talent with strong interest in FP&A and Business Intelligence

We imagine that you have at least 3-5 years of relevant experience from a similar role, driving the business intelligence agenda in a global organisation. On a personal level, you have a positive mindset, thrive in a dynamic work environment and are ready to embrace new challenges. In addition, you:



Have a strong knowledge of SAC and SAC planning
Have experience with BW query development
Have an interest in finance
Strong stakeholder management skills
Have a structured and detail-oriented approach to your work to ensure high quality deliverables
Speak and write English fluently
Enjoy collaborating with a team of ambitious and highly skilled colleagues



Want to know more and apply?

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your opportunities in DSV. You are welcome to call Manager, Group Financial Systems, Irina Hansen on +45 61 62 04 03.

We look forward to receiving your application via the link below as soon as possible.

DSV – Global transport and logistics

Working at DSV means playing in a different league.

As a global leader in transport and logistics, we have been on an extraordinary journey of growth. Let’s grow together as we continue to innovate, digitalise and build on our achievements.

With close to 160,000 colleagues in over 90 countries, we work every day to offer solid services and meet our customers’ needs and help them achieve their goals. We know that the best way to achieve this is by bringing in new talent, fresh perspectives and ambitious individuals like you.

At DSV, performance is in our DNA. We don’t just work – we aim to shape the future of logistics. This ambition fuels a dynamic environment built on collaboration with world-class team players, accountability and action. We value inclusivity, embrace different cultures and respect the dignity and rights of every individual. If you want to make an impact, be trusted by customers and grow your career in a forward-thinking company – this is the place to be.

Start here. Go anywhere

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook.

Do you possess analytical talent, and does development of models, reports, and processes, used for FP&A, BI and financial reporting sound fun?

If so, apply now!

We are looking for a talented colleague, who is dedicated to developing and improving the way we do our reporting in Group Corporate Finance. You can look forward to plenty of challenges and continuous professional development in a company and department that is constantly developing.

Join a team of finance and system professionals

When joining Group Corporate Finance at our headquarters in Hedehusene, you will be part of the Group Financial Systems team within Group Financial Reporting and Systems. More specifically you will work with dedicated finance, BI and system professionals who are committed to continuously improving our global reporting processes and systems, and ensuring that all users have the tools, training and support they need.

Your new team values a performance culture built upon trust and openness and where humour, professionalism and results go together, and where everyone contributes and supports each other in reaching our goals.

Contributing to DSV’s journey towards the future enterprise performance management setup

Over the past few years, DSV has successfully implemented SAP Group Reporting and rolled out Analysis for Office and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) across our global finance organization. We have also adopted SAC Planning for our Rolling Forecast processes and are now initiating the transition of Budget reporting to SAC Planning.

As a Senior Business Intelligence Specialist, you will play a key role in shaping the future of our financial reporting and planning landscape. This is a unique opportunity to influence strategic finance solutions, drive innovation, and contribute to the successful delivery of critical BI initiatives within a global organization

In close collaboration with your colleagues in Group Financial Systems and IT your tasks include:


  • Develop and maintain management reports and financial models for both group and local finance teams using SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Analysis for Office, and BW queries.
  • Design, implement and maintain functional and technical components of planning, budgeting, and forecasting solutions using SAC Planning.
  • Actively participate in the planning, coordination, and execution of BI and finance-related projects across the organization.
  • Participate in the daily operation activities


Curious analytical talent with strong interest in FP&A and Business Intelligence

We imagine that you have at least 3-5 years of relevant experience from a similar role, driving the business intelligence agenda in a global organisation. On a personal level, you have a positive mindset, thrive in a dynamic work environment and are ready to embrace new challenges. In addition, you:


  • Have a strong knowledge of SAC and SAC planning
  • Have experience with BW query development
  • Have an interest in finance
  • Strong stakeholder management skills
  • Have a structured and detail-oriented approach to your work to ensure high quality deliverables
  • Speak and write English fluently
  • Enjoy collaborating with a team of ambitious and highly skilled colleagues


Want to know more and apply?

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your opportunities in DSV. You are welcome to call Manager, Group Financial Systems, Irina Hansen on +45 61 62 04 03.

We look forward to receiving your application via the link below as soon as possible.

DSV – Global transport and logistics

Working at DSV means playing in a different league.

As a global leader in transport and logistics, we have been on an extraordinary journey of growth. Let’s grow together as we continue to innovate, digitalise and build on our achievements.

With close to 160,000 colleagues in over 90 countries, we work every day to offer solid services and meet our customers’ needs and help them achieve their goals. We know that the best way to achieve this is by bringing in new talent, fresh perspectives and ambitious individuals like you.

At DSV, performance is in our DNA. We don’t just work – we aim to shape the future of logistics. This ambition fuels a dynamic environment built on collaboration with world-class team players, accountability and action. We value inclusivity, embrace different cultures and respect the dignity and rights of every individual. If you want to make an impact, be trusted by customers and grow your career in a forward-thinking company – this is the place to be.

Start here. Go anywhere

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Excellent opportunity for an experienced data professional eager to design, build, and maintain scalable and reliable data solutions on Azure.

Do you have a strong background in data engineering and a deep understanding of ETL/ELT, data warehousing, and analytics? Are you proficient in SQL, Python, and Azure Synapse, with a passion for transforming raw data into strategic insights? Then you might be our new Data Engineer!

You will play an important role in:

Everllence PrimeServ is looking for a high performing and detail-oriented Data Engineer to support our journey in elevating data integrity, security, and operational excellence. As a key member of our team, you will:


Develop, deploy, and maintain secure data pipelines, warehouses, and data lakes on Azure following the Medallion Architecture.
Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines to automate and streamline deployments from test to production environments.
Enforce robust governance frameworks including access management, version control, and best practices in code development.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive strategic data governance and security initiatives.
Utilize GitHub best practices for branch management, commit standards, and automated deployments to support continuous integration.


We imagine that you:


You have 2+ years of practical experience working with data engineering and ETL/ELT processes.
You possess a solid background in data architecture and engineering, with hands-on experience in Azure Synapse, CI/CD, and data governance.
Have strong technical skills in SQL, Python, PySpark, and experience working with Azure data services such as Azure Data Factory, Data Lake Storage, Databricks and SQL Database.
Understand secure development practices, version control, and access management protocols.
Are detail-oriented, with a proven ability to document processes, maintain high code quality, and adhere to established conventions.
Are passionate about continuous improvement and operational excellence, ensuring our data solutions are both secure and scalable.
Having Azure Certification and especially DP-203 Azure Data Engineer Associate would be a plus as well as knowledge on Fabric/Databricks.


If you’re ready to drive innovation and help us build a well-governed, secure data ecosystem, we’d love to hear from you!

Welcome to the Data & BI department

You will be a part of the Data & BI department and you will participate in the collaboration with the business stakeholders and within the analytical community across the organization. You will be joining a diverse team of skilled and dedicated people operating in an international environment. We have a professional approach to our work, while having a humorous and positive environment in the team.

What can you expect from us:


Opportunity to participate in a function with many exciting challenges
Unique work experience and reference from a top employer
A young, international and professional environment filled with energy
A job in a trend-setting international company
Work-life balance and continuous trainings.


Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

At Everllence, we offer you the chance to shape the future where you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions, while achieving your personal career goals. We prioritize work-life balance with flexible working hours, remote work options, and over 7 weeks of paid time off.

We foster a creative and inclusive culture, emphasizing diversity and equality. We are dedicated to our employees' well-being, offering opportunities to join various social activity clubs, ranging from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.

In 2027, we will consolidate our Zealand locations into one large site in Trekroner, Roskilde.

About Everllence

Everllence, formerly known as MAN Energy Solutions , is a leading provider of propulsion, decarbonization and efficiency solutions for shipping, the energy economy and industry. True to our motto – ‘Moving big things to zero’ – we help key industries in the global economy to reduce hard-to-abate emissions. Our technologies have a measurable impact on the success of the global energy transition. More information about the company can be found at www.everllence.com .

Headquartered in Germany, Everllence employs around 15,000 people across more than 140 sites worldwide. In Denmark, we have over 2,500 dedicated employees from more than 55 nationalities, spread across four locations: Copenhagen, Brøndby, Frederikshavn, and Holeby. Our after-sales brand, Everllence PrimeServ, also supports our customers through its worldwide service-center network.

Build your own Future

Please submit your application to us no later than July 31 2025. We will conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, you are welcome to Piotr Michalak (Piotr.michalak@everllence.com)

Relocating to Denmark is a major step for our international colleagues. To support this transition, we offer tailored intercultural and global mindset training for all employees and managers, promoting a collaborative and inclusive work environment. Our mobility package includes assistance with obtaining a Danish CPR number, tax information, and work permits,

At Everllence, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position.

Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Scientist




What’s more meaningful than seeing the real-world impact of your work?




Ok, maybe ending world hunger, but this is a strong second.

At OOONO, you’re not just building models in a notebook. You’re shaping the algorithms that directly power a physical product - used in real time by real people in the real world.

Join a small, collaborative team where you’re trusted to take ownership, test bold ideas, and push things into production. You’ll work hands-on with rich geospatial data to make our location logic smarter and faster.

And you’ll do it side by side with engineers, hardware specialists, and designers who genuinely care - about the product, the users, and each other.

What you’ll be doing

Develop and improve core algorithms to enhance product performance and user experience.
Contribute to map matching logic and road network analysis to improve location accuracy
Design, build, and maintain predictive models to solve complex business challenges.
Analyze large-scale data sets from Athena, MongoDB, and other sources to extract actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Software, Hardware, UX/UI) to implement data-driven solutions.
Experiment with cutting-edge geospatial tools and frameworks to continuously improve analytical workflows.
Handle location data and geo spatial field.




We imagine you’re someone who has

A master’s degree in data science, geoinformatics or similar field
Proven experience (3+ years) in a Data Science role or similar, ideally within a tech environment and working with geospatial data
Proficiency in Python, including libraries such as Polars, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, and geospatial libraries like GeoPandas, Shapely, Pyproj, Folium, Osmnx
Knowledge of geospatial analysis techniques (e.g., spatial joins, indexing, projections).
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, and algorithm development.
Solid problem-solving skills and ability to work independently when needed
Hands-on person that can drive processes from A to B independently
English is a requirement.
Self-driven




How is it working at OOONO?

We’re glad we asked. It’s a nice working place. As in nice-nice. We have a relaxed, informal atmosphere and a flat hierarchy. Whenever you need a break from your important work stuff, you can get beat in table tennis, foosball, or just smalltalk about the weather by the coffee machine. We have monthly social events where we do anything from go-karting to going to festivals.

And when we’re not social? Then we’re pretty damn ambitious. We don’t like conservative targets or linear growth. We’re all about the extraordinary. This has led OOONO to become one of the fastest-growing tech scaleups and surprise-surprise: We have no plans of slowing down. So yes, OOONO is a lovely place to work, but it’s also a pretty good opportunity to develop as a person and take the next steps in your career.




The practical stuff

Start date: ASAP
Send your motivated CV to job@ooono.dk
Working hours: Full-time (37 hours)
Location: Gearhalsvej 1.1, 2500 Valby




Please note: To be considered for this position, you must be currently living in Denmark.

Show more

Title: Student Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Student Developer

Join our team at Copenhagen Energy Trading




Do you want to be part of a fast-growing energy company with high ambitions, a tech-driven mindset, and plenty of room for personal and professional development? Are you passionate about green energy, software development, and analytics?




Then take a look at this exciting opportunity to develop your skills at Copenhagen Energy Trading – a young and fast-growing energy trading company based in Copenhagen.




What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll join our Tech team, where we build tools that support every part of the trading process – from data pipelines and forecasting models to trading dashboards and automated systems. Everything is built in Python, and we maintain a high standard for clean, well-structured code.




As a student developer, you’ll:

Work on real production tools (not just side projects)
Improve your Python and analytics skills
Learn about power markets and how tech enables trading
Make a real impact from day one, with plenty of freedom and responsibility




You’ll be part of an open and collaborative culture where honesty and transparency shape how we work and grow together. We believe in giving you autonomy, flexibility, and trust, and if things go well, this could lead to a full-time position after graduation.




What We Offer

A student position (15-20 hours per week) with flexible working hours to ensure that you can balance work and studies without compromise
Work alongside experienced and ambitious teammates who set a high bar for quality, and learn what professional software development looks like in the real world.
The opportunity to build your influence and leave your fingerprint on the way we work in a young and fast-growing company
A steep learning curve in a fast-moving, tech-first environment
Competitive pay, team events, and a super friendly vibe
A potential path to a full-time role after graduation




What We’re Looking For

Currently studying a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Passionate about software development with strong programming skills in Python. Experience with other programming languages, such as Go, Rust, or .NET is an advantage but not a requirement
Familiarity with Git and SQL
Interest in energy markets, trading, or solving complex technical problems
A proactive mindset and eagerness to learn from a fast-paced team
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
Bonus: Experience running software in production or building personal projects




Who We Are

Copenhagen Energy Trading A/S was founded in 2021 and is part of Copenhagen Energy Group.




We specialise in short-term power trading across Europe and North America. Technology is at the heart of our operations, supported by a team of top-tier talent. Driven by data and technology, we use deep insights into electricity markets to create discretionary and algorithmic trading strategies that efficiently move power to where it’s needed most.




We believe in a culture of collaborative growth and do not have a system of bureaucratic policies or rigid hierarchy. We support a strong sense of team spirit, surrounded by a like-minded team and an easy-going work culture.




Interested?

All applicants are welcome. At Copenhagen Energy Trading, we believe that diversity, equality, and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace that enables us to be innovative and creative. We interview candidates continuously and may select the right candidate prior to the expiry of the job ad. So please do not hesitate to apply.




Application Deadline: August 1, 2025

To apply, submit your cover letter, CV and relevant school diplomas. For more information, you are welcome to contact Jens Christian Johannsen (CTO) at jcj@copenhagen-energy.com or our Recruitment Manager, Anna Schumann, at as@copenhagen-energy.com.

Title: Senior Power BI Consultant
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen

Apply now

Details

Type of contract: Permanent

Location(s): Copenhagen

Language(s): Danish

Mobility: N/A

Application Deadline: 04/08/2025

Senior Power BI Consultant – Turn Analytics into Your Playground!

Are you the kind of person who gets excited about dashboards and loves finding the story behind the numbers? Do you enjoy leading the way, inspiring your clients and colleagues to see data in a new light? If so, you might be the next addition to our great data team at NNIT, as a Senior Power BI Consultant!

What To Expect

At NNIT Data and Application Innovation, you will join a vibrant team where curiosity is celebrated, and learning is part of everyday life. Here, your structured thinking pairs with your desire to shake things up—we believe the best ideas spark when passion and know-how meet creativity.

You will be colleague to more than 60 professional colleagues in both Denmark, the Czech Republic and the Philippines in the area of data and Business applications, part of a larger Microsoft technology strategic area in NNIT and will have more than 1700 across NNIT worldwide.

Besides a strong technical foundation, we also excel in having a consulting mindset and a commercial drive. We understand our customers’ business and aim to position ourselves as trusted advisors to our customers.

What will you be doing?

Leading exciting Power BI projects from data structuring to beautiful, actionable dashboards

Working closely with customers to truly understand their needs—and then surprising them with insights they hadn’t imagined

Coding with DAX and other data models that make even the most complex challenges look easy

Guiding and mentoring junior teammates, because sharing knowledge is just how you roll

Always looking for new ways to make analytics inspiring, useful, and fun for everyone involved

Keeping pace with the newest trends and tricks in Power BI—because you love staying ahead of the curve

Who are you?

You have 6+ years of Power BI wizardry under your belt

DAX and data modeling? That’s your playground

You’ve led BI projects and enjoy being the go-to expert for clients and colleagues alike

Bonus points if you know your way around the Life Science industry

Master’s degree is a plus (but your passion and skills will impress us either way)

You’re a strong communicator—in English (and maybe Danish too?)

You’re structured, curious, proactive, and love solving problems

Most of all, you thrive in a team where knowledge sharing and open minds drive what we do

Join NNIT and make your mark!

At NNIT, we are passionate people building winning teams with our customers. We develop high quality and value adding software applications. We are customer obsessed, driven by our company’s core values, open and honest, conscience driven and value adding.

We emphasize quality in our delivery and ongoing development of our skill sets, processes and services. It is important for us that you continuously develop both personally and professionally. Therefore, we focus on your skills through interesting assignments, relevant professional training and personal development plans.

Ready to turn data into insights—and have fun doing it? Then apply today rather than tomorrow as we interview candidates continuously.

About NNIT

NNIT is a publicly listed company that specializes in IT solutions to life sciences internationally, and to the public and enterprise sectors in Denmark. We focus on high complexity industries and thrive in environments where regulatory demands and complexity are high. We advise on and build sustainable digital solutions that work for the patients, citizens, employees, end users or customers. NNIT consists of group company NNIT A/S and subsidiaries SCALES, Excellis Health Solutions and SL Controls. Together, these companies employ more than 1,800 people in Europe, Asia, and USA.

We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All candidates are encouraged to apply for the given job regardless of their gender, age, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, national and social origin, political opinion, disability, race, skin colour, and ethnic origin.

In the interest of fostering a fair and unbiased recruitment process, we kindly request candidates to refrain from including their pictures in their applications.

Learn more about working at NNIT

Apply now and liberate your talent!
Show more

Keeping pace with the newest trends and tricks in Power BI—because you love staying ahead of the curve

Who are you?

You have 6+ years of Power BI wizardry under your belt

DAX and data modeling? That’s your playground

You’ve led BI projects and enjoy being the go-to expert for clients and colleagues alike

Bonus points if you know your way around the Life Science industry

Master’s degree is a plus (but your passion and skills will impress us either way)

You’re a strong communicator—in English (and maybe Danish too?)

You’re structured, curious, proactive, and love solving problems

Most of all, you thrive in a team where knowledge sharing and open minds drive what we do

Join NNIT and make your mark!

At NNIT, we are passionate people building winning teams with our customers. We develop high quality and value adding software applications. We are customer obsessed, driven by our company’s core values, open and honest, conscience driven and value adding.

We emphasize quality in our delivery and ongoing development of our skill sets, processes and services. It is important for us that you continuously develop both personally and professionally. Therefore, we focus on your skills through interesting assignments, relevant professional training and personal development plans.

Ready to turn data into insights—and have fun doing it? Then apply today rather than tomorrow as we interview candidates continuously.

About NNIT

NNIT is a publicly listed company that specializes in IT solutions to life sciences internationally, and to the public and enterprise sectors in Denmark. We focus on high complexity industries and thrive in environments where regulatory demands and complexity are high. We advise on and build sustainable digital solutions that work for the patients, citizens, employees, end users or customers. NNIT consists of group company NNIT A/S and subsidiaries SCALES, Excellis Health Solutions and SL Controls. Together, these companies employ more than 1,800 people in Europe, Asia, and USA.

We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All candidates are encouraged to apply for the given job regardless of their gender, age, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, national and social origin, political opinion, disability, race, skin colour, and ethnic origin.

In the interest of fostering a fair and unbiased recruitment process, we kindly request candidates to refrain from including their pictures in their applications.

Learn more about working at NNIT

Apply now and liberate your talent!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you excited about the chance to shape and contribute to BESTSELLER’s journey towards becoming more data driven?

Then BESTSELLER TECH may be just the place for you!

YOUR TEAM

You will help shape a self-organised, agile team of Data Engineers responsible for enabling BESTSELLER TECH teams to interact with data. We share a passion for new and open-source technologies, and with us, you will experience a high degree of autonomy and have a direct impact on the solutions we build.

We make fast decisions, encourage experimentation, and move quickly from idea to execution.

YOUR ROLE

You will play a key role in shaping how we interact and share data both within and outside of BESTSELLER – from building data products to setting API standards. Our ambition in BESTSELLER TECH is to empower every team to connect with data. This means you will engage with a wide range of both technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organisation.

As a Data Engineer in our Data Integration Services (DIS) team, you will have the chance to:


Impact our data strategy and how BESTSELLER TECH works with data.
Onboard stakeholders onto a modern data platform built on Snowflake, dbt and managed with Terraform.
Act as a trusted advisor on Kafka as well as continue to evolve our Kafka setup.
Integrate and manage data from various sources such as Kafka, custom APIs, and cloud services.
Stay at the forefront of technological advancements, constantly learning and exploring new possibilities within the field.


What We Offer


An exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
A collaborative and supportive team culture, where we succeed together.
An extensive and modern data stack.
Opportunities for continuous learning and development, helping you grow as a professional and explore new areas of expertise.


YOUR PROFILE

We hire attitude and train for skills - so your most important qualifications will be your curiosity and eagerness to explore and work with data technologies. You enjoy translating complexity into clarity and are energized by helping others grow.

We’re looking for someone who is:


Collaborative and people oriented. You thrive when teaching, facilitating, and supporting peers.
Comfortable working independently as well as part of a team.
A strong problem solver who takes ownership and enjoys seeing things through.
Positive and energetic – someone who values collaboration, innovation, and a good laugh.


Your technical toolbox includes:


Expertise in Python development.
Proficiency in SQL.
Understanding of distributed systems and experience with Kafka or similar is a plus.
Passionate technologist with thirst for knowledge and desire to learn.


WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU!

If you have any questions, please contact Peter Brøndum on +45 52 15 17 26. Otherwise, send us your CV and application as soon as possible and no later than 22 July 2025.

We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the ad when we have found the right candidate.

LOCATION: We have a hybrid workplace, so your daily work will be carried out both from one of our offices and online from where you are.

CURIOUS FOR MORE?

Get a glimpse of what life is like in BESTSELLER TECH by following #bestsellertech on LinkedIn.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 400 people strong, located in Denmark, Spain and Rwanda. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more

Title: Quantitative Analyst for US Power Trading
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Quantitative Analyst for US Trading

At MFT Energy, we trade energy to make markets efficient and drive the green transition.  

We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious US Power Trading team. This is your opportunity to play a key role in a small fast growing trading team in the dynamic and evolving US power market, working alongside talented traders who share your drive for excellence and innovation. 

Our US Power Trading team is based across Aarhus (HQ), New York, and Revelstoke, Canada – offering you a truly international work environment where collaboration across borders is part of everyday life. As part of the onboarding, we’re looking for someone who’s open to spending time in Canada – whether for a shorter or longer stay – working side by side with our team in Revelstoke to build strong connections and gain first-hand experience in our trading setup.

Why join us?  

At MFT Energy, we combine a startup mindset with the strength of a global organization. We believe in empowering individuals to make data-driven decisions in a fast-paced environment where collaboration, innovation, and entrepreneurial thinking are the cornerstones of our success.  

As a quantitative analyst in MFT, you’ll be at the heart of our US power trading team, which specializes in navigating one of the world’s most complex and fast-moving energy markets.  

Here’s what you’ll be doing: 


Modelling: Build Mathematical models to support trading strategies. 
Data infrastructure: Enhance and streamline data pipelines, ensuring robust analytics and efficient operations. 
 Team collaboration: Work closely with experienced and data driven traders and software developers to translate market insights into actionable tools and models. 
 Innovation: Research and implement new technologies and methodologies to stay ahead in energy market modeling and analytics. 


What we’re looking for: 

We’re looking for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments and is eager to solve complex problems from the ground up with next-level curiosity. Being a successful quantitative analyst in MFT Energy isn’t just about having a strong track record. It’s about bringing your experience and skills into play while staying curious, driven, and open to learning.

Skills We Believe Are Important For Success


Master’s or PhD in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics or another quantitative field. 
Proficiency in Python and a statically typed programming language. 
Experience designing and maintaining reliable, automated systems. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills preferable with strong knowledge of Statistics.  
Fluent in English, both written and spoken. 
At least 1-2 years of experience within commodity trading


You should expect technical tests as part of the recruitment process.

What we offer 


A dynamic, entrepreneurial work environment where the best ideas win. 
Talented and ambitious colleagues who challenge and support you. 
Competitive benefits and a people-first leadership approach. 
A workplace that gives you energy rather than drains it – though we’ll admit, the first few onboarding months can be intense.


Make the most of your talent! Join us! 

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations. Please send us the following information: your CV, a link to your GitHub or other passion projects examples, your grades, and answers to the four questions in the application form. No cover letter needed. 

For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com. 

Start date: As soon as possible 

We will be screening and interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis. 

As a global and independent energy trading hub, we specialize in power, gas, and environmentals trading 24/7 in 41 countries. At MFT Energy, we innovate energy trading through our people and technology, supported by our unique partner model. Our belief is that fostering a sense of ownership among employees is the most effective way to advance our business.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
As we’re continuing our journey towards becoming the best bite-sized audio platform in the world, we need more manpower within the Artificial Intelligence team. Our senior data scientists are producing high value algorithms which need to be put in production early in the development process in order to ensure fast product iterations and best quality results.

We are looking for an experienced data engineer to support the AI team with developing and putting their data products into production. More generally the machine learning engineer will help enforcing best practices, implement innovative solution architectures and build a lean data organization.

Your role will be bridging the AI team with both the data engineering team and the tech team. This implies the ability to both understand the requirements coming from machine learning based products and the current technical architecture of our products in order to ensure seamless and efficient integration.

You will help the teams bring ideas from conception to release while advocating for clean and understandable solutions along the whole journey. You are an effective diplomat with strong communication and organizational skills. You are patient, understanding, ego-free, and eager to give and receive constructive feedback.

Expected start date: Soon! - but we’re flexible.

You will be tasked with:


Managing a dedicated Kubernetes cluster
Implement CI/DC pipelines for data products
Define and implement complex data processing pipelines
Building micro-services for connecting internal and external services
Help integrate algorithm-generated data into our Elastic Search search engine


We expect you to bring:


Solid hands on experience with Kubernetes is a must
Knowledge of search principles and technologies. Knowledge of vector search
Good experience with Google Cloud Platform products incl. BigQuery, Kubernetes, Composer (Airflow), PubSub, etc.
Fluency in languages such as Python, Rust and C# or F#
Advanced Level in SQL
Experience in working within an agile, intensely iterative requirements and development process
Effective communication skills, with ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical resources and peers
Self-motivated and self-managing
Comfortable with a dynamic and fast-paced start-up environment
Experience in creating a performant infrastructure for data collection, storage, processing and exposure, preferably with Google Cloud
Solid experience with designing scalable and reliable data processes including handling with data pipelines and ETL processes


These are the benefits


Up to six months of fully paid parental leave (up to 6 months) for all new parents - no matter your gender and no matter where in the world you live.
Participation in our ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Program)
Learning and development opportunities to make sure you stay on top of the game
Flexible work. Opportunity to work flexible hours and remote
The chance to make an impact at an international company and see your work pay off immediately
Delicious free lunch with great colleagues


This is us

Founded in Copenhagen in 2019, Podimo is a platform for podcast and audiobook lovers as well as audio content creators. Our app puts a world of podcasts and audiobooks at your fingertips. Our revenue-sharing model rewards creators for making content that people want to hear – whether they have an established following or a niche audience.

We're a courageous and curious bunch. We respect our coworkers’ ideas, opinions, and time, approach our work with integrity and humility, and recognize the value everyone brings. We believe we are better together and have zero time for brilliant jerks.

We’re fiercely passionate about creating, finding, and hearing great stories. We care for our creators and the beautiful stories they share and we have massive respect for their process as we help them bring their stories to life. We love what we do, but more importantly, we love to have a good time doing it.

For more information or questions please contact us at benjamin@podimo.com or phone number 51913590
Show more

Title: Client Service Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a dedicated and talented Client Service Analyst to join our Client Services Team in Denmark.

In this full-time role, you’ll be a key partner to leading pharmaceutical brands, ensuring the success of their sales data deliveries, and transforming insights into impact.

The office is located in Nørrebro (Titanhus)

Position: Client Service Analyst, sales data for pharmaceuticals.

As a Client Service Analyst in our Team, you will be the primary point of contact for our customers, providing exceptional support and guidance. You will build strong professional relationships with your allocated clients, assisting them with queries, support, and trainings on our current deliveries. Your role will also involve ensuring accurate and timely communication of support issues to relevant departments. Some business travel within the Nordic countries may be required for trainings and meetings.

Key Responsibilities:


Build strong client relationships by delivering clear, proactive support on both current and new data deliveries.
Conduct research, analysis, and create reports to respond to client requests and inquiries.
Perform first-line data investigation.
Conduct customized client training sessions on current front-end tools.
Report internally on projects, actions, follow-ups, and opportunities.


Skills and Competencies:


Fluent in Danish and English (mandatory)
Strong analytical mindset
Client-focused with excellent communication skills
Willingness to learn new solutions, tools, and processes.
Organized and solution-oriented
Proficient in Microsoft Office and experience with various BI tools


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience from the Healthcare and Pharma industry.
Proficiency in an additional Nordic language
Strong team spirit and a proactive, client-focused mindset


Why Join Us?

At IQVIA Nordics, we believe in fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment. We offer opportunities for growth and development, and we are committed to making a positive impact on the healthcare industry. Join our team and be part of a company that values innovation, excellence, and teamwork.

Apply Now! We look forward to receiving your application. Come and join our great team and help us move healthcare further!

Please note that the recruitment process will only start as of August due to the holiday period. Thank you for your patience!

IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Content Associate (WM)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

As a Wolt Market Content Associate you are responsible for creating and enhancing the retail selection in the Wolt Market online catalogue. This is a 1-year fixed-term position (maternity cover) where you’ll play an important role in ensuring a Wolt-class customer experience and driving conversion.

In this role, you’ll get a lot of help and support on the way, but are also expected to be an amazing independent specialist with an exceptional ability to execute every single day.

What you’ll be doing


Customers First: Take customer signals and their suggestions to improve the catalogue further.
Passion for Details: Responsible that the Product content is accurate and up-to-date, as far as it concerns relevant product information and other customer-relevant parameters such as accurate meta-data and categories for an efficient customer journey.
Creativity: Prepare and upload media content to the products for an enhanced customer experience
Analytical Detective: Identify the main catalogue-driven pain-points and solve them in order to ensure the correctly functioning customer journey, by analyzing available product data, and research missing information in collaboration with vendors (distributors/direct vendors/brandbank) to confirm product details in order to keep the catalogue up to date.
Efficiency: Find ways to standardise and automate your daily work and share with the global content community, while keeping search optimisation needs in mind.
Share & Learn: Follow the content strategy guidelines to enhance our customer experience, and suggest improvements.
Team Player: Collaborate with Category, Inventory and Operations Managers to improve our assortment and drive higher sales and conversion.


Our humble expectations*


Experience managing product content in an e-commerce or retail environment
Experience in dealing with processes and transforming large amounts of data into customer relevant information to improve user experience
High attention to detail including precise and effective prioritisation to be able to manage multiple, competing topics
Ability to dive deep into a predefined problem, perform ‘Root Cause Analysis’ and identify constraints to recommend a path forward
Passion for delivering great customer experience
Educational background in Business, Marketing, Communication, or a related field
Excellent skills in Google Suite or MS Office (MS Word, MS Excel)
Fluency in English and Danish language
Photoshop experience is a plus


What we offer

At Wolt Market, we’re offering a 1-year fixed-term opportunity that will create a long-lasting impact where you can grow your skills, build your portfolio, and leave a real mark in one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech environments.

This is your chance to take ownership of your work, drive real change through data and creativity, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to craft a Wolt-class experience. From improving product accuracy and visuals, to spotting content issues before they impact customers, to building scalable solutions for catalogue operations – you’ll learn fast, contribute even faster, and finish the year with a portfolio that speaks volumes.

Next steps*

We will be reviewing applications on an on-going basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, send your application in English.

Please note that we do not accept applications coming through email due to GDPR. Make sure to apply through our careers page.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
Show more
HTML:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

As a Wolt Market Content Associate you are responsible for creating and enhancing the retail selection in the Wolt Market online catalogue. This is a 1-year fixed-term position (maternity cover) where you’ll play an important role in ensuring a Wolt-class customer experience and driving conversion.

In this role, you’ll get a lot of help and support on the way, but are also expected to be an amazing independent specialist with an exceptional ability to execute every single day.

What you’ll be doing

  • Customers First: Take customer signals and their suggestions to improve the catalogue further.
  • Passion for Details: Responsible that the Product content is accurate and up-to-date, as far as it concerns relevant product information and other customer-relevant parameters such as accurate meta-data and categories for an efficient customer journey.
  • Creativity: Prepare and upload media content to the products for an enhanced customer experience
  • Analytical Detective: Identify the main catalogue-driven pain-points and solve them in order to ensure the correctly functioning customer journey, by analyzing available product data, and research missing information in collaboration with vendors (distributors/direct vendors/brandbank) to confirm product details in order to keep the catalogue up to date.
  • Efficiency: Find ways to standardise and automate your daily work and share with the global content community, while keeping search optimisation needs in mind.
  • Share & Learn: Follow the content strategy guidelines to enhance our customer experience, and suggest improvements.
  • Team Player: Collaborate with Category, Inventory and Operations Managers to improve our assortment and drive higher sales and conversion.

Our humble expectations*

  • Experience managing product content in an e-commerce or retail environment
  • Experience in dealing with processes and transforming large amounts of data into customer relevant information to improve user experience
  • High attention to detail including precise and effective prioritisation to be able to manage multiple, competing topics
  • Ability to dive deep into a predefined problem, perform ‘Root Cause Analysis’ and identify constraints to recommend a path forward
  • Passion for delivering great customer experience
  • Educational background in Business, Marketing, Communication, or a related field
  • Excellent skills in Google Suite or MS Office (MS Word, MS Excel)
  • Fluency in English and Danish language
  • Photoshop experience is a plus

What we offer

At Wolt Market, we’re offering a 1-year fixed-term opportunity that will create a long-lasting impact where you can grow your skills, build your portfolio, and leave a real mark in one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech environments.

This is your chance to take ownership of your work, drive real change through data and creativity, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to craft a Wolt-class experience. From improving product accuracy and visuals, to spotting content issues before they impact customers, to building scalable solutions for catalogue operations – you’ll learn fast, contribute even faster, and finish the year with a portfolio that speaks volumes.

Next steps*

We will be reviewing applications on an on-going basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, send your application in English.

Please note that we do not accept applications coming through email due to GDPR. Make sure to apply through our careers page.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Analytics & Insights Partner - LEGO® Certified Retail Stores
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

We’re looking for a strategic Analytics & Insights Partner to join our central Analytics & Insights team — partnering directly with our LEGO® Certified Retail Stores (LCS) business to put data at the heart of every decision.

If you thrive where analytics, storytelling, and commercial impact intersect — and know how to influence decisions across global teams — this role is for you. You’ll help shape growth narratives, uncover new opportunities, and build smarter, insight-led strategies for our franchise-led retail portfolio.

LEGO Certified Stores are fully branded LEGO® retail spaces, owned and operated by our network of Franchise Partners — with 1,000 stores expected globally by 2026. In this role, you’ll help build the critical capabilities that make these stores the ultimate brand and shopping experience for LEGO® fans around the world.

We offer a hybrid working model called Best of Both, with 3 days in the office and 2 from home.

Please note relocation support is not available for this position.


Core Responsibilities





Business Performance Analysis Conduct deep-dive analysis into business performance metrics, identifying trends, patterns, and outliers to uncover growth opportunities and potential risks.
Advanced Analytics & Forecasting Utilise statistical, mathematical, and predictive modeling techniques to forecast market dynamics, assess economic conditions, and support scenario planning.
Data Architecture & Models Develop data frameworks, visualization dashboards, and analytical models that enable scalable insights and decision-making.
Integrated Insights Combine internal performance metrics with market, competitive, shopper, and macroeconomic data to deliver a holistic view of business health and identify areas for improvement.
Strategic Storytelling Translate complex data insights into clear, compelling narratives that influence collaborators and drive actionable decisions aligned with business objectives.
Collaborative Partnerships Work cross-functionally with marketing, sales, finance, and operations to align insights with business strategies and ensure data-informed execution.




Do you have what it takes?





Experience in retail analytics dealing with store performance and manipulating data to develop compelling arguments would be preferable.
Relevant retail industry sector knowledge or experience of working in a consultancy supporting retailers.
Analytical Proficiency Expertise in SQL, Python, and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Data Strategy & Modeling Strong understanding of data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks) and ability to develop statistical models for scenario analysis and performance measurement.
Problem-Solving Ability Aptitude for breaking down complex problems and applying analytical frameworks to generate solutions.
Storytelling with Data Ability to create compelling narratives that align insights with business priorities and influence stakeholders.
Commercial Acumen Deep understanding of business performance drivers, market trends, and consumer behavior to provide insights that impact commercial strategies.
Collaboration & Influence Skilled at partnering with cross-functional teams and influencing stakeholders at all levels




Play your part in our team succeeding

Analytics & Insights Partnering roles act as strategic advisors, leveraging data-driven insights to inform decisions, optimise performance, and drive commercial growth. They blend business acumen, analytical expertise, and storytelling skills to deliver actionable recommendations that address both short-term goals and long-term strategies.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: Power BI Business Analyst
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do You Dream of a Career with Global Impact and Visibility in an Ambitious and Growing Company?

Use your skills to shape the future of operational intelligence with advanced, time-driven reporting solutions.

Are you passionate about visualizing high-frequency data and building dashboards that truly drive decisions? We're looking for a Power BI Business Analyst - Operations Intelligence Industry 4.0 with a deep understanding of time series analytics to join our team and help transform complex datasets into powerful business insights.

This is a unique opportunity for a Power BI professional who thrives in data-rich environments like operations, industrial IoT, or manufacturing. If you're experienced with DAX, Power Query, and time-based modeling – and ready to bring data to life – we want to hear from you.

What You’ll Do


Design and develop advanced Power BI dashboards to visualize time-based trends, anomalies, seasonality, and performance metrics
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into interactive, impactful reporting solutions
Aggregate and transform large time series datasets for forecasting, trend analysis, and historical review
Build robust, scalable data models and complex DAX calculations to support advanced time intelligence
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure data sources and pipelines are optimized for time series analysis
Implement advanced features like rolling averages, Year-over-Year (YoY), and Period-over-Period (PoP) comparisons
Support integration with Industry 4.0 frameworks and real-time/near real-time analytics solutions
Document best practices to ensure consistency, governance, and high performance across Power BI environments


What You Bring


3+ years of hands-on experience building Power BI dashboards, reports, and enterprise-level data models
Deep experience working with time series data, including time intelligence functions and performance trends
Advanced skills in DAX and Power Query (M language), with the ability to build complex calculations and custom measures
Strong business acumen and the ability to explain insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience in operational, industrial, IoT, or other high-frequency data environments
Familiarity with data sources such as SQL Server, Azure, Microsoft Fabric, or cloud-based platforms
Bonus if you have experience with real-time data feeds, predictive analytics, or anomaly detection
Power BI Certification (PL-300 or equivalent) is a strong plus


Global career possibilities

At Hempel, we offer a variety of global career possibilities and many cross-functional and cross-cultural working relationships. We strive to create the right conditions for personal and professional development.

Join a global company where employees are truly passionate about delivering the best in everything they do. With business in mind and people at heart, we always work together to influence our road ahead. We want you to be part of our growth journey and of a great global family.

Sounds like a match?

Welcome to apply! Click the ‘Apply for position’ button in the top-right corner and submit your application letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system. Final deadline for applications is 1 August 2025. For further information about the job, please contact Line Friis – lif@hempel.com

Application due

2025-08-01

Seniority Level

Associate

Job Functions

Analyst

Industry

Chemicals

At Hempel, you’re welcomed to a global community of +7000 colleagues around the world. A workplace built on shared trust, mutual respect and support for each other.

We’re on a mission to double our impact. To succeed, we need bright minds and team players. Which is why, from day one, your input, ideas and initiative are not only welcomed, but expected. In return, you will enjoy great opportunities for development in a growing global company – and be part of the solution by contributing to our global impact.

At Hempel, we are committed to everyone feeling safe, valued and treated equally, in an environment where each employee can bring their authentic selves to work.  We believe that inclusion is key to innovation and by bringing together the most diverse perspectives and talents, we can achieve great things, together.
Show more

Title: Healthcare Assistant - No Experience Needed - Work In Ireland - Paid Relocation
Description:
Mercier Consultancy BG is excited to offer a rewarding opportunity for individuals who aspire to become Healthcare Assistants in Ireland. This position requires no prior experience, making it an excellent choice for those looking to start their career in healthcare. We provide a paid relocation package to assist you in your transition. In this role, you will have the chance to make a real difference in the lives of patients by offering compassionate and dedicated support.

Key Responsibilities:


Assist patients with daily living tasks, including personal hygiene, dressing, and feeding
Provide companionship and emotional support to patients to enhance their quality of life
Maintain a clean and safe environment by following hygiene and safety protocols
Observe and report any changes in patients' health status to the nursing staff
Engage patients in recreational and social activities that promote mental and emotional well-being
Support nursing staff with routine duties to ensure smooth healthcare operations
Participate in training sessions to improve your skills and knowledge in patient care


Requirements


No experience required; a willingness to learn and a caring attitude are essential
Fluency in English is important for effective communication with patients and colleagues
A compassionate approach towards patients is vital
Ability to work effectively both in a team and independently
Strong attention to detail and good organizational skills
Commitment to adhering to healthcare regulations and best practices
Willingness to relocate to Ireland and embrace a new cultural experience


Benefits


Competitive salary (€28,000-€30,000 depending on experience and location)
Paid training and ongoing career development
Full-time guaranteed contracts
Free uniform and parking
Flight fares paid
Cycle to work scheme
Employee assistance and wellbeing program
Supportive, friendly working environments and a warm Irish welcome
Relocation assistance to help candidates settle comfortably in Ireland
Help with identifying job opportunities for accompanying family members
Show more
