Title: IT Support Assistant - Student / Part-time role
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a tech-savvy person with a flair for solving IT issues and keeping things running smoothly? Copenhagen Optimization is looking for a proactive and detail-oriented IT Support assistant to join our facilities team, focusing on IT operations. This is your chance a valuable hands-on role in a dynamic and friendly work environment!

What you'll be doing:

You’ll support our daily IT operations and help ensure a seamless tech experience for all our colleagues. Your tasks will include:


Monitoring and responding to requests in our #it-support Slack channel
Inquiring about and ordering equipment for new hires and existing colleagues in line with company guidelines
Setting up new desks and ensuring proper hardware allocation
Securely wiping old computers before reuse or recycling
Mapping hardware serial numbers to employees and updating the equipment asset list
Testing software updates before approving the for rollout to all colleagues.
Ensuring meeting rooms and workstations are functional, organized, and tidy
Installing software and setting up new computers for new colleagues


Who you are:


Currently enrolled in a relevant IT or technical program - or already finished, just looking for a part-time role.
Interested in IT support, hardware/software setup, and device management
Comfortable with tools like Slack and Microsoft Intune (or eager to learn)
Reliable, structured, and a natural problem-solver
Available to work 8–10 hours per week - split on 2 days.


What we offer:


A friendly, international team at a central Copenhagen office
A hands-on role where your input truly matters
Flexible working hours that fit your schedule
Real-world experience with IT operations and enterprise tools


This will be our first role dedicated on IT-support, if this sounds like the right fit for you, we’d love to hear from you - the sooner the better!

Apply in English or Danish now and, help us keep the tech side of things smooth and efficient.
Show more

Title: ESG Data Intern
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
ESG data internship in purpose driven, fast-growing ESG data company

As an intern, you will gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up that uses emerging technology to increase the sustainability of investments.

Matter provides ESG and sustainability data as well as analytics to the financial industry. We are a fintech company with offices in Copenhagen and London centred around an international culture with colleagues from +10 different nationalities.




The role

We are looking for interns who want to work in the field of ESG and sustainability data analysis. As an intern you will be involved in assessing and validating company reported ESG data, as a part of larger team building technology solutions for ESG data collection and analysis. Tasks can include quality control of ESG data, development and maintenance of research guides, and general data analysis. Your team and project is cross-functional and very ambitious, and you will be exposed to cutting edge technology development, while you also develop a robust understanding of ESG data. The internship is paid and time limited.




Who are we looking for?

We are looking for someone with a background in economics, political science, business administration, law, or other relevant studies. The ideal candidate will demonstrate most of the following traits, but you do not need to tick all boxes:

Strong academic profile (min. 2nd year of BSc.)
Demonstrated interest in sustainability
Highly organized with attention to detail
Ability to work under strict deadlines with competing priorities
Quick learner with ability to process and understand new information naturally.
Curiosity - ability to self-motivate and know when to ask questions
General interest in ESG and sustainable finance is a plus




What we offer

An internship at Matter will offer you:

The opportunity to work with an extraordinarily competent international team using an array of new technologies to service clients in the financial sector
Experience in working in a rapidly developing scale-up, and a fast-growing and impactful sector
An improved understanding of ESG data as well as insight into the complexities facing corporate ESG departments and sustainable investors using ESG data
Substantial responsibility considering the limited time you spend with us




Practicalities

Full-time for minimum ten weeks between September and December 2025, with flexibility during exam season (or a period that fits your schedule)
Working language is English
Preferred physical presence in Copenhagen office – placement in London may be possible
Paid internship position
The hours are mainly 9-17, but you are expected to be flexible around deadlines




How to apply

If you are interested in learning more, we look forward to hearing from you. Please submit a short motivational letter that mentions relevant experience (max 500 words), grades, and a CV - all in one PDF document - here on LinkedIn or to joinus@thisismatter.com. Write “ESG data intern 2025” in the subject line.




Please apply early as we recruit on an ongoing basis and are looking to fill the position as soon as we have identified the right candidate.

We encourage everyone who meets the qualifications, regardless of gender, age, sexual orientation, nationality, race, religion, physical ability, etc. to apply.

Show more

The role

We are looking for interns who want to work in the field of ESG and sustainability data analysis. As an intern you will be involved in assessing and validating company reported ESG data, as a part of larger team building technology solutions for ESG data collection and analysis. Tasks can include quality control of ESG data, development and maintenance of research guides, and general data analysis. Your team and project is cross-functional and very ambitious, and you will be exposed to cutting edge technology development, while you also develop a robust understanding of ESG data. The internship is paid and time limited.


Who are we looking for?

We are looking for someone with a background in economics, political science, business administration, law, or other relevant studies. The ideal candidate will demonstrate most of the following traits, but you do not need to tick all boxes:

  • Strong academic profile (min. 2nd year of BSc.)
  • Demonstrated interest in sustainability
  • Highly organized with attention to detail
  • Ability to work under strict deadlines with competing priorities
  • Quick learner with ability to process and understand new information naturally.
  • Curiosity - ability to self-motivate and know when to ask questions
  • General interest in ESG and sustainable finance is a plus


What we offer

An internship at Matter will offer you:

  • The opportunity to work with an extraordinarily competent international team using an array of new technologies to service clients in the financial sector
  • Experience in working in a rapidly developing scale-up, and a fast-growing and impactful sector
  • An improved understanding of ESG data as well as insight into the complexities facing corporate ESG departments and sustainable investors using ESG data
  • Substantial responsibility considering the limited time you spend with us


Practicalities

  • Full-time for minimum ten weeks between September and December 2025, with flexibility during exam season (or a period that fits your schedule)
  • Working language is English
  • Preferred physical presence in Copenhagen office – placement in London may be possible
  • Paid internship position
  • The hours are mainly 9-17, but you are expected to be flexible around deadlines


How to apply

If you are interested in learning more, we look forward to hearing from you. Please submit a short motivational letter that mentions relevant experience (max 500 words), grades, and a CV - all in one PDF document - here on LinkedIn or to joinus@thisismatter.com. Write “ESG data intern 2025” in the subject line.


Please apply early as we recruit on an ongoing basis and are looking to fill the position as soon as we have identified the right candidate.

We encourage everyone who meets the qualifications, regardless of gender, age, sexual orientation, nationality, race, religion, physical ability, etc. to apply.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have +5 years of experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible

Title: Business Analyst to join the Nordic CEO Office
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
With more than 3,000 employees, Deloitte is the largest audit and consultancy firm in Denmark. We tailor solutions across Audit, Tax, Financial Advisory Services, Enterprise Risk Services, Technology, and Transformations.




About the team




At the Nordic CEO Office, we are a team of approximately 10 people, supporting the Nordic CEO and the Nordic Head of Transformation. Our area of responsibility covers both strategy, transformation, and the executive agenda, where we work closely with business leaders and teams within Deloitte.




We are a dedicated team of professionals who work closely together on projects, processes, and tasks. We value a culture based on trust, where we have fun in what are often busy days, and we help each other succeed. We expect everyone to contribute, and for this, our Business Analysts are a vital part of the team.




Job Description




Are you interested in working in the intersection of strategy and transformation? Do you want to make an impact while being part of an inclusive culture based on collaboration, curiosity, and high ambitions?




We offer an attractive part-time student position of approximately 15 hours per week, where you will have the opportunity to contribute, learn, and develop in a variety of tasks while gaining valuable experience from working at a leading global professional services firm.




Your place of work will be at our office in Copenhagen, and the position will offer flexibility around your studies and exams.




In this role, you will make an impact by:




Supporting the executive agenda, communication, and engagement around our Nordic strategy
Contributing to the preparation and follow-up on leadership and communication activities
Developing presentations and key material for our Nordic executive management teams
Performing quantitative and qualitative data analyses to ensure solid argumentation for recommendations
Assisting on cross-functional projects in collaboration with team members
Providing support in facilitating our Nordic annual cycle and strategy execution




Qualifications




You are a student currently enrolled at a relevant university with at least two years remaining in your studies. Your field of study is within economics, business administration, management, or a related field, and we expect you to have demonstrated your skills and have relevant experience from a previous or current role.




You are curious, proactive, with a positive can-do attitude, and you demonstrate a strong willingness to learn and develop through diverse tasks, including leadership communication, data analysis, and structured follow-up on activities and plans.




What you bring to the team:




An analytical mindset with the ability to think and solve tasks through a structured approach
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey insights and key messages from analyses effectively
Structured and detail-oriented, committed to delivering quality deliverables on time
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and thrive in a varied, fast-paced environment
Strong interest in business, business strategy, leadership engagement, and communication
Fluency in English, both oral and written
Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite – especially PowerPoint and Excel




Even if you do not see yourself in all the bullets above, we still encourage you to apply if you believe your skills can make an impact on our team.




Additional Information




Do you want to be part of our team?




Click the "I am interested" button above if you are ready to join our team.




Send your application, CV, and grade transcripts by 04.08.2025. We process applications continually, so we recommend that you apply as soon as possible. Interviews will be held from the start of August.




Expected start date: 01.10.2025 or as soon as possible.




Please do not hesitate to contact Valerie Weihprachtitzky, Manager at +45 52 80 57 20, if you have any questions about the position.




We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender (gender identity and gender expression), sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability.




By applying for this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.




In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. We value our different skills, perspectives and experiences and foster an environment where innovative powers thrive. To us, success is the feeling that the work we are doing will outlast us. The impact we make is not about what we achieve as individuals, but how we enable those around us to be their very best. From professional development to leadership opportunities, we empower our people to be extraordinary by playing to their strengths – because that is how we can make a difference.

Title: Student Assistant - Data Engineering
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Again

At Again, we are tackling one of the planet’s most pressing issues— waste CO2 —by transforming emissions into the solution. Our innovative approach involves fermenting industrial waste gases into carbon-negative chemicals, thereby turning harmful emissions into valuable, emission-free green chemicals. With each tonne of product we create, we remove over 2 tonnes of carbon from the atmosphere. Backed by over $100 million in funding from top venture capital investors and the European Union’s Horizon 2020 programme, we’re poised for rapid growth and global impact. If you think we’re doomed - think Again

What you'll do


Continuous updating of databases for experimental data, ensuring integrity and completeness of raw and metadata
Writing basic data wrangling and analysis scripts
10-15 hours per week, consistent availability 2 days per week required, flexible around class schedule and exams periods.


About You


Undergraduate degree in a subject with data science/coding component (e.g. data science, statistics, computational biology)
Coding experience in R and/or Python and ideally SQL
Understanding of best practices in data management
Strong attention to detail, ability to work independently
Preferred:
Some knowledge of biology/experimental data
Basic experience with cloud data storage and cloud computing

What we promise you?


You get to work with a group of passionate scientists, working on challenging and meaningful projects
An inclusive, empowering and engaging work environment
This will be the journey of a lifetime – we are serious about our mission to reduce over 1 gigaton of CO₂ and you can play a pivotal role in making that happen


If you have questions regarding the role, we would love to hear from you. Feel free to reach out at hej@again.bio. We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
📍 Location: Baltorpvej (~20 mins from central Copenhagen)

🗣️ Language Requirement: Danish-speaking




Coders Connect is thrilled to be partnering with a global leader in smart pest control solutions, helping expand their Innovation Centre just outside Copenhagen.

You’ll join a startup-style unit within the company, focused on delivering next-gen IoT-powered, data-driven services.




With over 1 million IoT devices deployed globally, this team plays a critical role in transforming massive data volumes into actionable insights. We're seeking a Danish-speaking Data Engineer ready to work in a fast-paced, agile environment — and build something that truly scales 🌍.




🔧 What You’ll Do

Build and maintain data pipelines that handle hourly batch data from a vast IoT device network
Work in Azure and Databricks to create scalable, high-performance cloud data infrastructure
Collaborate closely with Data Scientists, QA, Product Managers & Engineers in agile 2-week sprints
Contribute to architecture, ensuring top-notch data quality, performance, and reliability
Help transition from external consultants to an internal, capability-driven data team
Operate autonomously in a flat, startup-like structure




👨‍💻 You Bring

Fluency in Danish (spoken & written)
Living in Denmark (visa transfers possible; no relocation from abroad)
Proven experience with Azure Data Services and Databricks
Strong ETL pipeline skills for batch data processing
A scale-up/startup mindset — proactive, self-driven, and ownership-focused
Experience in agile development environments




📍 Working Setup

Hybrid: Tuesdays onsite required, ideally 2–3 days/week
Office in Baltorpvej (approx. 20 mins from central Copenhagen)
Flat structure, high autonomy, quick decision-making




💸 What’s On Offer

Competitive Salary: DKK 800,000–850,000/year
+10% employer pension contribution
5 weeks vacation + 1 extra week
Work on a meaningful, global-impact IoT product
High flexibility, real ownership, and influence from day one




If you're a Data Engineer looking for real-world impact at scale, in a team where your voice matters we’d love to hear from you!




📩 Apply via Coders Connect or reach out to hlekani@codersconnect.co.uk to learn more!

Title: Clinical IT Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about solving business problems with technology? Can you both analyze a need for improvement in clinical applications, and make it happen in a structured way?

If so, now is your chance to join Ascendis Pharma as our new IT Business Analyst for the clinical area!

Ascendis Pharma is a fast-growing global biopharmaceutical company committed to making a meaningful difference in patient's lives. We have locations in Denmark, Germany, the United States, the UK, Italy, Spain, and France.

Guided by our core values of Patients, Science, and Passion, we use our TransCon® drug development platform to fulfill our mission of developing new therapies, selecting only those that demonstrate best-in-class potential to address unmet medical needs.

Today, we are advancing programs in Endocrinology Rare Disease and Oncology. In addition, we collaborate with partners around the world on the development of TransCon-based products for other therapeutic areas and markets.

We are seeking a passionate Business Analyst to join our growing team. As a member of the Global IT team, you will play a crucial role in executing on improvements to our clinical application landscape. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment, collaborate with cross-functional, global teams working together to achieve extraordinary results.

You will be part of the Clinical IT Product team with four colleagues based in Copenhagen, Denmark. 

The team is known for relentlessly delivering to our clinical internal customers and utilizing the latest trends in technology to enable business strategy. The team is fast paced and collaborative. 

You will be based in Hellerup and report to Jakob Monajemzadeh Thrane, People Leader in Global IT, and to Ivanna Rosendal, Global Head of Digitalization, from a functional point of view. Both are based in HQ in Hellerup, Denmark.

 

Your key responsibilities will be:

Analyze needs for improvements to our clinical applications (such as EDC, CTMS, eTMF, IRT) and create clear documentation
Sequence and execute on the tasks needed to implement the improvements to the systems, working with the rest of the team and SaaS vendors.  
Create documentation needed for GxP validation of the system improvements.
Communicate with end users and ensure that they are engaged in the development of our SaaS solutions.

 

Qualifications and Skills:

You hold a relevant academic degree - minimum a bachelor's degree - and +5 years of experience from a similar role in a pharmaceutical, biotechnology or related environment.

Furthermore, you have:

Experience with IT applications in the clinical area, such as from Clinical Operations, Data Management or Clinical Trial Supply
Hands-on knowledge of translating user needs to digital and IT in life sciences
Experience in driving the successful delivery of digital products and platforms
A broad understanding of clinical trials.
Knowledge or experience with GAMP 5 and GxP
You have been working in an agile team, relentlessly improving your working practices.

 

Key competencies:

You are a strong team player, analytical, and have a can-do attitude.

You possess an entrepreneurial mindset and can thrive in an informal, open environment where innovation and change are key. You are also able to structure your own work and are not afraid to ask questions.

We expect you to be a self-starter who can see white spaces and opportunities and jump in to move things forward.

Our team needs to scale to support the ever-growing demands, so we need team members who both can act pragmatically, and solution orientated for the short term, and at the same time are able to think long-term to ensure what we do today can grow to support us in the future.


Travel: 10-25 days per year.

Office: Tuborg Boulevard 12, 2900 Hellerup

 

Apply now.

Applications will be evaluated when received, so please apply as soon as possible.

Please upload your CV and answer three questions in the application form.

 

All applications must be submitted in English and are treated confidentially.

 

For more details about the position, please contact Jakob Monajemzadeh Thrane, jmt@ascendispharma.com, or Ivanna Rosendal, imr@ascendispharma.com

 

You can learn more about Ascendis by visiting our website www.ascendispharma.com

Applications submitted via email or other channels will not be reviewed.


Please note: Due to the summer holiday period, our response times may be a bit longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and look forward to reviewing your application as soon as possible. 

Show more

You possess an entrepreneurial mindset and can thrive in an informal, open environment where innovation and change are key. You are also able to structure your own work and are not afraid to ask questions.

We expect you to be a self-starter who can see white spaces and opportunities and jump in to move things forward.

Our team needs to scale to support the ever-growing demands, so we need team members who both can act pragmatically, and solution orientated for the short term, and at the same time are able to think long-term to ensure what we do today can grow to support us in the future.

Travel: 10-25 days per year.

Office: Tuborg Boulevard 12, 2900 Hellerup

 

Apply now.

Applications will be evaluated when received, so please apply as soon as possible.

Please upload your CV and answer three questions in the application form.

 

All applications must be submitted in English and are treated confidentially.

 

For more details about the position, please contact Jakob Monajemzadeh Thrane, jmt@ascendispharma.com, or Ivanna Rosendal, imr@ascendispharma.com

 

You can learn more about Ascendis by visiting our website www.ascendispharma.com

Applications submitted via email or other channels will not be reviewed.

Please note: Due to the summer holiday period, our response times may be a bit longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and look forward to reviewing your application as soon as possible.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Excellent opportunity for an experienced data professional eager to design, build, and maintain scalable and reliable data solutions on Azure.

Do you have a strong background in data engineering and a deep understanding of ETL/ELT, data warehousing, and analytics? Are you proficient in SQL, Python, and Azure Synapse, with a passion for transforming raw data into strategic insights? Then you might be our new Data Engineer!

You will play an important role in:

Everllence PrimeServ is looking for a high performing and detail-oriented Data Engineer to support our journey in elevating data integrity, security, and operational excellence. As a key member of our team, you will:


Develop, deploy, and maintain secure data pipelines, warehouses, and data lakes on Azure following the Medallion Architecture.
Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines to automate and streamline deployments from test to production environments.
Enforce robust governance frameworks including access management, version control, and best practices in code development.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive strategic data governance and security initiatives.
Utilize GitHub best practices for branch management, commit standards, and automated deployments to support continuous integration.


We imagine that you:


You have 2+ years of practical experience working with data engineering and ETL/ELT processes.
You possess a solid background in data architecture and engineering, with hands-on experience in Azure Synapse, CI/CD, and data governance.
Have strong technical skills in SQL, Python, PySpark, and experience working with Azure data services such as Azure Data Factory, Data Lake Storage, Databricks and SQL Database.
Understand secure development practices, version control, and access management protocols.
Are detail-oriented, with a proven ability to document processes, maintain high code quality, and adhere to established conventions.
Are passionate about continuous improvement and operational excellence, ensuring our data solutions are both secure and scalable.
Having Azure Certification and especially DP-203 Azure Data Engineer Associate would be a plus as well as knowledge on Fabric/Databricks.


If you’re ready to drive innovation and help us build a well-governed, secure data ecosystem, we’d love to hear from you!

Welcome to the Data & BI department

You will be a part of the Data & BI department and you will participate in the collaboration with the business stakeholders and within the analytical community across the organization. You will be joining a diverse team of skilled and dedicated people operating in an international environment. We have a professional approach to our work, while having a humorous and positive environment in the team.

What can you expect from us:


Opportunity to participate in a function with many exciting challenges
Unique work experience and reference from a top employer
A young, international and professional environment filled with energy
A job in a trend-setting international company
Work-life balance and continuous trainings.


Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

At Everllence, we offer you the chance to shape the future where you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions, while achieving your personal career goals. We prioritize work-life balance with flexible working hours, remote work options, and over 7 weeks of paid time off.

We foster a creative and inclusive culture, emphasizing diversity and equality. We are dedicated to our employees' well-being, offering opportunities to join various social activity clubs, ranging from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.

In 2027, we will consolidate our Zealand locations into one large site in Trekroner, Roskilde.

About Everllence

Everllence, formerly known as MAN Energy Solutions , is a leading provider of propulsion, decarbonization and efficiency solutions for shipping, the energy economy and industry. True to our motto – ‘Moving big things to zero’ – we help key industries in the global economy to reduce hard-to-abate emissions. Our technologies have a measurable impact on the success of the global energy transition. More information about the company can be found at www.everllence.com .

Headquartered in Germany, Everllence employs around 15,000 people across more than 140 sites worldwide. In Denmark, we have over 2,500 dedicated employees from more than 55 nationalities, spread across four locations: Copenhagen, Brøndby, Frederikshavn, and Holeby. Our after-sales brand, Everllence PrimeServ, also supports our customers through its worldwide service-center network.

Build your own Future

Please submit your application to us no later than July 31 2025. We will conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, you are welcome to Piotr Michalak (Piotr.michalak@everllence.com)

Relocating to Denmark is a major step for our international colleagues. To support this transition, we offer tailored intercultural and global mindset training for all employees and managers, promoting a collaborative and inclusive work environment. Our mobility package includes assistance with obtaining a Danish CPR number, tax information, and work permits,

At Everllence, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position.

Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.

Our mobility package includes assistance with obtaining a Danish CPR number, tax information, and work permits,

At Everllence, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position.

Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.

Title: Assistent Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ønsker du at kickstarte din karriere og komme foran andre i din årgang? Brænder du for at investere i din professionelle og personlige udvikling, samt er du interesseret i at komme helt tæt på, hvordan man bygger og driver virksomheder. Vil du være del af et exceptionelt team af talentfulde og drevne mennesker med stor erfaring i at bygge succesfulde virksomheder? I så fald kan du være den rigtige til vores Talent Internship Program.

Vores Mission

CVX er en af Europas hurtigst voksende ventureinvestorer, og vi hjælper ambitiøse og lovende vækstvirksomheder med at nå deres fulde potentiale ved at investere kapital, viden, tid, færdigheder og netværk. Vi drives af vores overbevisning om, at de bedste investorer ofte er dem, der ud over kapital giver grundlæggerne den rette viden og erfaringer, færdigheder og netværk i forhold til den fase og branche, som virksomheden opererer i. CVX investerer altid sammen med de bedste business angels for den pågældende grundlægger, og i dag har vi over 600 partnere i vores netværk, der investerer i virksomheder og bringer deres færdigheder i spil, hvor de virkelig kan tilføre værdi.

Dine Opgaver

Du vil arbejde ud af vores HQ i København, hvor du vil få en mentor som tager del i din udvikling. Din opgaver vil variere og kan bl.a. indeholde:


Drive og udvikle vores process for Leads til vores salgsteam med fokus på at øge antal og kvalitet
Støtte vores kontakt til medlemmer for at udvikle vores medlemsrejse
Understøtte vores finance team med rapportering og hjælpe med inddrivelse af penge
Kommunikation på SoMe eks. LinkedIn posts, osv.


Hvad vi tilbyder dig

Vi har en lang track record for at vores interns efterfølgende får arbejde i nogle af de største konsulenthuse, investment banks og private equity fonde. Herunder Mckinsey, Blackstone, Goldman Sachs, BCG mm.

Som del af vores Talent Internship Program bliver du del af et skræddersyet program som er bygget til at udvikle talent indenfor forretning og entreprenørskab, og som historisk har udviklet CEOs og andre ledere til vores virksomheder. Du får muligheden for et betalt internship, hvor du vil opleve:


Indsigt i hvordan man bygger og driver virksomheder ved at være del af lokalet, når beslutninger træffes
Et givende professionelt netværk af ambitiøse talenter, inspirerende mennesker og C-level erhvervsledere
Muligheden for at kickstarte din karriere med ansvar for vigtige projekter som vil skubbe dig ud af din komfort zone


Hvad vi forventer fra dig

Du besidder exceptionel arbejdsmoral og "high sense of urgency". Du besidder et stort drive og ønsker at være den bedste til det du gør. Du tager ejerskab over dine opgaver, er proaktiv i dine handlinger og følger dine forpligtelser og opgaver til dørs. Du er ydmyg og deler vores passion for at bygge virksomheder.

Vi forventer også at du:


Har gennemført STX, HHX eller HTX med topkarakter
Har erfaring fra at arbejde deltid eller fra andre ekstra aktiviteter


Ansøgningsfrist: 15. Juli 2025 eller indtil alle pladser er fyldt.

Hvis du har nogen spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte William Jørck på (+45) 22392014 eller wj@presidents.eu
Show more

Vi forventer også at du:

  • Har gennemført STX, HHX eller HTX med topkarakter
  • Har erfaring fra at arbejde deltid eller fra andre ekstra aktiviteter

Hvis du har nogen spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte William Jørck på (+45) 22392014 eller wj@presidents.eu

Title: Student assistant i Business Intelligence
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Har du forståelse for tal og datahåndtering? Vil du udvikle dig fagligt i et fleksibelt og studierelevant job? Så har vi brug for dig i vores BI-team.

Vi er et lille team med store ambitioner og et moderne data lakehouse setup i Azure. Vi har brug for dig til at være med til at vedligeholde og skabe dataløsninger til interne og eksterne brugere.

Hvad skal du lave?

Du kommer til at arbejde som en integreret del af teamet, som består af Product Owner, Data Scientist, Digital Business Partner, en anden studentermedhjælper og eksterne udviklere.

Helt Konkret Skal Du Løse Følgende Opgaver


Modellere og visualisere data i Power BI fra forskellige kilder.
Have ansvar for datapipelines og datamodeller samt eventuel fejlsøgning og -rettelse.
Samarbejde med tværfunktionelle teams for at indsamle krav og designe professionelle dataløsninger.
Håndtere forespørgsler fra brugerne af Power BI, så deres ønsker bliver imødekommet.


Hvad forventer vi af dig?

Som Person Ser Vi Meget Gerne, At


Du er nysgerrig og har interesse i at udvikle dig fagligt
Du er selvkørende, men altid ved, hvornår du skal sparre med dine kollegaer
Du er omstillingsparat
Du viser initiativ, værdsætter teamwork og trives med at have dine egne opgaver, og samtidig at have dine egne opgaver
Du er serviceorienteret og efterspørger også selv støtte, når du har brug for det


Vi Har Høje Forventninger Til De Resultater, Vi Skaber Sammen, Og Derfor Ønsker Vi At Få En Kollega, Der Kan Sige Tjek Til Følgende


Du kan allerede, eller har vilje til at lære, at arbejde med Power BI
Det er en fordel, hvis du kender til SQL og Python.
Det er en fordel, hvis du kender til UI/UX.
Du kan arbejde ca. 15 timer om ugen
Du har mindst to år tilbage af dine studier


Vi forestiller os, at du er i gang med en naturvidenskabelig uddannelse indenfor f.eks. datavidenskab/data science, datalogi, en ingeniøruddannelse eller lignende.

Hvad kan du forvente af os?

Du bliver en del af teamet og vil opleve tillid og ansvar. Du får dine egne opgaver med fuld adgang til sparring og støtte. Teamet motiveres af at lære nyt, så det vil ligeledes være en del af arbejdsdagen for dig.

Du kommer til at arbejde med mange typer data og data-udfordringer. Vores tidligere studentermedhjælper brugte vores data både til sin bachelor og sit speciale og er blevet fastansat efter studiet.

Vi tror på, at man kan mere, når arbejdet er sjovt. Og vi sørger for, at der er tid til at lade nysgerrigheden styre og til at prøve idéer af. Hos os vægter evner og inspiration højest, mens erfaring og læring følger med jobbet og opgaverne.

Hos os bygger vi stærke relationer for at skabe gode vilkår for samarbejde, så vi sammen kan udvikle de bedste løsninger.

Vi arbejder efter rammer frem for regler, og vi kan lide at være sammen i både faglige og sociale sammenhænge. Vi har en aktiv personaleforening, som sørger for mange gode arrangementer, og hver fredag samles vi om fx morgenmøder, morgenmad og fredagssamlinger.

Du kommer primært til at arbejde i vores lyse lokaler midt i København, og du kan se frem til stor fleksibilitet i form af mulighed for hjemmearbejde og placering af din arbejdstid.

Vi ønsker at være en inkluderende arbejdsplads med plads til forskellighed, og derfor opfordrer vi dig til at søge uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, religion, seksualitet eller funktionsnedsættelse.

Vil du være en del af vores uimodståelige arbejdsplads?

Send din ansøgning og dit cv via ”Søg denne stilling”.

For at sikre en fair rekrutteringsproces skal du ikke inkludere et billede af dig selv eller oplyse din fødselsdato, når du ansøger.

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Product Owner, Laura Marott på tlf.nr.: 20 42 69 36 eller e-mail lma@e-nettet.dk.

Ansøgningsfrist er den 11. august 2025.

Om e-nettet

Hos e-nettet samler vi finanssektoren og digitaliserer Danmark. Vi udvikler unikke løsninger, som leverer konkret værdi til kunder, borgere og samfund.

Når en kunde skifter bank uden knas. Når en digital tinglysning sker med få klik. Når en bolighandel kører friktionsløst. Så har e-nettet bygget de usynlige løsninger, der leverer synlige gevinster til alle.

e-nettet er ejet af alle penge- og realkreditinstitutter i Danmark, og vi har i mere end 25 år været med til at drive digitaliseringen af Danmark. Det fortsætter vi med. Derfor er vores vision at fremme Danmarks førerposition som verdens bedst digitaliserede samfund.

Læs mere på e-nettet.dk/karriere, hvor du kan møde nogle af dine kommende kolleger.

Ansøgningsfrist: 11. august 2025
Show more

Om e-nettet

Hos e-nettet samler vi finanssektoren og digitaliserer Danmark. Vi udvikler unikke løsninger, som leverer konkret værdi til kunder, borgere og samfund.

Når en kunde skifter bank uden knas. Når en digital tinglysning sker med få klik. Når en bolighandel kører friktionsløst. Så har e-nettet bygget de usynlige løsninger, der leverer synlige gevinster til alle.

e-nettet er ejet af alle penge- og realkreditinstitutter i Danmark, og vi har i mere end 25 år været med til at drive digitaliseringen af Danmark. Det fortsætter vi med. Derfor er vores vision at fremme Danmarks førerposition som verdens bedst digitaliserede samfund.

Læs mere på e-nettet.dk/karriere, hvor du kan møde nogle af dine kommende kolleger.

Ansøgningsfrist: 11. august 2025

Title: Assistent Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ønsker du at kickstarte din karriere og komme foran andre i din årgang? Brænder du for at investere i din professionelle og personlige udvikling, samt er du interesseret i at komme helt tæt på, hvordan man bygger og driver virksomheder. Vil du være del af et exceptionelt team af talentfulde og drevne mennesker med stor erfaring i at bygge succesfulde virksomheder? I så fald kan du være den rigtige til vores Talent Internship Program.

Om os

Private Equity Insights er verdens førende Private Equity-fællesskab. Vi forbinder og udvikler mere end 240.000 investeringsprofessionelle over hele verden gennem vores platforme, der omfatter konferencer, webinars, magasiner og nyhedsrapporter.

Private Equity Insights er en del af United Media, der fokuserer på at opbygge store industrier inden for medier og konferenceprodukter inden for sektorer som forsikring, HR, private equity, detailhandel osv. Fra i dag har vi organisk lanceret 8 medievirksomheder og erhvervet en.

Dine Opgaver

Du vil arbejde ud af vores HQ i København, hvor du vil få en mentor som tager del i din udvikling. Din opgaver vil variere og kan bl.a. indeholde:


Drive og udvikle vores process for Leads til vores salgsteam med fokus på at øge antal og kvalitet
Støtte vores kontakt til medlemmer for at udvikle vores medlemsrejse
Understøtte vores finance team med rapportering og hjælpe med inddrivelse af penge
Kommunikation på SoMe eks. LinkedIn posts, osv.


Hvad vi tilbyder dig

Vi har en lang track record for at vores interns efterfølgende får arbejde i nogle af de største konsulenthuse, investment banks og private equity fonde. Herunder Mckinsey, Blackstone, Goldman Sachs, BCG mm.

Som del af vores Talent Internship Program bliver du del af et skræddersyet program som er bygget til at udvikle talent indenfor forretning og entreprenørskab, og som historisk har udviklet CEOs og andre ledere til vores virksomheder. Du får muligheden for et betalt internship, hvor du vil opleve:


Indsigt i hvordan man bygger og driver virksomheder ved at være del af lokalet, når beslutninger træffes
Et givende professionelt netværk af ambitiøse talenter, inspirerende mennesker og C-level erhvervsledere
Muligheden for at kickstarte din karriere med ansvar for vigtige projekter som vil skubbe dig ud af din komfort zone


Hvad vi forventer fra dig

Du besidder exceptionel arbejdsmoral og "high sense of urgency". Du besidder et stort drive og ønsker at være den bedste til det du gør. Du tager ejerskab over dine opgaver, er proaktiv i dine handlinger og følger dine forpligtelser og opgaver til dørs. Du er ydmyg og deler vores passion for at bygge virksomheder.

Vi forventer også at du:


Har gennemført STX, HHX eller HTX med top karakter
Har erfaring fra at arbejde deltid eller fra andre ekstra aktiviteter


Ansøgningsfrist: 15. Juli 2025 eller indtil alle pladser er fyldt.

Hvis du har nogen spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte William Jørck på (+45) 22392014 eller wj@presidents.eu
Show more

Title: Data & AI Strategy Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join Us as a Strategy Consultant – Data & AI

Empowering Innovation. Creating Real-World Impact. Together.

At Accenture Strategy & Consulting, we help our clients embrace the power of change driven by data, AI, and human ingenuity. We’re now looking for ambitious, purpose-driven Strategy Consultants to join our Data & AI team in Denmark.

Are you passionate about making data and AI work for people? Do you want to shape the future of businesses using cutting-edge technology with empathy, curiosity, and impact at the core? Then we’d love to meet you.

What You’ll Find at Accenture



An inclusive culture where women thrive; with active networks like FLOT (Female Leader of Tomorrow) and mentoring programs to help you grow your career.

Flexibility that works for your life; hybrid setups, family-friendly policies, and mental well-being support.

A strong development journey tailored to your aspirations; with a mentor, global knowledge, and upskilling programs at your fingertips.

Fun and connection; we believe work should energize you. Our local team prioritizes joy, and Accenture Club Denmark hosts everything from sports to food tastings.

Impactful projects; collaborate with the largest organizations in the Nordics on meaningful, sustainable, and tech-powered transformations.

Opportunities to give back through volunteering locally and globally.



Your Role in Our Mission

As part of our Nordic Data & AI practice, you’ll work with talented people from diverse backgrounds to help organizations grow in a digital-first world. You’ll be driving value with AI strategies, from concept to implementation, while ensuring businesses become more inclusive, agile, and future-ready.

In this role, you will:



Lead or co-lead workstreams in strategy development and product adoption, where Data and AI meet real business challenges.

Shape holistic and ethical Data & AI strategies, including Generative AI, that drive measurable value.

Translate complexity into clarity, designing operating models and architectures that work for people.

Apply storytelling and business acumen to co-create solutions and proposals with clients.

Help implement scalable AI platforms and change initiatives in collaboration with tech experts and business stakeholders.



You’ll be joining a supportive environment that values collaboration, learning, and diverse perspectives. We grow together, every day.

Meet Your Future Colleagues

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives, and we’re proud to work with people who bring their whole selves to work. Combining expertise, curiosity, and compassion.



Nikkimarie Glenn – Consultant, Data Science With an MSc in Mathematical Modelling and a strong track record in bridging the gap between AI technology and day-to-day business operations, Nikkimarie supports clients through both strategic advisory and hands-on implementation. She is passionate advocate for people leadership, she’s also an active member of Accenture’s Female Leadership Academy.

William – Manager, Data Science With an PhD in Robot Systems and a background in research, William helps public and healthcare organizations in Denmark and across Europe harness the power of AI. He’s committed to making data science accessible and actionable. When he’s not guiding clients, you’ll find him leading Accenture Denmark’s ski team with energy and team spirit on and off the slopes.

Elizabeth – Senior Manager, Data Strategy With an MSc in International Business and fluency in French, Elizabeth brings a global mindset to every challenge. She has led SAP and data architecture projects and is now a recognized expert in Master Data Management (MDM). A frequent speaker at events like Connected Women in AI, she’s passionate about building inclusive communities and driving real-world impact with data.



These are just a few of the inspiring individuals you’ll collaborate with and learn from as part of our team.

Who We’re Looking For

We’re not looking for “perfect” resumes—we’re looking for people who share our values and curiosity.

You may be a strong match if you:



Have 2–3 years of experience in data / AI strategy, digital consulting, or AI-driven innovation (from consulting, startups, or corporates).

Are comfortable navigating both business and tech topics—e.g., MDM, data platforms, AI/ML, etc.

Think in hypotheses, structure problems, and communicate clearly to different audiences.

Care about people, details, and the bigger picture.

Enjoy staying up to date on new tech trends, AI regulations, and emerging GenAI use cases.

Speak and write English and Danish or another Nordic language fluently.

Hold a relevant Master's degree in business, engineering, or science with strong academic results.



We welcome all types of talent. If you're passionate about the future of data and AI—and making that future inclusive and human-centered—we encourage you to apply.

Ready to Shape the Future With Us?

We’d love to hear from you. Apply online with your CV, university grades, and a short cover letter. Questions? Reach out to recruiting lead Annika Venäläinen at annika.venalainen@accenture.com

About Accenture

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy & Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 740,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries.

We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners, and communities.

🌐 accenture.com

💼 Accenture Nordics on LinkedIn

📺 Accenture Nordics on YouTube

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst (Fully Remote)

We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to play a key role in driving strategic insights and evolving our data environment. This fully remote position offers the opportunity to collaborate across departments, supporting both day-to-day operations and broader strategic initiatives—especially as we modernise systems and strengthen our reporting capabilities.

Our current data stack includes SQL Server and Power BI, with complex data models and pipelines. Projects will span business intelligence, data science, and advanced analytics. If you’re someone who can quickly get to grips with existing systems, understand data logic, and communicate insights clearly, this role could be a great fit.

Key Responsibilities

Partner with stakeholders to identify analytical needs and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Collaborate across teams to uncover growth opportunities and provide statistical and business analysis.
Design, develop, and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports using SQL Server and Power BI.
Support the development of a modern data strategy, including system upgrades and migrations.
Help standardise metrics, documentation, and reporting logic across the organisation.

What You’ll Bring

Advanced SQL skills, with hands-on experience working in SQL Server environments.
Strong ownership mindset and a proactive, solutions-focused approach.
Proven experience designing and maintaining Power BI dashboards and data models.
Ability to work with complex datasets and apply business logic to analytical outputs.
Excellent communication skills—you can clearly explain data insights to technical and non-technical audiences.
Solid grounding in statistics, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modelling.
Bonus: Experience with ERP systems or large-scale data migrations.
Bonus: Background in e-commerce or service-oriented operations.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company




Founded in 1926 by Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, today Publicis Groupe is the second largest communications group in the world and a leader in marketing, communication, and digital business transformation, led by Arthur Sadoun, the third CEO in its history. Publicis Groupe is positioned at every step of the value chain, from consulting to execution, combining marketing transformation and digital business transformation.




Publicis Groupe is a privileged partner in its clients’ transformation to enhance personalisation at scale. The Groupe relies on ten expertise concentrated within four main activities: Communication, Media, Data and Technology. Through a unified and fluid organisation, its clients have a facilitated access to all its expertise in every market. Present in over 100 countries, Publicis Groupe employs around 103,000 professionals.




Overview




At Publicis Groupe, we believe in the power of data to transform how brands connect with people. Our Data Solutions team leads a Groupe-wide initiative focused on delivering best-in-class reporting and data solutions for some of the world’s most iconic brands. We work hand-in-hand with client teams, analysts, and tech specialists to build scalable, intelligent reporting frameworks that drive insight and action.




We’re now looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing team and help bridge the gap between business and tech. If you thrive at the intersection of analytics, systems thinking, and client service—this role is for you.




Responsibilities




As a Data Analyst, you’ll serve as the strategic link between client-facing teams and our technical developers—translating complex requirements into clear, deliverable solutions. Your focus will span data integrations, API connectors, reporting development, and dashboard functionality. Expect to lead projects end-to-end, working across teams to deliver smart, scalable, and elegant data solutions.




Client & Stakeholder Leadership

Be a trusted partner to internal client teams, ensuring expectations are met with clear timelines, technical support, and transparent communication
Lead regular check-ins to align on goals, capture feedback, and proactively surface new needs
Maintain a detailed understanding of project status and ensure best-in-class service delivery

Data Integration & Testing

Own the setup and maintenance of API connectors and automated reporting pipelines
Validate data quality, perform regression testing, and ensure KPI definitions match client narratives
Collaborate with technical teams to guarantee dashboard integrity and address any discrepancies

Reporting & Dashboard Development

Create dashboard wireframes, gather input from client teams, and translate into development-ready briefs
Oversee QA processes with Data Governance and the BI team
Coordinate testing, troubleshooting, and resolution of reporting issues
Safely manage data sharing with non-Publicis users in line with security standards




Qualifications




✔ Experience in a data, operations, or analytics-focused role

✔ Familiarity with BI and reporting platforms such as Power BI, Datorama, Data Studio, Databricks, SQL

✔ Strong communication skills and a collaborative, solutions-focused mindset

✔ An organised, proactive approach—comfortable working across teams and timelines

✔ Excitement for new technology, data storytelling, and digital marketing innovation

✔ A team player who’s passionate about making data work harder, smarter, and more creatively




Benefits:




In The UK, Alongside The Core Benefits Such As Pension, Life Assurance, Private Medical, And Income Protection Plan, We Also Offer:




WORK YOUR WORLD opportunity to work anywhere in the world, where there is a Publicis office, for up to 6 weeks a year.
REFLECTION DAYS - Two additional days of paid leave to step away from your usual day-to-day work and create time to focus on your well-being and self-care.
HELP@HAND BENEFITS 24/7 helpline to support you on a personal and professional level. Access to remote GPs, mental health support and CBT. Wellbeing content and lifestyle coaching.
FAMILY FRIENDLY POLICIES We provide 26 weeks of full pay for the following family milestones: Maternity. Adoption, Surrogacy and Shared Parental Leave.
FLEXIBLE WORKING, BANK HOLIDAY SWAP & BIRTHDAY DAY OFF You are entitled to an additional day off for your birthday, from your first day of employment.
GREAT LOCAL DISCOUNTS This includes membership discounts with Soho Friends, local restaurants and retailers in Westfield White City and Television Centre.

Publicis Groupe operates a hybrid working pattern with full time employees being office-based three days during the working week.

Show more

In The UK, Alongside The Core Benefits Such As Pension, Life Assurance, Private Medical, And Income Protection Plan, We Also Offer:


  • WORK YOUR WORLD opportunity to work anywhere in the world, where there is a Publicis office, for up to 6 weeks a year.
  • REFLECTION DAYS - Two additional days of paid leave to step away from your usual day-to-day work and create time to focus on your well-being and self-care.
  • HELP@HAND BENEFITS 24/7 helpline to support you on a personal and professional level. Access to remote GPs, mental health support and CBT. Wellbeing content and lifestyle coaching.
  • FAMILY FRIENDLY POLICIES We provide 26 weeks of full pay for the following family milestones: Maternity. Adoption, Surrogacy and Shared Parental Leave.
  • FLEXIBLE WORKING, BANK HOLIDAY SWAP & BIRTHDAY DAY OFF You are entitled to an additional day off for your birthday, from your first day of employment.
  • GREAT LOCAL DISCOUNTS This includes membership discounts with Soho Friends, local restaurants and retailers in Westfield White City and Television Centre.

Publicis Groupe operates a hybrid working pattern with full time employees being office-based three days during the working week.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Madison Berkeley is delighted to be partnered with a leading REIT seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Junior Data Analyst to join their Strategy and Investment Analysis team.




This role is ideal individuals early in their data career with a passion for data and an interest in helping drive strategic decisions through accessible, high-quality data and reporting. You will play a key role in maintaining and improving our existing suite of dashboards and analysis tools, while also contributing to the development of new dashboards and reporting processes to ensure data-driven decision-making across the business.




Key Responsibilities

• Conduct regular weekly and monthly checks to ensure dashboards remain accurate and up to date.

• Perform basic data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities

• Refresh data feeds, ensuring timeliness and consistency in dashboard outputs

• Integrate diverse data sources into a SQL database and automate work processes.

• Maintain and update existing Excel reports, including internal and external KPI reports.

• Validate dashboard results against existing reports to ensure consistency and correctness.

• Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using BI tools while collaborating with stakeholders and applying AI and advanced analytics to enhance decision making.




Key Attributes

• Strong organisational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines.

• Exceptional attention to detail.

• A proactive approach to identifying issues, solving problems, and suggesting improvements.

• Good communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues at all levels.

• A genuine interest in data, analysis, and supporting strategic decision-making.




Essential Skills & Experience

• Experience using Power BI.

• Strong Excel and basic SQL skills

• Some exposure to data quality or validation tasks.

• 0–2 years of experience in a similar analyst or data-focused role.




We are currently experiencing very high demand for this role and will be responding only to applicants whose experience closely aligns with the job requirements.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Bionic:
Bionic is a tech-enabled business switching service. We empower small business owners with a radically better way for them to sort their business essentials through smart technology.    

We're currently looking for a Data Analyst to join us in a fast-paced environment where innovative ideas and projects come to life.  

About the Role:


Do you take satisfaction in seeing your recommendations implemented in the real world? Are you analytically creative and motivated by new challenges? Do you have a passion for working with data to drive insight and improve customer understanding? 

At Bionic, data is core to our business and strategy, and this role is part of a team that is critical to delivering on this goal.   

This role will build on the firm data and reporting architecture to bring insight, clarity and simplicity to what can be a complex business, ultimately making things simple for our customers.  As such you will leverage best in class analytics and data tools. 

You will have access to a wealth of data from a multitude of sources and will be translating analysis into commercially actionable insight and recommendations in a fast-paced environment.  The role will involve working on best practice statistical and analytical techniques to not only discover but also to test and measure impact of key strategic initiatives. 

You will be an important member of the Analytics team, with opportunities to interact cross functionally with Marketing, IT, Digital, Product, Commercial and Finance teams. 

Ultimately, this would be a great role for a Junior Analyst who is looking to take the next step to developing their skills in a fast growing Tech company. 



Day-to-Day:


Be a key member a small team of technical analysts, responsible for delivering business critical analysis and insight 
Be hands on in the coding of Bionic data to deliver analytical solutions to business problems and opportunities 
Be creative in supporting the development of analytical solutions to drive proven business value 
Able to work in a fast-paced environment, having the confidence to voice your thoughts and opinions  
Implementing rigorous testing and measurement: working on testing and measurement across products and functions, implementing methodologies to serve highly iterative and fast paced roadmap. 
Communicate analysis to drive engagement: Share analytical results in a commercial and compelling manner, with ability to visualise insights in a clear and concise format 
Keep up to date with new and emerging technologies: best in class techniques and application to real business problems 
Learn and help share knowledge to grow capability of the team and Bionic: ensure that learnings are shared within the team and the business to drive a data driven culture.  Actively participate in trainings, documentation of learnings and data/analytics sharing sessions


Essential Skills and Experience:


Confident User of SQL and Python 
Experience analysing large and complex datasets - Cloud-based data platforms preferred 
Understanding of statistical and data science techniques (e.g. forecasting, regression, clustering etc) to deliver business projects 
Experience in Data Visualisation (Tableau (preferred), Power BI, Looker) 
Degree level or higher in a numerate subject (e.g. Maths, Statistics, Economics, Operational Research or Computer Science) 
1-2 years' experience in a data analyst or similar role, preferably in a fast-paced commercial or digital environment. 


Who We're Looking For:


A commercially driven analyst for a Data and Analytics team passionate about driving business growth  
Ability to demonstrate an analytical ‘curiosity' through innovative, data driven insights about business questions 
Ability to explore business impact and position analysis to deliver commercial value 
A self-starter that is curious and keen to learn new approaches and techniques as well as demonstrate innovation in approach  
A keen sharer of information with the ability to translate analysis into insight and support delivery of compelling commercial recommendations 
Curious, proactive, ambitious, storyteller, loves solving complex problems and excited to help others and share the success, team player 
Experience working in cross-functional teams (with product, commercial, marketing and IT) is preferrable  
It would be highly desirable if you had experience within one of the following: Digital, B2B, Retail and Customer Data




Interview process 


Initial conversation with one of our Talent Acquisition Team 
1st stage Teams interview with the hiring manager and a colleague from the Data Analytics team 
2nd stage in-person case study-based interview 


About the Bionic Group 


Bionic has over 600 colleagues working across three office locations and four businesses; Bionic - London (HQ), Bionic Outbound - Luton, Think Business Loans - Chelmsford, and Smart -our Field based agents. 

Working at Bionic means provides you many opportunities to advance your career, with incredible progression, recognition, and reward. 

Benefits  

Enhance your health & wellbeing 🌱 

Private healthcare cover 
Employee Assistance Programme, including a virtual GP service, priority physio & talking therapies 
Eyecare scheme 

Taking time away from work 🏖️ 

25 days annual leave plus the 8 UK bank holidays, increasing with tenure 
1 paid family/religious day of leave per year - following successful probation period 
1 paid charity volunteering day per year 
Option to buy/sell up to an additional 3 days leave per year 

Family matters: for the special moments 🏠 

Enhanced maternity, paternity or shared parental leave 
2 days off for your wedding upon joining, and up to 5 days after 2 years' service 
Flexible working options & a hybrid work approach 

Financial wellbeing 💸 

Auto-enrolled salary sacrifice pension scheme  
Life assurance 
Season ticket Loans, salary advances & loans to buy/rent a home - based on tenure 
Cycle to work scheme 

Recognition 🌟 

Highflyers incentive, a VIP experience for our high performers across Bionic group to celebrate success 
Company summer & Christmas party celebrations, business and local zonely & annual awards and recognition  
Long service awards 

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - SQL
Description:
Data Analyst - SQL - MS Stack (Power BI) - Python would be great too - Able to gather requirements - Proactive - Looking for career development - Permanent - Hybrid - £35-43,000 per annum




This role has come about due to career progression and we need a Data Analyst with some solid experience in SQL and the Microsoft stack, including Power BI to join a growing business. The company are in Financial Services but no prior experience in this area is needed, professional services or regulatory environments are preferred but not essential.




You'll be a proactive learner and someone who is keen to develop their skills in a business that have the capability and desire to see you grow too. As well as your ability to provide analytical insights and model data, you will need the ability to talk to the business around data requirements and not just provide reactive reports.




The role is as much about the attitude and desire to build a career in data as it is the technical skill set. You will get hands on with new technology such as MS Fabric and you'll get exposure to Data Science techniques over time, opening up career development opportunities elsewhere as the data team grows further.




The business offer a superb benefits package and hybrid working 2 days per week in the office in Central Birmingham.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Zoopla is one of the UK's most instantly recognisable property brands. In fact, we're known and loved by over 91% of the nation (and we're working hard on the other 9%). Our mission is to help the nation make better home decisions - by connecting everyone to their home and giving them personalised insights to help with moving, managing or financing. Over 50 million people visit Zoopla every month to access exclusive data and information on every UK property, search over 500,000 homes for sale and rent, find the best agents and secure the latest mortgage deals.

We're a growing, dynamic team that embraces innovation and isn't afraid to push the boundaries. We're only just starting our journey to redefine the digital property landscape, with much more to explore and achieve. Join us, and transform the way the nation makes home decisions.

We're a growing, dynamic team that embraces innovation and isn't afraid to push the boundaries. We're only just starting our journey to redefine the digital property landscape, with much more to explore and achieve. Join us, and transform the way the nation makes home decisions.


Position Overview



Every month millions of people visit Zoopla searching over 500,000 homes for sale and rent, finding the best agents and securing the latest mortgage deals looking for help on one of the biggest decisions in life. Where's my next home going to be?

We want to help even more people make better property decisions, and that's why we care so much about data. Whether someone is looking for their next home or an estate agent is looking to list, we need a best-in-class journey for both. Measurement, experimentation, and insights are the keys to unlocking this.


Responsibilities


Taking ownership of the data relationship with business stakeholders
With support from the rest of the Analytics team
Reporting on our baseline performance and trends. Keeping our finger on the pulse.
Driving us towards a self-serve first culture
Reporting on complex experimentation
Close analyst-stakeholder relationships are the most crucial component of a well-functioning data team. Stakeholders should consider you part of their team.
Varied work across other data disciplines, e.g. dashboarding, AE modelling, business unit level deep dives and data sprints, supporting ML projects.
We make time for innovation, so if you have an idea, shout, and we'll make the space.


What does a great candidate look like


Demonstrates curiosity and a proactive approach to learning, constantly seeking opportunities to deepen understanding and explore new ideas
Exhibits a strong desire for ownership and accountability, taking the initiative to drive projects forward and deliver impactful results
Skilled at translating complex business challenges into actionable data insights, driving meaningful outcomes and business impact
Excellent communication skills, able to convey ideas clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
While recognising the value of experience, greater emphasis is placed on finding the right cultural fit and individual capabilities for the role.
Strives to set high standards and continually seeks opportunities for personal and team growth, fostering an environment of continuous improvement
Inspired by the prospect of contributing to industry innovation and eager to participate in reimagining the future landscape


Technical Skills



Essential

Proficient in SQL with a proven track record of handling complex data queries and manipulation
Demonstrable experience with Tableau or similar data visualisation tools, including the ability to create insightful and user-friendly dashboards and reports
Experience with DBT (Data Build Tool) or similar data transformation technologies, with a keen understanding of data modelling and ETL processes

Desirable

A background in statistics and/or programming, with the ability to apply statistical methods and algorithms to extract insights from data
Especially surrounding experimentation
Familiarity with machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, preferably in Python, R, or another programming language, enabling the development and implementation of predictive models and data-driven solutions



Benefits


Everyday Flex - greater flexibility over where and when you work
25 days annual leave + extra days for years of service
Day off for volunteering & Digital detox day
Festive Closure - business closed for period between Christmas and New Year
Cycle to work and electric car schemes
Free Calm App membership
Enhanced Parental leave
Fertility Treatment Financial Support
Group Income Protection and private medical insurance
Gym on-site in London - or membership in regional offices
7.5% pension contribution by the company
Discretionary annual bonus up to 10% of base salary
Show more

  • Everyday Flex - greater flexibility over where and when you work
  • 25 days annual leave + extra days for years of service
  • Day off for volunteering & Digital detox day
  • Festive Closure - business closed for period between Christmas and New Year
  • Cycle to work and electric car schemes
  • Free Calm App membership
  • Enhanced Parental leave
  • Fertility Treatment Financial Support
  • Group Income Protection and private medical insurance
  • Gym on-site in London - or membership in regional offices
  • 7.5% pension contribution by the company
  • Discretionary annual bonus up to 10% of base salary

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Graduate Data Analyst

Salary: £28,000 – £35,000 per annum




Overview

Nexus IT is a specialized recruitment agency connecting top talent with leading IT firms across the UK. We're currently hiring a Graduate Data Analyst on behalf of a forward-thinking technology consulting company.

This full-time role is ideal for recent graduates or aspiring professionals seeking to establish a career in data analysis.

The successful candidate will join a dynamic analytics team and work on meaningful, real-world projects, gaining hands-on experience under the guidance of seasoned data analysts and consultants.




Please note: Onboarding will be conducted in person at our client’s London office.

Key Responsibilities

As a Graduate Data Analyst, your role will involve supporting data-driven initiatives for both internal and external stakeholders. Core responsibilities include:

Assisting with data gathering, research activities, and preliminary analysis
Contributing to the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Creating and updating visual dashboards using Power BI
Writing and optimizing SQL queries for data extraction and analysis
Presenting findings and insights in an accessible manner for both technical and non-technical audiences
Documenting data processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participating in team meetings and collaborative problem-solving sessions
Continuously enhancing technical skills through real-time project exposure and mentorship




Candidate Profile

We are seeking a motivated and analytical individual who is eager to learn and contribute. The ideal candidate will possess:

A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business, or a related field
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel for data manipulation and organization
Basic understanding of SQL, or a strong interest in developing SQL skills
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau (preferred, not required)
Excellent attention to detail and a problem-solving mindset
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey insights clearly
A positive, proactive attitude and a willingness to learn and grow within the role




What You’ll Gain

This opportunity offers a structured pathway into the field of data analytics, with a range of benefits including:

Competitive salary package of £28,000 – £35,000
38-hour work week
Remote working arrangement, with optional hybrid access for London-based candidates
Performance-based bonuses
Reimbursement of professional membership fees
28 days of paid annual leave, in addition to UK public holidays
Enhanced pension scheme
Paid leave entitlements for UK Armed Forces Reservists
Access to a 24/7 Employee Assistance Programme, including GP access, mental health support, and wellness services




Our Hiring Process

We aim to make the hiring journey clear, collaborative, and centered around you. The process includes the following key stages:

Introductory Chat – A casual conversation to understand your interest in the role and share initial insights.
HR Interview – A deeper dive into your experience, career goals, and how well you align with the client’s team culture.
Technical Assessment – A hands-on task designed to assess your data analysis skills and problem-solving abilities.

Throughout each step, we encourage open dialogue—feel free to ask questions to ensure the opportunity aligns with your expectations and goals.




Diversity & Inclusion Statement

Our client is committed to fostering an inclusive and equitable workplace. Applications are welcomed from candidates of all backgrounds, and reasonable adjustments can be made throughout the recruitment process.

The organization actively promotes:

A collaborative and respectful working culture
Mental health awareness and employee wellbeing
Equal access to development and advancement opportunities




Important Note

Applicants must have the legal right to work in the United Kingdom. Unfortunately, our client is unable to sponsor visas for this role at this time.
